original: 'di ni bsgrub bya zhig go zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub bya zhig go zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If you say that the continuum is one, then the consciousness of blue and so on would be one.🔽If you say that the continuum is

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid @183b yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid @183b yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why? means: why is the very same continuum to be established?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that, he says:

original: tha mi dad rgyun skabs mi rigs phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tha mi dad rgyun skabs mi rigs phyir ro // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that there be a continuum without difference.

original: rgyun tha mi dad pa'i go skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun tha mi dad pa'i go skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means: there is no existence of a continuum without difference.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by way of commentary, he says:

original: skabs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: skabs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The occasion, etc.

original: bdag gi dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams so //
translated: The entities of self, which are mutually different, etc. means the moments of the consciousness of blue, etc.

original: rgyun tha mi dad pa'i rten can nyid du yod par mi 'os te zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rgyun gyi rten nyid du gang brtags pa de mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun tha mi dad pa'i rten can nyid du yod par mi 'os te zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa'i rgyun gyi rten nyid du gang brtags pa de mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that there be a basis of a continuum without difference, etc. means: it is not tenable that that which is imagined to be the very basis of a continuum without difference.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: lan ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: lan ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: The answer is: because it is different.

original: rten gyi skad cig ma rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi skad cig ma rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the moments of the basis are different.

original: rgyun bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi chos dag rgyud gcig la brten pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skad cig tha dad pa la brten pa'i rgyun gcig yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ci ltar byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi chos dag rgyud gcig la brten pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skad cig tha dad pa la brten pa'i rgyun gcig yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Like a continuum, etc. Just as the phenomena of Maitreya and Upagupta are not based on the same continuum, in the same way, a single continuum based on different moments does not exist.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;🔽byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ; byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: byams pa'i chos nag po nyid la sogs pa dang / nyer sbas kyi chos rnams rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa'i chos nag po nyid la sogs pa dang / nyer sbas kyi chos rnams rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The phenomena of Maitreya, etc. The phenomena of Maitreya, such as his blackness, etc., and the phenomena of Upagupta are not included in the same continuum.

original: byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi rgyud dag gzhan dag gis phan tshun tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi rgyud dag gzhan dag gis phan tshun tha dad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continua of Maitreya and Upagupta are considered to be mutually different by others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he says, because of their difference.

original: gang dag rang mtshan nyid kyis so so ba zhes bya ba ni gang sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so sor yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag rang mtshan nyid kyis so so ba zhes bya ba ni gang sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so sor yod pa yin gyi /
translated: “Those that are distinct by way of their own characteristics” means that the moments of the consciousness of blue exist distinctly by way of their own characteristics.

original: gzhan du na skad cig ma rnams ngo bo gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma gcig tu 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na skad cig ma rnams ngo bo gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas skad cig ma gcig tu 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the moments would be one entity, and thus they would be one moment.

original: des na tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are different.

original: de yang rgyun gcig gi rten du rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyun gcig gi rten du rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And it is not logical that they are the basis of one continuum.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams la yang ngo //
translated: “In the same way here” means also with respect to the moments of the consciousness of blue.

original: des na nus pa smin pa dang ma smin pa dag gis shes pa skye ba dang mi skye ba dag yin par mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na nus pa smin pa dang ma smin pa dag gis shes pa skye ba dang mi skye ba dag yin par mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that consciousness arises or does not arise due to the ripening or nonripening of the potential.

original: yang sems tsam pa'i 'dod pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang sems tsam pa'i 'dod pa ston pa ni /
translated: Again, the Cittamātra assertion is stated:

original: de skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If it is momentary” and so on.

original: rang gi lugs brjod pa lhur byas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa la mig gi dbang po'i tha snyad byed pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes rang gi lugs brjod pa @184a * //🔽gang yin pa de nyid lhur byas pa gang la yod pa des so //
analyzed: rang gi lugs brjod pa lhur byas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa la mig gi dbang po'i tha snyad byed pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa nyid la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes rang gi lugs brjod pa @184a * // gang yin pa de nyid lhur byas pa gang la yod pa des so //
translated: The phrase by the very fact that one is intent on stating one's own position means that one is intent on the position that the term eye sense faculty is a designation for the potentiality that produces eye consciousness, and that the very form of the consciousness is conceived to be an external object.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang phyi rol gyi don med kyang rnam par shes pa grub par ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po dang phyi rol gyi don med kyang rnam par shes pa grub par ro //
translated: The phrase one's desired aim is accomplished means that consciousness is established even though there is no eye sense faculty and no external object.

original: mig blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don 'di ni sngar bstan du zin kyang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag sngar ma bstan pa dang / rnam pa la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba de dag sngar bstan du zin kyang zhib tu ma bstan pas zlos pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don 'di ni sngar bstan du zin kyang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam gzhag sngar ma bstan pa dang / rnam pa la phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba de dag sngar bstan du zin kyang zhib tu ma bstan pas zlos pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “the eye cognition” and so on is not a repetition of what has already been taught, because the presentation of the eye faculty and so on has not been taught previously, and because although the attachment to external objects in terms of aspects has been taught previously, it has not been taught in detail.

original: rang gi nus pa gang zhig las de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i nus pa de la mig gi blo skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa gang zhig las de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i nus pa de la mig gi blo skye ba yin no //
translated: The eye cognition arises from the potential that is the cause of the arising of the eye cognition immediately after it.

original: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i nus pa'i skad cig ma la mig gi dbang po zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i nus pa'i skad cig ma la mig gi dbang po zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore the moment of the potential that is the basis of the eye cognition existing in the foundation consciousness is understood to be the eye faculty.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa smin pa la mig gi dbang po zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa smin pa la mig gi dbang po zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The potential in the store consciousness that produces eye consciousness is called the eye faculty.

original: bag chags las tha dad du gyur pa'i mig gi dbang po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bag chags las tha dad du gyur pa'i mig gi dbang po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no eye faculty that is separate from the latent impressions.

original: de'i 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: mig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs te /
analyzed: mig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs te /
translated: The eye, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: “By another consciousness” means by another eye consciousness.

original: 'jig bzhin pas na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig bzhin pas na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: “In the process of destruction” means in the present.

original: de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa'i'o //
translated: “In accordance with its form” means in accordance with the form of the eye consciousness.

original: nus pa'i skad cig mar med pa gang zhig las zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid can nus pa'i skad cig ma las so //
analyzed: nus pa'i skad cig mar med pa gang zhig las zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid can nus pa'i skad cig ma las so //
translated: From what non-existent moment of potentiality? From the moment of potentiality characterized by the maturation of the latent impressions existing in the store-consciousness.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa'i skad cig ma de la gti mug gi mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa'i skad cig ma de la gti mug gi mig gi dbang po yin no snyam du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The moment of potentiality that is the cause is understood as the eye faculty of delusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, that which serves as the basis, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan la yang nges par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan la yang nges par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand in the same way for the other faculties means that the ear and other faculties should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi don tha snyad du byed pa na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni phyir rol gyi don tha snyad du byed pa na'o //
translated: Here means externally, when designating objects.

original: phyi gzung ba med par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyi gzung ba med par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med kyang ngo //
translated: Without external grasping means without external objects.

original: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod ba'i bag chags smin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa @184b bon las so //🔽sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du skyes pa yin no snyam du khong du ma chud pas shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen nas sems las
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod ba'i bag chags smin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa @184b bon las so // sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du skyes pa yin no snyam du khong du ma chud pas shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen nas sems las
translated: “From its own seed” means from the seed that has the characteristic of the maturation of the latent impressions that exist in the storehouse consciousness.🔽“Blue, etc.” means that the eye consciousness is produced in the aspect of blue, etc.

original: tha dad du gyur pa'i phyir rol gyi don yod pa yin no zhes mngon par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad du gyur pa'i phyir rol gyi don yod pa yin no zhes mngon par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Not understanding this, they conceive of the aspect of consciousness itself as external objects, and they think that external objects exist separately from the mind.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But external objects do not exist.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “How?” and so on.

original: dmar po'i rnam pa can du skye ba na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dmar po yin pas so //
analyzed: dmar po'i rnam pa can du skye ba na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dmar po yin pas so //
translated: “When it is produced in the aspect of red” means that it is naturally red.

original: nor bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar nor bu chu shes la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi nye bar sgyur ba tshon ras dmar po la sogs pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nor bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar nor bu chu shes la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi nye bar sgyur ba tshon ras dmar po la sogs pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: The passage beginning with “A gem, etc.” means that, just as a gem that knows water, etc., depends on external conditions, such as a red cloth, etc.,

original: de bzhin du ban du ka la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ban du ka la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: but not so a bandhuka flower, etc.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ban du ka la sogs pa rnams kyi gang gi sa bon des ban du ka dmar po bskyed pa'i nus pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ban du ka la sogs pa rnams kyi gang gi sa bon des ban du ka dmar po bskyed pa'i nus pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun las so //
translated: However, etc. means that from the continuum of the sprout, etc., which possesses the capacity projected by the seed of a bandhuka flower to produce a red bandhuka flower,

original: rnam pa khyad par can nyid du skye bar zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu ma yin pa'i dmar po'i rnam pa gzhan la ma ltos par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa khyad par can nyid du skye bar zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu ma yin pa'i dmar po'i rnam pa gzhan la ma ltos par ro //
translated: a different aspect is born, i.e., a different aspect is born without depending on another redness that is not its cause.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can no ;
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba 'byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can no ;
translated: The appearance of blue, etc. arises, i.e., having the aspect of blue, etc.

original: / de'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba nyid do //🔽de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba nyid ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba nyid do // de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “The appearance of blue, etc.” is the appearance in the aspect of blue, etc.🔽In order to illustrate that with an example, he says:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “For example,

original: ngogs mthar skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtsho'i 'gram du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ngogs mthar skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtsho'i 'gram du skyes pa'o //
translated: born on the bank” means born on the shore of a lake.

original: yod pa lta bur dmigs mod kyi //
analyzed: yod pa lta bur dmigs mod kyi //
translated: “Although it is perceived as if it existed”

original: zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na yod pa bzhin du snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na yod pa bzhin du snang ba'o //
translated: means that it appears as if it existed in the water.

original: de'i nang na yod pa ni ma yin na zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa de chu'i nang na yod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang na yod pa ni ma yin na zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa de chu'i nang na yod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “It is not in the water” means that the ruby, etc. is not in the water.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na yod pa'i rin po che'i rnam pa rin po cher snang ba bzhin du shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya🔽ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang na yod pa'i rin po che'i rnam pa rin po cher snang ba bzhin du shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya🔽ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The same should be applied to consciousness” means that just as the aspect of a jewel in the water appears as a jewel, in the same way, the aspect of consciousness itself is imagined to be external.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Thus, external objects do not exist apart from consciousness. This is the summary.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas shes pa'i rnam pa kho na la phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa ston pa yin te /
translated: In another way, etc. shows that the form of consciousness itself is conceived as external in another way.

original: gzugs @185a * //
analyzed: gzugs @185a * //
translated: Form

original: don gzhan med par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med par ro //🔽de'i rnam pa can sems zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi sems 'byung ba yin pas so //
analyzed: don gzhan med par zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med par ro // de'i rnam pa can sems zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi sems 'byung ba yin pas so //
translated: is not a different object.🔽The mind that has its form arises from the maturation of its own potential.

original: rang nus smin las zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi rgyu smin pa las so //
analyzed: rang nus smin las zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi rgyu smin pa las so //
translated: The mind that has the form of blue arises from the maturation of its own cause, which is characterized by potential.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to that,

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “That is not so.”

original: rmi lam gyi dpe'i sgo nas shes pa'i rnam pa la phyi rol du mngon par zhen par 'dod pa de mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dpe'i sgo nas shes pa'i rnam pa la phyi rol du mngon par zhen par 'dod pa de mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: The assertion that the form of consciousness itself is conceived as external in another way is not tenable from the perspective of the example of a dream.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason for that is asked: “Why?”

original: de la lan ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is stated: “How?” and so on.

original: mig med pas ni zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na mig gi bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: mig med pas ni zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na mig gi bya ba med pas so //
translated: “Because there is no eye” means because there is no activity of the eye in a dream.

original: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba ste /
translated: “In a dream” and so on means that blue and so on appear.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that appears in the aspect of blue and so on arises.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na long ba la sngon po la sogs bar snang ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na long ba la sngon po la sogs bar snang ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Here” means that in the state of being awake, why would the mental consciousness to which blue and so on appear not arise for the blind?

original: ci'i phyir mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi skye ba'o //
translated: Why would it not arise?

original: gang las skye zhe na /
analyzed: gang las skye zhe na /
translated: From what would it arise?

original: rang gi sa bon no //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon no //
translated: From its own seed.

original: smin las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: smin las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “From the ripening” is stated.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i bag chags las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is from the latent propensities that exist in the foundation consciousness.

original: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun par skye na zhes bya ba ni ci ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ches gsal bar sngon po la sogs pa snang bar skye ba de bzhin du gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa ches
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun par skye na zhes bya ba ni ci ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ches gsal bar sngon po la sogs pa snang bar skye ba de bzhin du gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa ches
translated: If, etc.🔽If it arises in accordance with the aspect of the eye consciousness, then just as the eye consciousness arises with a very clear appearance of blue, etc.,

original: gsal bar sngon po'i rnam par skye na'o //
analyzed: gsal bar sngon po'i rnam par skye na'o //
translated: if the mental consciousness arises with a very clear appearance of blue, etc.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ro //🔽'di'i don gal te ci ltar rmi lam gyi dpe don med kyang don gyi rnam pa can gyi sems skye ba can du sgrub na de bzhin du rmi lam gyi dpes long ba la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun par yid kyi rnam
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ro // 'di'i don gal te ci ltar rmi lam gyi dpe don med kyang don gyi rnam pa can gyi sems skye ba can du sgrub na de bzhin du rmi lam gyi dpes long ba la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun par yid kyi rnam
translated: Like that means like the eye consciousness.

original: par shes pa ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: par shes pa ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If you prove that the dream example is meaningless, but the mental consciousness arises with the aspect of an object, then in the same way, why wouldn’t the blind person’s mental consciousness arise in accordance with the eye consciousness due to the dream example?

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnams so //
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnams so //
translated: “By what?” refers to the mental consciousness that is in conformity with the eye consciousness.

original: gnyis kar yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dag go //
analyzed: gnyis kar yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dag go //
translated: “In both cases” refers to the dream state and the waking state.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: “If” and so on introduces the opponent’s doubt.

original: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mig gi @185b rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni mig gi @185b rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: “In that way” refers to the mental consciousness that is in conformity with the eye consciousness.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni nus pa smin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni nus pa smin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the ripening of the potential.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga la ltos nas drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis rmi lam na nus pa smin pa yod la /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga la ltos nas drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnyid kyi rkyen gyi stobs kyis rmi lam na nus pa smin pa yod la /
translated: In dependence on the five sense consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness, the sixth mental consciousness, by the power of the condition of sleep, has the ripening of the potential in dreams.

original: 'di na ci ltar sad pa la rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di na ci ltar sad pa la rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, it is said, “Just as when one is awake, there is no such mental consciousness.”

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sad pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sad pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “Just as” means just like when one is awake.

original: de la gzhan dag na re nus pa smin pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ni gnyid yin la /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re nus pa smin pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ni gnyid yin la /
translated: In that regard, others say that the ripening of potential is the cooperating condition of sleep.

original: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na de med pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na de med pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when one is awake, since that does not exist, there is no such mental consciousness.

original: rmi lam na ni rkyen yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni rkyen yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But in a dream, since the condition of mental consciousness exists, there is such mental consciousness.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, it is said:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as when one is awake, there is no such mental consciousness.”

original: ci ltar long ba 'di la gnyid log pa'i skyes bu bzhin du mig gi bya ba med du zin kyang mig med pa de ni de'i rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags smin pa'i rkyen ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar long ba 'di la gnyid log pa'i skyes bu bzhin du mig gi bya ba med du zin kyang mig med pa de ni de'i rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bag chags smin pa'i rkyen ma yin la /
translated: Just as in the case of a blind person, even though the eye faculty is not present, the absence of eyes is not a condition for the ripening of the latent potentials for the arising of a mental consciousness that has that form.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam na gnyid yod du zin kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par bgyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam na gnyid yod du zin kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par bgyis /
translated: In the same way, even though sleep is present in dreams, it is not a condition for the ripening of the latent potentials for the arising of a mental consciousness that is similar to the aspect of an eye consciousness.

original: 'di'i don ni gnyis ka la yang mig med par mtshungs su zin kyang gcig la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam @186a * //🔽par shes pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gnyis ka la yang mig med par mtshungs su zin kyang gcig la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam @186a * // par shes pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The meaning of this is that even though both are similar in the absence of eyes, in one case a mental consciousness that is similar to the aspect of an eye consciousness arises,🔽but in the other it does not.

original: gcig la ni mi 'gyur bas mig med pa ni rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gcig la ni mi 'gyur bas mig med pa ni rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the absence of eyes is not the cause.

original: de bzhin du gnyid yod sad du zin kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur na gnyid kyi rgyu can ma yin no zhes nges par gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid yod sad du zin kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur na gnyid kyi rgyu can ma yin no zhes nges par gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, even when one is awake, if a mental consciousness with such an aspect were to arise, it would not be caused by sleep.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: rmi lam mthong bas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rmi lam mthong bas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “When one sees a dream,” and so on.

original: rmi lam mthong bas ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong bas ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: “When one sees a dream” is the subject.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi long ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gnyid sad pa'i long ba la mig gi bya ba med pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste dpe de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi long ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gnyid sad pa'i long ba la mig gi bya ba med pas rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste dpe de bzhin du'o //
translated: “Like a blind man in the waking state,” just as a blind man in the waking state does not have eye consciousness, so too, a mental consciousness with such an aspect does not arise.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i rten dbang po'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i rten mig gi dbang po yin la de'i bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i rten dbang po'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i rten mig gi dbang po yin la de'i bya ba med pa ste /
translated: “Because the activity of the sense faculty that is the basis of that consciousness is absent,” the eye sense faculty is the basis of eye consciousness, and its activity is absent.

original: mig gi dbang po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is: because the eye faculty does not function.

original: rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi dbang po med pas nus pa'i ming can gyi mig gi dbang po gang yin pa de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa ste mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi dbang po med pas nus pa'i ming can gyi mig gi dbang po gang yin pa de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa ste mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya
translated: The eye consciousness, etc. means that the consciousness that is based on the eye faculty, which is called the eye faculty because it is capable of seeing external objects, is called the eye consciousness.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that conforms to its aspect is the mental consciousness that is similar to the eye consciousness.

original: de'i nus pa ni rgyur gyur pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i nus pa ni rgyur gyur pa'i bag chags so //
translated: Its potential is the latent impressions that are its cause.

original: de smin pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de smin pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Its maturation is its tendency to produce a result.

original: de yongs su 'gyur ba ni de las skyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de yongs su 'gyur ba ni de las skyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Its transformation is the mental consciousness that arises from that.

original: de gang la yod pa de la can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la can zhes bya ste /
translated: That which possesses that is called the possessor.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ste bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ste bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and it is not that the mental consciousness is endowed with the eye consciousness.

original: des na ci ltar long ba la mig med pa yin du zin kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur mig med pa de mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam na yang gnyid yod du zin kyang rnam par shes pa de lta🔽bu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na ci ltar long ba la mig med pa yin du zin kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyur mig med pa de mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam na yang gnyid yod du zin kyang rnam par shes pa de lta bu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the blind person does not have an eye that is a cause of a mental consciousness of that kind, even though he is blind, in the same way, even though one is asleep, sleep is not the cause of a consciousness of that kind in a dream.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyid rnam par shes pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnyid rnam par shes pa de lta bu'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is said that “because of that” means because sleep is not the cause of a mental consciousness of that kind.

original: rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: “Even in a dream” means even in the state of dreaming.

original: de dngos zhes bya ba ni gang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na @186b gzugs mthong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dngos zhes bya ba ni gang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na @186b gzugs mthong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the cause of seeing form in the dream state.

original: mig ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mig ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the eye like?

original: brdzun pa'i spyod yul rtogs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i spyod yul rtogs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “the cause of the realization of a false object.”

original: sad pa la ltos nas brdzun pa'i spyod yul gzugs gang yin pa de rtogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa la ltos nas brdzun pa'i spyod yul gzugs gang yin pa de rtogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of the realization of that form which is a false object in dependence on the waking state.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Therefore, the eye in a dream is like that.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul dang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul dang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du nyams su myong ba'i yul lo //
translated: “An object of that kind” is an object experienced in a dream.

original: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa de lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “A consciousness of that kind” is a consciousness experienced in a dream.

original: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa de khas blang bar bya dgos kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa de khas blang bar bya dgos kyi /
translated: “That kind” is that which is the basis of the eye consciousness in a dream.

original: gzhan du na long ba la mig gi rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na long ba la mig gi rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, why wouldn’t a blind person generate eye consciousness?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na gsum char khas blang bar bya dgos pa de'i phyir ro zhes ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rmi lam na gsum char khas blang bar bya dgos pa de'i phyir ro zhes ba'o //
translated: “Therefore” means that because all three must be accepted in a dream, therefore.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma la sems tsam du smra bas lan gang dang gang btab pa de'i lan de dang de sems tsam du smra ba 'di'i dam bca' dang mtshungs par mthong bas sems tsam du smra ba 'di sel bar byed pa
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma la sems tsam du smra bas lan gang dang gang btab pa de'i lan de dang de sems tsam du smra ba 'di'i dam bca' dang mtshungs par mthong bas sems tsam du smra ba 'di sel bar byed pa
translated: “This” and so on means that the response that the Proponents of Mind Only give to the Madhyamikas is seen to be the same as their thesis, and therefore this Proponents of Mind Only are refuted.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says

original: sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “When awake” and so on.

original: 'di ni dbu ma pa'i thal 'gyur yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma pa'i thal 'gyur yin te /
translated: This is a consequence for the Madhyamikas.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na gsum char ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na gsum char ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
translated: In the state of being awake, all three are empty of inherent nature,

original: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are objects of observation.

original: rmi lam bzhin no zhes dbu ma pa'i brjod pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin no zhes dbu ma pa'i brjod pa la /
translated: The Madhyamikas reply, “It is like a dream.”

original: sems tsam pa na re sad pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pa don gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: sems tsam pa na re sad pa'i dus kyi rnam par shes pa don gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: The Cittamātra say, “The consciousness of the waking state is empty of objects,

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs su dmigs pa'i yul ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs su dmigs pa'i yul ni brdzun pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: because it is consciousness, like a consciousness in a dream, and likewise, the observed objects in the waking state are false by nature,🔽because they are objects, like objects in a dream.”

original: yul yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi yul bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag chos can gzhan gyi dbang med na yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: yul yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi yul bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag chos can gzhan gyi dbang med na yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Likewise, “afflicted and purified phenomena do not exist without the other-dependent nature,” is the thesis.

original: rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: “Because it has no basis” is the reason.

original: rus sbal gyis bu'i gos bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: rus sbal gyis bu'i gos bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: “Like a tortoise with fur” is the example.

original: de bzhin du rab rib can gyi dpe dag gis kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don gyis stong pa yin te /🔽rnam par shes @187a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab rib can gyi dpe dag gis kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don gyis stong pa yin te / rnam par shes @187a * //
translated: The consciousness of one who is awake is empty of objects,

original: pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is consciousness.

original: rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi shes pa bzhin //
translated: Like the consciousness of one with cataracts.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa don gyis stong par bsgrub pa'i ched du sems tsam du smra bas lan gang dang gang brjod pa'i lan de dang de dbu ma pas dam bca' ba dang mtshungs par mthong nas rtsod pa 'di zlog par byed pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa don gyis stong par bsgrub pa'i ched du sems tsam du smra bas lan gang dang gang brjod pa'i lan de dang de dbu ma pas dam bca' ba dang mtshungs par mthong nas rtsod pa 'di zlog par byed pa
translated: In order to prove that consciousness is empty of objects, the Proponents of Mind Only offer various responses. Seeing that all of these responses are equivalent to the thesis of the Followers of the Middle Way, the latter will not engage in debate with the former.

original: yin te / 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa la don gyis stong pa nyid dang / brdzun pa'i yul can du ma grub pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: yin te / 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa la don gyis stong pa nyid dang / brdzun pa'i yul can du ma grub pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The reason for this is that the Proponents of Mind Only have already been shown, through the above explanations, to have established that the consciousness of a dream is empty of objects, that it is not a consciousness that possesses a false object, and that it is dependent

original: rus sbal gyi spu'i gos kyang btags pa'i dngos por yod pas med par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sngar /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu'i gos kyang btags pa'i dngos por yod pas med par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa yang sngar /
translated: And the consciousness of one with eye disease, etc. was previously stated:

original: de blo la ltos gnyis kar bden pa ste //
analyzed: de blo la ltos gnyis kar bden pa ste //
translated: “Both are true in dependence on the mind.”

original: zhes gsungs pas thams cad la yul med par ma grub pas lan thams cad dam bca' ba dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas thams cad la yul med par ma grub pas lan thams cad dam bca' ba dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, since all are not established as objectless, all answers are exactly the same as the thesis.

original: de bzhin du lung gis gnod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lung gis gnod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the fault of being contradicted by scripture, etc. is also not possible. The phrase “etc.” includes the contradiction by inference.

original: lung gi gnod pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gi gnod pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of contradiction by scripture, he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽srid pa gsum ni btags pa tsam //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // srid pa gsum ni btags pa tsam //
translated: “Because . . .” and so on.🔽The three worlds are mere designations.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa thams cad tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa thams cad tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: The three realms are all mere conventions.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po med //
translated: They are essentially unreal.

original: ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This shows that an existent entity does not exist by way of its intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid la 'jig pa med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la 'jig pa med //
translated: There is no destruction of intrinsic reality.

original: ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This shows that an existent entity does not exist by way of its intrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no destruction of intrinsic reality.

original: btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni re zhig dngos po ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni re zhig dngos po ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The words “imputed” and so on show that an entity does not exist at all,

original: 'on kyang btags pa de nyid la rtog ge ba ngan pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du phyin ci log tu rtogs nas dngos po'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang btags pa de nyid la rtog ge ba ngan pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du phyin ci log tu rtogs nas dngos po'i rang bzhin du rtog par byed do //
translated: but that very imputation is wrongly understood by bad logicians as the intrinsic reality of entities, and so they imagine it to be the intrinsic reality of entities.

original: rang bzhin med cing zhes bya ba ni dngos po la ci 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing zhes bya ba ni dngos po la ci 'gog pa'o //
translated: “Without intrinsic reality” is the negation of an entity.

original: rnam rig med ces bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par shes pa la 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rig med ces bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par shes pa la 'gog pa'o //
translated: “Without consciousness” is the negation of consciousness characterized by the relative.

original: kun gzhi med cing zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'o //🔽dngos med na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi med cing zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gog pa'o //🔽dngos med na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Without foundation consciousness” is the negation of foundation consciousness.🔽“Without non-entity” is the negation of the non-entity of the imagined.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can nyid du btags pa 'gog pa'o //🔽byis pa ngan pa rtog ge ba //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can nyid du btags pa 'gog pa'o // byis pa ngan pa rtog ge ba //
translated: The refutation of the imagined nature is the refutation of the imputational nature, which is the imputational factor that is the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin phyin ci log tu rtog par byed pa'i byis pa rnams kyi dngos @187b po la sogs pa 'di dag btags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin phyin ci log tu rtog par byed pa'i byis pa rnams kyi dngos @187b po la sogs pa 'di dag btags pa'o //
translated: The words “the childish, the logicians” refer to the childish who impute these entities and so forth, since they conceive the nature of entities to be erroneous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is because of that that the text says “like a mirage.”

original: snying po med par spyod pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po med par spyod pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are empty of the enjoyment of an essence.

original: gal te srid pa gsum ni btags pa tsam //
analyzed: gal te srid pa gsum ni btags pa tsam //
translated: If the three existences are mere imputations,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po med //
translated: they are not entities that exist by way of their own natures.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dngos po bkag pa de ni gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po bkag pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dngos po bkag pa de ni gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po bkag pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir lung dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the refutation of entities such as these contradicts scripture, that is not so, because the refutation of entities that are the apprehended and apprehender in the dependent is intended in the statement, “The three existences are mere imputations.🔽They are not entities that exist by way of their own natures.”

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, the text says, “The nonexistence of one in the other” and so forth.

original: gcig la ste gzhan dbang la gcig med pa ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la ste gzhan dbang la gcig med pa ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-existence of the one, i.e., the non-existence of the entity characterized by the apprehended object and apprehending subject in the relative.

original: de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid du gal te brjod na de yang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid du gal te brjod na de yang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: If it is said that the non-existence of the entity that is empty of those is emptiness, that is also unreasonable.

original: de la lung gi sgo nas mi rigs pa nyid du ston pa ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lung gi sgo nas mi rigs pa nyid du ston pa ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To show the unreasonableness from the perspective of scripture, he says, “Mahamati...

original: thams cad kyi tha shal yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi nang na dman pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha shal yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi nang na dman pa ste /
translated: the worst of all...” means the lowest of all.

original: des 'khor ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa rnams ldog par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des 'khor ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa rnams ldog par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the conceptualization of entity and non-entity that is the seed of cyclic existence does not cease.

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid rigs pa dang 'gal bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid rigs pa dang 'gal bar ston pa ni /
translated: To show the contradiction with reasoning of the emptiness of one thing in another,

original: ba lang rta ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ba lang rta ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because a cow is not a horse...” and so on.

original: ci ltar ba lang rta ma yin no zhes brjod pa na ba lang rta ma yin pa nyid du 'grub kyi /
analyzed: ci ltar ba lang rta ma yin no zhes brjod pa na ba lang rta ma yin pa nyid du 'grub kyi /
translated: When it is said, “A cow is not a horse,” a cow is established as not being a horse.

original: ba lang rta ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang rta ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But a cow is not not a horse,

original: ba lang gi ngo bo nyid du ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi ngo bo nyid du ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as the intrinsic reality of a cow.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bkag pas gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pas dngos po med pa nyid du ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bkag pas gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid du yod pas dngos po med pa nyid du ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, when the apprehended and apprehender are refuted in the dependent, it should be said that “things are not established as nonexistent because they exist as the intrinsic reality of the dependent.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gal te rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin 'grub par 'gyur na de'i tshe gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gal te rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin 'grub par 'gyur na de'i tshe gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams la rang bzhin med pa nyid rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that if the intrinsic reality of consciousness were established, then it would be reasonable that things lack intrinsic reality because of being empty of mutual absence.

original: 'on kyang bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: But it is not tenable that things are empty of intrinsic reality because of being empty of intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa ma yin pas gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid du de ci ltar brjod par bya zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang yod pa ma yin pas gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid du de ci ltar brjod par bya zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the nature of things is refuted by such statements, since the dependent is not existent, how can it be said that emptiness, the non-existence of one in the other, exists?

original: yang lung gi sgo nas mi rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang lung gi sgo nas mi rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate irrationality by means of scriptural authority, he says:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de la zhes bya ba ni stong @188a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de la zhes bya ba ni stong @188a * //
translated: Likewise, etc.

original: pa nyid ston pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: pa nyid ston pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: Therein means in the context of teaching emptiness.

original: dbang po la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The statement, “one enters the dharmadhatu by means of the faculties” means that one realizes all things as empty by way of realizing the faculties as empty.

original: de la dbang po rnams la 'jug pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbang po rnams la 'jug pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, the entry into the faculties, he says:

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The faculties are twenty-two, etc.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis te //
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis te //
translated: The faculties are twenty-two.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: mig gi dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: The eye faculty, etc. is the extensive teaching.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa gzugs kyi rdul phra rab dang ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lngar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa gzugs kyi rdul phra rab dang ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa lngar shes par bya'o //
translated: The clear form atom which is the basis of the five beginning with the eye consciousness should be known as the five beginning with the eye faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa drug 'gags pa'i de ma thag pa 'das pa'i skad cig ma ni yid kyi dbang po yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug 'gags pa'i de ma thag pa 'das pa'i skad cig ma ni yid kyi dbang po yin no //
translated: The immediately preceding cessation of the six consciousnesses is the mind faculty.

original: mdoms kyi phyogs kyi dbang po'i cha gang yin pa de ni mo'i dbang po dang pho'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mdoms kyi phyogs kyi dbang po'i cha gang yin pa de ni mo'i dbang po dang pho'i dbang po'o //
translated: That part of the faculty in the region of the sexual parts is the female faculty and the male faculty.

original: gang drod dang rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i rgyu de ni srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang drod dang rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i rgyu de ni srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: That which is the cause of the abiding of heat and consciousness is the life faculty.

original: rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the sensation associated with the five consciousnesses that are favorable to retention, and the sensation associated with the mental consciousness in the third meditation.

original: gnod par byed pa rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pain is the sensation associated with the five consciousnesses that are unfavorable to retention.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams dang // bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba yid kyi bde ba'i dbang po yin te gzhan na yid bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams dang // bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba yid kyi bde ba'i dbang po yin te gzhan na yid bde ba'i dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure is the sensation associated with the mental consciousness that is favorable to the third meditation and to the realm of desire and the first and second meditations, because there is no faculty of pleasure elsewhere.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rjes su mi mthun pa'i tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rjes su mi mthun pa'i tshor ba ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mental suffering is the sensation associated with the mental consciousness that is unfavorable to the third meditation.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant and that is associated with the five sense consciousnesses and the mental consciousness.

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu dag la yid ches pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu dag la yid ches pa ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is the conviction in the truths, the jewels, action and its result.

original: dge ba'i las la spro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las la spro ba ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of vigor is the enthusiasm for wholesome action.

original: dmigs pa mi brjod pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi brjod pa ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the object of meditation.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa @188b ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa @188b ni shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the discernment of dharmas.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi yid dang yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms te dbang po bzhi dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi yid dang yid bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms te dbang po bzhi dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the four faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness and concentration, and the faculty of wisdom on the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi mi shes pa kun shes pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dbang po dgu po de rnams bsgom pa'i lam du ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi mi shes pa kun shes pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dbang po dgu po de rnams bsgom pa'i lam du ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: Since the path of seeing enters into the complete knowledge of all that is not known, those nine faculties are the faculty of complete knowledge on the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam na sngar med pa'i shes par bya ba med pas de nyid phra rgyas lhag ma rnams spang ba'i ched du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam na sngar med pa'i shes par bya ba med pas de nyid phra rgyas lhag ma rnams spang ba'i ched du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is nothing to be known on the path of meditation that was not previously known, it is the faculty of complete knowledge because it is the knowledge that abandons remaining negative tendencies.

original: dbang po dgu po de rnams mi slob pa'i lam la shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dgu po de rnams mi slob pa'i lam la shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: Those nine faculties are the faculty possessing complete knowledge on the path of no learning.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i tshe ngas sdug bsngal shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i tshe ngas sdug bsngal shes so //
translated: When the knowledge of elimination and nonarising is obtained, one comprehends I have known suffering.

original: yang shes par byar med do zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang shes par byar med do zhes khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is nothing more to be known.

original: 'di ni dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the nature of the faculties.

original: dbang po'i ming gi don ni mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi rang rang gi don dmigs pa la dbang byed pas dbang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i ming gi don ni mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi rang rang gi don dmigs pa la dbang byed pas dbang po nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of the term faculty indriya is that the five such as the eye are faculties because they control adhipati their own objects.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pas na tshor ba rnams dbang po nyid yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed pas na tshor ba rnams dbang po nyid yin te /
translated: Feeling is a faculty since it dominates the afflictions.🔽Thus a sutra states:

original: 'di ltar mdo las tshor ba bde ba la ni chags pa skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las tshor ba bde ba la ni chags pa skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Desire arises for feelings of pleasure.🔽Aversion arises for feelings of pain.

original: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni khong khro dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Ignorance arises for feelings that are neither pleasure nor pain.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga po rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po nyid yin te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga po rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po nyid yin te /
translated: The five such as faith are faculties since they dominate purification.

original: 'di ltar de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon cing lam skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon cing lam skyed par byed pas so //
translated: Thus they suppress the afflictions and generate the path.

original: gong ma gong ma thob pa la dbang byed pas na mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa gsum po rnams dbang po yin te /
analyzed: gong ma gong ma thob pa la dbang byed pas na mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa gsum po rnams dbang po yin te /
translated: The three such as the faculty producing complete knowledge are faculties since they dominate the attainment of higher and higher states.

original: 'di ltar mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po thob pa la dbang byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po thob pa la dbang byed la /
translated: Thus the faculty producing complete knowledge dominates the attainment of the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thob pa la dbang byed pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la dbang byed pas so ;
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thob pa la dbang byed pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la dbang byed pas so ;
translated: The faculty of understanding all has the faculty of possession of understanding as its object. The faculty of possession of understanding has the attainment of nirvana as its object.

original: / rgyas par mdzod du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / rgyas par mdzod du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail in the Abhidharma Kosha.

original: dus gsum du yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye pa med pas so //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye pa med pas so //
translated: It is not perceived in the three times means that it does not arise, as stated in the lines beginning “Not from itself” and so on.

original: de ni mig ma lags so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: de ni mig ma lags so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: It is not the eye means that it has no intrinsic nature.

original: dbang po ma lags so zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don med pas @189a * //
analyzed: dbang po ma lags so zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don med pas @189a * //
translated: It is not a faculty means that it does not have the function of a faculty.

original: so ; / de'i tha snyad ci ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni mig dang dbang po nyid kyi tha snyad do //🔽chang pa stong pa ni zhes bya ba ni chang pa'i nang stong pa'o //
analyzed: so ; / de'i tha snyad ci ltar 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni mig dang dbang po nyid kyi tha snyad do // chang pa stong pa ni zhes bya ba ni chang pa'i nang stong pa'o //
translated: How should one understand its convention? means the convention of eye and faculty.🔽An empty pot means the empty interior of a pot.

original: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pas so //
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pas so //
translated: False means that it is empty inside.

original: ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni sor mo la sogs pa'i bkod pa yang med pas so //
analyzed: ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni sor mo la sogs pa'i bkod pa yang med pas so //
translated: “Non-existent” means that even the arrangement of fingers, etc. does not exist.

original: ma mchis pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma mchis pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it non-existent?

original: yang dag pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Unreal,”

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of non-production by the reasoning of “not from self,” etc.

original: ming du gdags par bas kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming du gdags par bas kyi zhes bya ba ni don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is only a nominal designation” means that it is empty of object.

original: stong pa yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni chang pa'i stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: stong pa yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni chang pa'i stong pa nyid kyang mi dmigs pas so //
translated: “Emptiness is also not apprehended” means that even the emptiness of the pot is not apprehended.

original: chang pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sor mo la sogs pa'i bkod pa'ang mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: chang pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sor mo la sogs pa'i bkod pa'ang mi dmigs pas so //
translated: “The pot is also not apprehended” means that even the arrangement of fingers, etc. is not apprehended.

original: don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to apply the meaning, he says, “Just so,” etc.

original: chang pa stong pa ltar zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chang pa stong pa ltar zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: “Just like the emptiness of the pot” is the brief teaching.

original: brdzun zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: “False,” etc. is the extensive teaching.

original: 'dir 'og ma 'og mas gong ma gong ma bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'og ma 'og mas gong ma gong ma bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, the lower should be explained by the higher.

original: byis pa 'drid pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams slu bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byis pa 'drid pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams slu bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase deceptive to the childish means that they deceive the childish.

original: phyin ci log la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase to sentient beings who are situated in error means that they are situated in error with regard to I and mine.

original: gzung ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa'i ched du ste stong pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa'i ched du ste stong pa nyid la'o //
translated: The phrase for the sake of apprehending means for the sake of introducing them to emptiness.

original: gzhan du na dang po kho nar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan na skrag par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na dang po kho nar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bstan na skrag par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, if they were taught that all phenomena are empty from the very beginning, they would be frightened.

original: don dam par ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase but not ultimately is easy to understand.

original: don dam par ma lags pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par ma lags pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not ultimate?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: dbang po ni rang bzhin dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po ni rang bzhin dang bral zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The faculties are devoid of intrinsic nature, etc.

original: dbang po ni rang bzhin dang bral zhing dbang po nyid kyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni spyir dgag pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni rang bzhin dang bral zhing dbang po nyid kyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni spyir dgag pa'o //
translated: The faculties are devoid of intrinsic nature and empty of the very nature of faculties. This is a general negation.

original: de la mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bye brag tu 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bye brag tu 'gegs pa'o //
translated: As for the eyes, etc., this is a specific negation.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam yin pas rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
