analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam yin pas rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: Since this is merely a thesis, the reason is asked for: Why is it so?

original: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: mig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the eyes, etc. are stated.

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig gi rang bzhin bkag pas so //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig gi rang bzhin bkag pas so //
translated: Since the intrinsic nature of the eyes, etc. is negated by “not from self,” etc.

original: de la sngar mig gi dbang po dus gsum yang ma dmigs so zhes gang bstan pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sngar mig gi dbang po dus gsum yang ma dmigs so zhes gang bstan pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to clarify what was previously taught, “The eye faculty is not apprehended in the three times,”

original: chos gang @189b la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gang @189b la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is stated: “Any dharma,” etc.

original: 'dir yang 'og ma 'og ma gong ma gong ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'og ma 'og ma gong ma gong ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the latter should be understood as the explanation of the former.

original: rmi lam na yang des de dag ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang des de dag ma rnyed na zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba med par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are not found even in dreams, then, as it has been said, “not from self,” and so on, proving that there is no arising.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “ Dependent origination, and so on,” and so on refers to the absorptions, the immeasurables, the formless states, and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: “ Those” refers to the aggregates, the constituents, the sources, and so on.

original: des na gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gcig la gcig med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they are not empty of emptiness through mutual absence,

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas so //
translated: but rather they are empty through intrinsic reality.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the conclusion, he says, “Therefore, the Teacher,” and so on.

original: sems tsam du smra ba'i khyad par ni ston pa'i gsung rab ma dpyad pa dag gis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems tsam du smra ba'i khyad par ni ston pa'i gsung rab ma dpyad pa dag gis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The distinction of the proponents of mind only is stated with “through the statements of the Teacher, without analysis.”

original: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab gang bstan pa de'i dgongs pa ni bzhed pa yin la /
analyzed: ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab gang bstan pa de'i dgongs pa ni bzhed pa yin la /
translated: The intention of the teachings of the Master, the Bhagavat Buddha, is the meaning.

original: de gang gis ma dpyad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gang gis ma dpyad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is called “unanalyzed.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi rtsal med par sbyar ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi rtsal med par sbyar ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “Without the power of wisdom.”

original: yang sems tsam du smra bas yul med pa'i shes pa sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: yang sems tsam du smra bas yul med pa'i shes pa sgrub pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the Cittamātra proponents’ proof of consciousness without objects is as follows.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, in response to that, it is said, “If you say . . .”

original: 'o na gang bla ma'i man ngag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sa gzhi keng rus kyis yongs su gang bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'dod chags la spyod pa'i skyes bu la bla mas mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i gdams ngag phog pa de'i
analyzed: 'o na gang bla ma'i man ngag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis sa gzhi keng rus kyis yongs su gang bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'dod chags la spyod pa'i skyes bu la bla mas mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i gdams ngag phog pa de'i
translated: “Well then, when yogis see the ground filled with skeletons through the guru’s instructions” means that when a person who engages in desire meditates on the instructions of the guru on the meditation on foulness, at first he sees the ground filled with skeletons.

original: tshe rnal 'byor ba de mi sdug pa bsgom pa na rgya mtsho la thug pa'i bar du sa gzhi keng rus kyis yongs su gang bar mthong gi keng rus de ni de na yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshe rnal 'byor ba de mi sdug pa bsgom pa na rgya mtsho la thug pa'i bar du sa gzhi keng rus kyis yongs su gang bar mthong gi keng rus de ni de na yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When that yogi meditates on the ugly, he sees the entire ground surface up to the ocean filled with skeletons, but those skeletons do not exist there.

original: 'on kyang keng rus kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni skye ba'i phyir yul med pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang keng rus kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni skye ba'i phyir yul med pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa yin no zhe na'o //
translated: However, since the consciousness that has skeletons as its object does arise, it is established that consciousness arises without an object.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To teach the reply to that,

original: bshad pa rnal 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: bshad pa rnal 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: he says, “The yogi,” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: ting nge 'dzin de ni log pa yid la byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni log pa yid la byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Because that samādhi is taught to be a mistaken mental attention” means that here samādhi is of two types:

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can dang / de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can dang / de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: that which has the reality of mental attention and that which has the unreality of mental attention.

original: de la stong pa nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid bsgom pa la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: In this regard, the cultivation of emptiness, etc. is of the nature of mental attention to reality,

original: @190a * // dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du bsgom pas so //
analyzed: @190a * // dngos po ci lta ba bzhin du bsgom pas so //
translated: because one cultivates things as they are.

original: mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: The cultivation of the unlovely, etc. is of the nature of mental attention to what is not reality,

original: dngos po la keng rus la sogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: dngos po la keng rus la sogs pa med pas so //
translated: because skeletons, etc. do not exist in things.

original: des ni yul med pas shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des ni yul med pas shes pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since there is no object, consciousness also does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa nyid do //
translated: This is what must be accepted without doubt. This is mental attention to what is not reality.

original: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid yid la byed par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid yid la byed par ma gyur na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e. if it were not mental attention to reality,

original: khyod kyi dbang blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyod kyi dbang blo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then your sense consciousnesses, etc.

original: ci ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems tsam pa khyod kyis yod par 'dod pa de bzhin du mi sdug pa bsgom pa la yang keng rus yid kyi yul ma yin par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems tsam pa khyod kyis yod par 'dod pa de bzhin du mi sdug pa bsgom pa la yang keng rus yid kyi yul ma yin par 'gyur na'o //
translated: Just as you Cittamātra assert that the aspects of form, etc. exist for eye consciousness, etc., in the same way, even in the meditation on foulness, a skeleton would not be an object of the mind.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “In the same way” means like the meditation on foulness.

original: yul der blo gtad ces bya ba ni keng rus la sogs pa'i yul la yid gtad pa la'o //
analyzed: yul der blo gtad ces bya ba ni keng rus la sogs pa'i yul la yid gtad pa la'o //
translated: “Directing the mind to that object” means directing the mind to the object of a skeleton, etc.

original: cig shos kyi zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom par mi byed pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: cig shos kyi zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom par mi byed pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: “The other” means those who do not meditate on foulness.

original: rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni keng rus rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni keng rus rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One would understand” means one would understand a skeleton.

original: de ni brdzun par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni brdzun par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: “That would not be false” means that samādhi would not be a mental activity that is not reality.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as,” etc.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni keng rus kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //🔽sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zlos gar gyi ltad mo la sogs pa la lta ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thun mong du skye ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa rnams
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni keng rus kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o // sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zlos gar gyi ltad mo la sogs pa la lta ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa thun mong du skye ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa rnams
translated: The statement “a consciousness having that aspect arises” means a consciousness having the aspect of a skeleton.

original: la yang keng rus kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: la yang keng rus kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: “Like a consciousness of blue, etc.” means that just as when one sees a spectacle, etc., a consciousness of blue, etc., arises in common, so also for those who are not yogis, a consciousness having the aspect of a skeleton arises.

original: ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis keng rus kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pas so ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis keng rus kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pas so ;
translated: “That samādhi would not be a non-attention to reality” means that it is a conception of a skeleton for everyone.

original: / de bzhin du gzhan la yul med pa'i blo yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de bzhin du gzhan la yul med pa'i blo yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in the same way, there is no cognition without an object, he says,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In the same way,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du chu 'bab pa'i klung la yi dags rnams rnag gi blo 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rab rib can la skra shad snang ba dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu 'bab pa'i klung la yi dags rnams rnag gi blo 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rab rib can la skra shad snang ba dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the pretas’ perception of a river as pus should be understood as similar to the appearance of falling hair to one with eye disease.

original: @190b rab rib can dang mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: @190b rab rib can dang mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the similarity to one with eye disease.🔽The verse states:

original: rab rib mthu las skra shad gang mthong ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: rab rib mthu las skra shad gang mthong ba // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The hair that is seen due to the power of eye disease🔽.

original: dbang po rab rib bcas pa'i blo gang gis //
analyzed: dbang po rab rib bcas pa'i blo gang gis //
translated: The word “etc.” in the phrase “the hair that is seen due to the power of eye disease” includes the following verse from the above text:🔽The cognition of one with diseased vision

original: rab rib mthu las skra rnams gang mthong ba //
analyzed: rab rib mthu las skra rnams gang mthong ba //
translated: sees hair due to the power of eye disease.

original: de blo la ltos gnyis kar bden pa ste ;🔽/ zhes bya ba sngar bzhin gsungs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽de lta bu'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi blo'i rigs can no //
analyzed: de blo la ltos gnyis kar bden pa ste ; / zhes bya ba sngar bzhin gsungs pa bsdu bar bya'o // de lta bu'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni rab rib can gyi blo'i rigs can no //
translated: Both are true in dependence on that cognition.🔽The phrase “of a similar type” means of the type of the cognition of one with eye disease.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yi dags kyis rnag gi blo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yi dags kyis rnag gi blo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the pretas’ perception of pus, and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa thams cad la yul med pas gsum char yang ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa thams cad la yul med pas gsum char yang ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that since there is no object for all mistaken consciousnesses, the three are also unproduced.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pas nges pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gsum char yang bden pa yin la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pas nges pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gsum char yang bden pa yin la /
translated: From the perspective of the ascertainment by a mistaken consciousness, the three are real.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa la ltos nas ni gsum char yang bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa la ltos nas ni gsum char yang bden pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of a nonmistaken consciousness, the three are not real.

original: spros pas chog go zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa dang de 'gegs par byed pa'i spros pas chog go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spros pas chog go zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa dang de 'gegs par byed pa'i spros pas chog go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Enough with the elaboration means that it is enough with the elaboration that establishes the existence of a consciousness without an object and that refutes it.

original: don mdor bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don mdor bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning in brief,

original: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says in brief, etc.

original: mdor na ci ltar shes bya med pa de bzhin du de la dmigs pa'i blo yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na ci ltar shes bya med pa de bzhin du de la dmigs pa'i blo yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: In brief, understand the meaning that just as the object of knowledge does not exist, so also the mind that observes it does not exist.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that with an example, he says

original: shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning “The cognition of the cognized” presents the argument.

original: shes bya'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang zhes bya ba ni shes bya rnams 'di lta bu yin no zhes dpyod pas na shes bya rnam pa can gyi blo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa can gyi blo yang zhes bya ba ni shes bya rnams 'di lta bu yin no zhes dpyod pas na shes bya rnam pa can gyi blo zhes bya'o //
translated: The cognition of the cognized is the cognition that analyzes the cognized, thinking, “The cognized is like this.”

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis ma skyes par zhes bya ba ni shes bya rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir shes bya yang ma skyes pas so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis ma skyes par zhes bya ba ni shes bya rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir shes bya yang ma skyes pas so //
translated: “Not arisen by way of its own essence” means that the cognized is not arisen because the cognized lacks intrinsic existence.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa las te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa las te /
translated: “As it is said” and so forth refers to a praise composed by master Nāgārjuna:

original: ma shes pa ni shes bya min //
analyzed: ma shes pa ni shes bya min //
translated: The noncognized is not cognized.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang shes pas yul du ma byas pa de shes par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang shes pas yul du ma byas pa de shes par bya ba ma yin /
translated: The noncognized is not cognized means that that which is not taken as an object by cognition is not cognized.

original: des na shes pa la ltos nas shes par bya bar 'gyur ro ;🔽/ de med rnam par shes med pa //
analyzed: des na shes pa la ltos nas shes par bya bar 'gyur ro ; / de med rnam par shes med pa //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on cognition, the cognized comes to be.🔽Without it, there is no consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes bya med na shes pa yod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes bya med na shes pa yod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Without the cognized, consciousness does not exist.

original: des na shes bya la ltos nas shes pa yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na shes bya la ltos nas shes pa yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the object of knowledge, consciousness exists.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin pas ring po dang thung ngu dag bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag kyang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes @191a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun ltos pa yin pas ring po dang thung ngu dag bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya dag kyang rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes @191a * //
translated: Thus, since they are mutually dependent, like long and short, consciousness and the object of knowledge do not intrinsically exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyed kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyed kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what the Lord has said.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the same way, etc.

original: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i rigs las 'khrungs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyi ma'i gnyen yin la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i rigs las 'khrungs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyi ma'i gnyen yin la /
translated: The Lord of the Sun is the Buddha, the Transcendent Lord, because he was born in the solar race.

original: khyed kyis kyang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa don dam par ma grub pas rnam par shes pa sgyu ma dang 'dra bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis kyang bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa don dam par ma grub pas rnam par shes pa sgyu ma dang 'dra bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: You have also said that consciousness is not ultimately established, in such passages as “not from itself,” and so forth, and so you have said that consciousness is like an illusion.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i yul yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du nges par sgyu ma'i dngos po dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i yul yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du nges par sgyu ma'i dngos po dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The object of the consciousness of that consciousness is like an illusion, just like the consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa ni shes pas dmigs par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa ni shes pas dmigs par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: Because the object is that which is observed by consciousness.

original: des na dmigs pa ni shes pa la ltos pas rang bzhin gyis ma grub pas sgyu ma'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'o //🔽da ni sems tsam pa la co 'dri ba'i sgo nas mjug bsdu ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa ni shes pa la ltos pas rang bzhin gyis ma grub pas sgyu ma'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'o // da ni sems tsam pa la co 'dri ba'i sgo nas mjug bsdu ba ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since the object is dependent on consciousness, it is not established by its intrinsic nature, and so it is like an illusory thing.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, to show the conclusion by way of ridiculing the Cittamātra, he says, “Therefore . . .” and so forth.

original: phyi rol gyi yul la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: “Denigrating external objects” means

original: phyi rol gyi yul med par rnam par shes pa tsam khas len pas so //🔽rnam par shes pa rdzas su smra ba'i brjed byed kyi gdon gyis bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes gang smra ba de ni brjed byed kyi gdon yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med par rnam par shes pa tsam khas len pas so // rnam par shes pa rdzas su smra ba'i brjed byed kyi gdon gyis bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes gang smra ba de ni brjed byed kyi gdon yin te /
translated: accepting mere consciousness without external objects.

original: rigs pa'i dran pa nyams par byed pas so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i dran pa nyams par byed pas so //
translated: “Seized by the demon of the forgettery of substantial consciousness” means that one who says that consciousness exists ultimately is a demon of the forgettery because it causes the memory of reasoning to deteriorate.

original: des gzung ba ni de'i dbang du gyur pas so //
analyzed: des gzung ba ni de'i dbang du gyur pas so //
translated: “Its object” is that which is under its power.

original: de lta bu'i sems tsam du smra ba de ni dam pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa rnams kyis ci ltar dngos po zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi g-yang sar mi lhung ba de ltar shin tu dam par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems tsam du smra ba de ni dam pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa rnams kyis ci ltar dngos po zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi g-yang sar mi lhung ba de ltar shin tu dam par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Such a proponent of Mind Only should be held very tightly by those who have the compassion of the holy, so that he does not fall into the abyss of the characteristics of attachment to entities.

original: ci ltar gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he be held?

original: lung dang rigs pa'i gsang sngags bzang po btab pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa'i gsang sngags bzang po btab pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He should be held by the application of the good mantra of scripture and reasoning.

original: lung dang rigs pa nyid sngags bzang po yin la de btab pas so //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa nyid sngags bzang po yin la de btab pas so //
translated: The good mantra is just scripture and reasoning, and by its application.

original: 'di'i don ni ci ltar brjed byed kyi gdon gyis gzung ba la sngags btab pas zhi ba'i sgo nas g-yang sar lhung ba las 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ci ltar brjed byed kyi gdon gyis gzung ba la sngags btab pas zhi ba'i sgo nas g-yang sar lhung ba las 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as one who is seized by the demon of epilepsy is held back from falling into an abyss by means of a mantra for pacifying,

original: de bzhin du sems tsam du smra ba 'di yang lung dang rigs pa'i gsang sngags bzang po btab pas dam du gzung bar bya ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam du smra ba 'di yang lung dang rigs pa'i gsang sngags bzang po btab pas dam du gzung bar bya ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, this proponent of Mind Only should be held tightly by the application of the good mantra of scripture and reasoning.

original: da ni gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid gang bstan pa de yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid gang bstan pa de yang dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the existence of the dependent nature that has been taught,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: gnyis kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @191b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @191b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gis stong pa'o //
translated: “Because it is empty of duality” means that it is empty of the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'di ni yod par gang gis shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni yod par gang gis shes par 'gyur //
translated: “How is this known to exist?”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang 'di yod par shes par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang 'di yod par shes par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: means “How is this dependent nature known to exist?”

original: gal te shes pas ma shes kyang grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pas ma shes kyang grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is established even though it is not known by consciousness,

original: lan ni ma bzung bar yod ces byar mi rung zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni ma bzung bar yod ces byar mi rung zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he replies, “It is not tenable to say that it exists without being apprehended.”

original: gang gis kyang ma shes pa de yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma shes pa de yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar 'grub /
translated: How can it be established that it exists if it is not known by anyone?

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If, etc.”

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang la gang gis bya ba byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang la gang gis bya ba byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of that,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “It is just like . . .”

original: de ni shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang 'di ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin pa nyid du yang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang 'di ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin pa nyid du yang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not apprehended by another cognition either means that it is not reasonable for this dependent nature to be apprehended by another consciousness.🔽Because it contradicts our own tenets.

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: This is explained in the passage beginning with “If . . .”

original: / gal te shes pa gzhan gyi shes pa gzhan yul du byed na yul gyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gal te shes pa gzhan gyi shes pa gzhan yul du byed na yul gyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i rang gi grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If one cognition makes another cognition its object, then the tenet that we maintain, namely, that cognition only is empty of objects, would be undermined.

original: shes pa gcig la shes pa gzhan yul nyid du yod pas so //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la shes pa gzhan yul nyid du yod pas so //
translated: This is because one cognition would exist as the object of another cognition.

original: ji ltar shes pa'i yul shes pa gzhan yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yin par 'gyur bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i yul shes pa gzhan yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yang yin par 'gyur bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Just as the object of consciousness is a different consciousness, so too external objects would be. Therefore, this contradicts your tenets.

original: de la shes pa la 'dzin pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de la shes pa la 'dzin pa yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni /
translated: Here, the proof of the existence of the apprehender in consciousness is as follows.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, “Here, it is said . . .”

original: gal te yang shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa gzhan 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa gzhan 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though it is not the case that one consciousness apprehends another consciousness,

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig pa yin pas gzhan dbang grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis rang rig pa yin pas gzhan dbang grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: nevertheless, since consciousness is reflexive awareness by nature, the dependent nature is established.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, the root text states, “That too . . .”

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa kho nas 'dzin pa nyid do //🔽de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa kho nas 'dzin pa nyid do // de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi ngo bos so //
translated: “That too” refers to the apprehension that is reflexive awareness alone.🔽“By that alone” refers to the nature of the dependent.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to the dependent.

original: ma grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rang rig ni rang gi ngo bo rang nyams su myong ba la /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rang rig ni rang gi ngo bo rang nyams su myong ba la /
translated: “It is not established” means that because reflexive awareness is the experience of one’s own nature,

original: de yang gcig nyid la byed pa dang bya ba mi 'thad pas rigs pa ma yin no //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gcig nyid la byed pa dang bya ba mi 'thad pas rigs pa ma yin no // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is not tenable that it is a single thing that is both the agent and the action. Therefore it is illogical.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la gzhan @192a * //🔽dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la gzhan @192a * // dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “For that reason . . .” and so on.

original: 'dir kha cig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that regard, in order to demonstrate the opponent’s position, he says, “In this regard, some say . . .” and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni me'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni me'i bdag nyid do //
translated: “With respect to itself” means with respect to the nature of fire.

original: 'od 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni me'i 'od zer rnams 'jug pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'od 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni me'i 'od zer rnams 'jug pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: “Because of the engagement of light” means because of the engagement of the light rays of fire.

original: sgras kyang zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i sgra skyes pa nyid na bum pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar byed pa dang / bum pa'i don la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar byed pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sgras kyang zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i sgra skyes pa nyid na bum pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar byed pa dang / bum pa'i don la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar byed pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: “Sound also” means just as the sound of a pot, when it arises, causes the consciousness that observes the sound of a pot to arise and causes the consciousness that observes the object, the pot, to arise, so too . . .

original: de ltar dpe bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the example,

original: don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the meaning,

original: rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Consciousness, too,” and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: “ Itself” means the nature of consciousness.

original: gal te rang rig mi 'dod na me yang rang gis bdag nyid gsal ba nyid ci'i phyir 'dod /
analyzed: gal te rang rig mi 'dod na me yang rang gis bdag nyid gsal ba nyid ci'i phyir 'dod /
translated: If you do not accept reflexive awareness, why do you accept that fire illuminates itself?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: “ Therefore,” and so on, concludes the argument.

original: de ltar dpe'i sgo nas rang rig grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe'i sgo nas rang rig grub par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the establishment of reflexive awareness through the example,

original: dran pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu'i rtags kyi sgo nas rang rig bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu'i rtags kyi sgo nas rang rig bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to establish reflexive awareness through the evidence of the effect, which is the defining characteristic of memory,

original: gang zhig mi 'dod pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig mi 'dod pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Even those who do not accept reflexive awareness,” and so on.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rang rig khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rang rig khas mi len na'o //
translated: “ Otherwise,” means if one does not accept reflexive awareness.

original: mthong ngo zhes dus phyis 'byung ba'i dran pas yul dran pa nyid du mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes dus phyis 'byung ba'i dran pas yul dran pa nyid du mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin la /
translated: “ Memory that occurs later, ‘I saw it,’ would not be a memory of the object,” is the point he is making.

original: de'i bshad pa ni ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The explanation of that is “I see” and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni mthong ngo zhes mthong bas khyad par du byas pa'i yul dran pa yin la /🔽dran pa yang nyams su myong ba dran pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni mthong ngo zhes mthong bas khyad par du byas pa'i yul dran pa yin la / dran pa yang nyams su myong ba dran pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is that “I see” is the memory of the object qualified by the seeing.

original: nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And memory is the memory of experience, but it is not the experience.

original: des na mthong ba la yang nyams su myong bas grub pas rang rig grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na mthong ba la yang nyams su myong bas grub pas rang rig grub pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since seeing is established by experience, reflexive awareness is established.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for that,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Why is that?” and so on is said.

original: dbu ma pa'i lugs ltar na /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i lugs ltar na /
translated: According to the Madhyamaka system,

original: shes pa la sgrub byed med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa la sgrub byed med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that consciousness is not established,

original: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Because there is no reflexive awareness” and so on is said.

original: 'dir shes pa nyams su myong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'dir shes pa nyams su myong bar 'dod na /
translated: Here, if you assert that consciousness is experienced,

original: shes pa rang gis sam 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis /
analyzed: shes pa rang gis sam 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis /
translated: is it by the consciousness itself or by another consciousness?

original: de la re zhig rang rig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang rig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by reflexive awareness,

original: khyod kyi phyogs la rang rig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs la rang rig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in your system there is no reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas sun 'byin pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa @192b gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bas sun 'byin pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa @192b gsungs so //
translated: The refutation by the experience of another consciousness is stated by “If it is experienced by another consciousness . . .”

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason,

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “If it is experienced by another consciousness . . .”

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma dang po gzhan gyis nyams su myong na de yang gzhan gyi yin pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa'i skad cig ma dang po gzhan gyis nyams su myong na de yang gzhan gyi yin pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consequence of an infinite regress is stated by “There would be an infinite regress.” If the first moment of the consciousness of blue is experienced by another, then that would be experienced by another, and so on ad infinitum.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “It is like this . . .”

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod nas skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong pa la thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod nas skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.

original: shes pa yul gzhan zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽thal bar 'gyur ro zhes tshig snga ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa yul gzhan zhes bya ba gsungs te / thal bar 'gyur ro zhes tshig snga ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The fault would be that blue would be apprehended by another consciousness.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.

original: sngon po la ltos pa'i yul gzhan ser po la sogs pa yongs su mi gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽de'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rnam par shes pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sngon po'i shes pa skad cig ma dang po'i yul sngon po nyid yin pa la /
analyzed: sngon po la ltos pa'i yul gzhan ser po la sogs pa yongs su mi gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'o // de'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rnam par shes pa'i rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sngon po'i shes pa skad cig ma dang po'i yul sngon po nyid yin pa la /
translated: The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.

original: shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan rnams kyi yul ni shes pa snga ma snga ma yin pas so //
analyzed: shes pa'i skad cig ma gzhan rnams kyi yul ni shes pa snga ma snga ma yin pas so //
translated: The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.

original: gal te shes pa gnyis cig car skye zhing de la shes pa gcig gis yul gzhan yongs su gcod par byed la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa gnyis cig car skye zhing de la shes pa gcig gis yul gzhan yongs su gcod par byed la /
translated: The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.🔽The fault would be that blue would not be apprehended.

original: gnyis pas shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pas shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The second consciousness determines the object.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain the answer to that,

original: sems can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that “because the mindstreams of sentient beings are one.”

original: gang gi phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir cig car shes pa gnyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir cig car shes pa gnyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because the mindstreams of sentient beings are one, two consciousnesses do not arise simultaneously.

original: gal te gar mkhan gyi khang pa la sogs par zhugs pa'i tshe shes pa cig car du skye ba mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te gar mkhan gyi khang pa la sogs par zhugs pa'i tshe shes pa cig car du skye ba mthong ba yin te /
translated: When entering a house of dancers and so on, it is seen that consciousness arises simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar der zhugs pa'i de ma thag tu gar mkhan gyi gdong la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / ga pur la sogs pa'i dri la dmigs pa'i sna'i rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar der zhugs pa'i de ma thag tu gar mkhan gyi gdong la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i sgra la dmigs pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / ga pur la sogs pa'i dri la dmigs pa'i sna'i rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: In that way, immediately after entering there, eye consciousness observing the face of the dancer, ear consciousness observing the sound of the flute and so on, nose consciousness observing the smell of camphor and so on,

original: so rtsi la sogs pa'i ro myong ba'i dmigs pa lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / gos la sogs pa la reg pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ci ltar cig car du shes pa mi skye zhe na /🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so rtsi la sogs pa'i ro myong ba'i dmigs pa lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / gos la sogs pa la reg pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ci ltar cig car du shes pa mi skye zhe na / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the object of experience of the tongue consciousness is the taste of tooth cleaner, etc., and the object of experience of the body consciousness is the touch of clothes, etc., why don't the consciousnesses arise simultaneously?

original: rnam @193a * //
analyzed: rnam @193a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that,🔽he says,

original: par shes pa autpala'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rnam par shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba rnams cig car du 'jug pa lta bur mngon pa yin no zhes tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: par shes pa autpala'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rnam par shes pa rim gyis 'byung ba rnams cig car du 'jug pa lta bur mngon pa yin no zhes tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The consciousnesses arise in sequence, but appear as if they were simultaneous, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽He says,

original: 'jug pa myur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jug pa myur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: because of the rapidity of their engagement.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa rnams myur du 'jug pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa rnams myur du 'jug pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousnesses engage rapidly, that is why.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?🔽He says,

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: like the piercing of a hundred lotus petals.

original: ci ltar khab kyis autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa ltar de la khab kyis rim gyis 'bigs su zin kyang cig car 'bigs pa bzhin du 'dir yang shes pa rnams cig car du 'jug pa lta bur mngon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ltar khab kyis autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa ltar de la khab kyis rim gyis 'bigs su zin kyang cig car 'bigs pa bzhin du 'dir yang shes pa rnams cig car du 'jug pa lta bur mngon pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as a needle pierces a hundred petals of an utpala flower, so too, although the needle pierces them in sequence, it appears as if it pierces them all at once.

original: shes pa rnams cig car du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa rnams cig car du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, although the consciousnesses engage in sequence, it appears as if they engage all at once.

original: des na shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that they are experienced by another consciousness.

original: nyams su myong ba nyid kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid kyang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that they are experienced.

original: dran pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: dran pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it would follow that there would be no memory of them.

original: des na rang rig khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rang rig khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that autocognition must be accepted,

original: de'i phyir thug pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thug pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, there is an infinite regress of experience,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa cig car du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa cig car du mi 'jug pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because the consciousnesses do not engage all at once.

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni rang rig khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni rang rig khas blangs nas so //
translated: “In that case” means if you accept autocognition.

original: gnyis ka'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya dag gi'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya dag gi'o //
translated: The phrase “the subject of both” refers to the cognition and the object of cognition.

original: gnyis ka'i yul can gyi dran pa'i rnam pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yul can gyi dran pa'i rnam pa ston pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the recollection of the subject of both” refers to the recollection of the cognition and the object of cognition.

original: ngas mthong ngo snyam du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngas mthong ngo snyam du zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “I saw” refers to the recollection that arises later.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this point in greater detail, the root text states,

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The cognition that has the nature of a recollection of the object of a prior cognition.”

original: de'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi'o //
translated: The phrase “the subject of that” refers to the subject that has the nature of a cognition.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;🔽de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir ; de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to summarize this point, the root text states,🔽“Therefore, it is ascertained that the prior cognition of the object was produced.”

original: ngas mthong ngo snyam du dus phyis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba las nyams su myong ba'i shes pa skyes so zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ngas mthong ngo snyam du dus phyis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba las nyams su myong ba'i shes pa skyes so zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “I saw” refers to the recollection that arises later. From this, it is ascertained that the prior cognition of the object was produced.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yang ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yang ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the cognition that experiences?

original: rang gi bdag nyid dang yul gyi bdag nyid myong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid dang yul gyi bdag nyid myong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, “The experience of itself and the object.”

original: rang dang gzhan nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the nature of experiencing itself and others.

original: khyad par gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is another distinction?

original: gang la dus phyis gnyis ka'i yul can gyi dran pa skye ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la dus phyis gnyis ka'i yul can gyi dran pa skye ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “that from which later a memory arises that has the nature of both.”

original: rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang las rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi @193b yul can gyi dran pa skye ba gang yin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang las rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi @193b yul can gyi dran pa skye ba gang yin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is that consciousness that experiences itself and others, from which later arises a memory that has the nature of both, that is, that has the nature of remembering both itself and others.🔽If there is experience of itself,

original: rang nyams su myong ba yod na zhes bya ba ni rang rig yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: rang nyams su myong ba yod na zhes bya ba ni rang rig yod par gyur na'o //
translated: then there is the dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rang rig gi sgo nas gzhan dbang grub pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rang rig gi sgo nas gzhan dbang grub pas so //
translated: If there is experience of itself, then there is reflexive awareness. If there is reflexive awareness, then there is the dependent nature.🔽This is what is being taught.🔽This is what is being taught: the realization that the dependent exists is reflexive awareness.

original: 'di nye bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gis yod par rtogs pa de rang rig yin no zhes bstan pa yin no de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nye bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gis yod par rtogs pa de rang rig yin no zhes bstan pa yin no de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the reply to that, it is said:

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That is also not reasonable.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang rig gis gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang rig gis gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is also not reasonable means that it is not reasonable that the dependent exists by way of autocognition.

original: mi rigs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is not reasonable,

original: de nyid kyis de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It is not established by that itself,” and so on.

original: rang rig gis gzhan dbang yod par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig gis gzhan dbang yod par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not established by autocognition that the dependent exists.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate the qualms of others,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If you think that it is established by memory,” and so on.

original: gal te phyis byung ba'i dran pas rang gi grub pa yin no snyam du sems na ;
analyzed: gal te phyis byung ba'i dran pas rang gi grub pa yin no snyam du sems na ;
translated: If you think that it is established by memory that occurs later,

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the response to that,

original: ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It is not established,” and so on.

original: de la re zhig rang las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas rang rig dang dran pa dag ma grub pas rang rig bsgrub pa'i don du ma grub pa'i dran pa sgrub byed du 'god pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig rang las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pas rang rig dang dran pa dag ma grub pas rang rig bsgrub pa'i don du ma grub pa'i dran pa sgrub byed du 'god pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: In this regard, first, it is not reasonable to posit nonestablished memory as the proof of self-awareness in order to establish self-awareness by means of reasoning such as “it is not from itself” and so on, since self-awareness and memory are not established.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yang rang rig la bya ba byed pa 'gal bas rang rig ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i rang gi rgyu mtshan can du dran pa yang ma grub pas dran pas rang rig 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i🔽tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yang rang rig la bya ba byed pa 'gal bas rang rig ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i rang gi rgyu mtshan can du dran pa yang ma grub pas dran pas rang rig 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since self-awareness is also incompatible with functional performance even in terms of worldly convention, self-awareness is not established. Since memory also is not established as having a reason that is not established, it is not the case that memory establishes self-awareness. This is the meaning.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In that regard, if it is said . . .” and so on.

original: rdzas sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni rdzas su gyur pa don dam pa'i rang rig sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas sam /
analyzed: rdzas sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni rdzas su gyur pa don dam pa'i rang rig sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas sam /
translated: “In terms of establishing a substance” means in terms of establishing a substantial ultimate self-awareness.

original: 'on te rdzas su gyur pa don dam pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te rdzas su gyur pa don dam pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, is it that very ultimate memory that becomes a substance that is established?

original: de skad du smra na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi dus dran pa las 'grub na zhes brjod na'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi dus dran pa las 'grub na zhes brjod na'o //
translated: If one says “thus,” it means if one says “it is established from memory at a later time.”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rdzas sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rdzas sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: “At that time” means in the context of the position that establishes a substance.

original: dran pa mi srid pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: dran pa mi srid pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: “Because memory is impossible” is just an illustration.

original: rang rig pa nyid kyang mi srid pas so //🔽de nyid kyi phyir ma grub pa'i dran pas ma grub pa'i rang rig @194a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid kyang mi srid pas so // de nyid kyi phyir ma grub pa'i dran pas ma grub pa'i rang rig @194a * //
translated: Because reflexive awareness itself is also impossible.

original: sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “Unestablished memory establishes unestablished reflexive awareness.”

original: 'on te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas su sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas su sgrub par byed pa'i phyogs khas mi len na'o //
translated: “Or, if it is from the perspective of worldly convention,” means if one does not accept the position that establishes a substance.

original: de ltar na yang rang rig pa'i rgyu can gyi dran pa mi srid do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du byas nas yang rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rang rig pa'i rgyu can gyi dran pa mi srid do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du byas nas yang rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, it is said that memory that has reflexive awareness as its cause is impossible, but this is from the perspective of worldly convention.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni /
translated: The reason for that is asked:

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de la lan ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so // de la lan ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is stated:🔽If, like fire, etc.

original: me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar me de dang me de'i rgyu can gyi du ba mngon sum gyis grub pa de bzhin du gal te rang rig pa grub par gyur na de'i tshe de'i rgyu can gyi dran pa 'grub par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang
analyzed: me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ci ltar me de dang me de'i rgyu can gyi du ba mngon sum gyis grub pa de bzhin du gal te rang rig pa grub par gyur na de'i tshe de'i rgyu can gyi dran pa 'grub par 'gyur ba las 'on kyang
translated: If, like fire, the memory that has reflexive awareness as its cause were established by direct perception, then the memory that has it as its cause would be established.

original: rang rig pa nyid ma grub pas de'i rgyu can gyi dran pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig ci ltar rjes su dpog par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ma grub pas de'i rgyu can gyi dran pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig ci ltar rjes su dpog par byed ces pa'o //
translated: But since reflexive awareness itself is not established, the memory that has it as its cause is also not established. Therefore, how could reflexive awareness be inferred on the basis of memory?

original: de ma nges pa nyid du dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma nges pa nyid du dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by way of example,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “It is like this…”

original: de dag med par yang zhes bya ba ni nor bu chu shel dang nor bu me shel dag go //
analyzed: de dag med par yang zhes bya ba ni nor bu chu shel dang nor bu me shel dag go //
translated: “Even though they do not exist” refers to the water crystal and the fire crystal.

original: char pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gangs zhu ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: char pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gangs zhu ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Rain, etc.” The word “etc.” includes melted snow, etc.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni lcags kyi gong bu brdungs pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni lcags kyi gong bu brdungs pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “The rubbing of sticks, etc.” The word “etc.” includes the striking of iron balls, etc.

original: de ltar ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: “It is like this” refers to the passage beginning with “Because of that…”

original: gang gis yul myong 'gyur de las //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gis yul myong 'gyur de las // zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “That by which one experiences an object…”

original: de med par med pas zhes bya ba ni rang rig med par de'i rgyu can dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de med par med pas zhes bya ba ni rang rig med par de'i rgyu can dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: “Because it does not exist without it” means that without autocognition, memory, which has it as its cause, does not exist.

original: mig gi gzung bya nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi gzung bya nyid bzhin no //
translated: “Like the object of the eye.”

original: zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sgra la mig gi gzung bya nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du dran pa yang rang rig gi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pas rang rig sgrub byed du ci ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci ltar sgra la mig gi gzung bya nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du dran pa yang rang rig gi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pas rang rig sgrub byed du ci ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This is saying that just as sound is not established as being the object of the eye, in the same way, memory is not established as the effect of autocognition, so how can it be the proof of autocognition?

original: da ni rang rig khas blangs kyang dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang rig khas blangs kyang dran pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to prove that even if one accepts autocognition, memory does not exist,

original: ci ste de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “But if you say that . . .” and so forth.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyod pa btang nas kyang //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyod pa btang nas kyang //
translated: “Having given up such analysis”

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dor nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dor nas kyang ngo //
translated: means having abandoned reasoning.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig khas blangs su zin kyang dran pa mi rigs te de'i rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig khas blangs su zin kyang dran pa mi rigs te de'i rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
translated: “In that case” means that even though one accepts autocognition, memory is not tenable. The reason for that is presented:

original: gzhan phyir ma shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te shes pa'i rgyud yin pas na shes @194b pa'i rgyud de byams pa'i shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan phyir ma shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te shes pa'i rgyud yin pas na shes @194b pa'i rgyud de byams pa'i shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Because it is other, it is not known . . .” and so forth. The continuum of consciousness is called the continuum of consciousness; the meaning of “the continuum of consciousness of Maitreya” is that.

original: ma shes pa'i rgyud ni shes pa'i rgyud ma yin pa ste nyer sbas kyi rgyud yin la /
analyzed: ma shes pa'i rgyud ni shes pa'i rgyud ma yin pa ste nyer sbas kyi rgyud yin la /
translated: The continuum of the one who does not know is not the continuum of the one who knows, but rather the continuum of Upagupta.

original: de las skyes pa de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa de bzhin du ste /
translated: The memory that arises from that is like that.

original: ci ltar byams pa'i shes pa'i rang rig pa de nyer sbas kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i dran pa ma dran pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ci ltar byams pa'i shes pa'i rang rig pa de nyer sbas kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i dran pa ma dran pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the memory that arises in the continuum of Upagupta of the self-awareness of Maitreya’s consciousness is not the memory of Maitreya’s consciousness,

original: dran pa po'i dran pa mi rigs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa po'i dran pa mi rigs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is it illogical for the memory of the experiencer to be the memory of the experiencer?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gzhan phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is different.

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las dran pa'i shes pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las dran pa'i shes pa gzhan yin te /
translated: The memory consciousness is different from the consciousness that experiences.

original: ji ltar nyer sbas kyi dran pas byams pa'i shes pa mi dran pa de bzhin du dran pas kyang nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dran pa ma yin te /🔽gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyer sbas kyi dran pas byams pa'i shes pa mi dran pa de bzhin du dran pas kyang nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dran pa ma yin te /🔽gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as Upagupta’s memory does not remember Maitreya’s consciousness, in the same way, memory is not the memory of the consciousness that experiences because it is different.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dang / dran pa'i shes pa dag rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dang / dran pa'i shes pa dag rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang yin la /
translated: If the consciousness that experiences and the consciousness that remembers are in the same continuum and are also cause and effect,

original: byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi shes pa dag ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan yin pa tsam gyi sgo nas dran pa med par ci ltar sgrub ce na /
analyzed: byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi shes pa dag ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan yin pa tsam gyi sgo nas dran pa med par ci ltar sgrub ce na /
translated: then how can you prove that they are not remembered, simply on the grounds that the consciousnesses of Maitreya and Upagupta are different, since they are not in the same continuum and are not cause and effect?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: gtan tshigs 'dis ni khyad par dag kyang 'joms //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis ni khyad par dag kyang 'joms // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This reason also refutes distinctions.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par dag 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par dag 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: This reason, “because they are different,” also refutes the distinctions that are characterized by being in the same continuum and being cause and effect.

original: 'di'i don ni ji ltar byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi shes pa dag gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan yin pa de nyid yod pas rgyud gcig tu
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ji ltar byams pa dang nyer sbas kyi shes pa dag gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhan yin pa de nyid yod pas rgyud gcig tu
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as the consciousnesses of Maitreya and Upagupta are different from each other, but belong to the same continuum and are not causally related, in the same way, here too, they are different from each other, but because they exist in the same continuum, they are causally related.🔽

original: gtogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gtogs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as the consciousnesses of Maitreya and Upagupta, even though they are different, belong to the same continuum and are not causally related, in the same way, here, since they are different, how could they belong to the same continuum and be causally related?

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain this, the root text says,

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Even if they are different, they are related as object and object-possessor.”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na rang rig mi rigs pas rang rig khas blangs pa tsam du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na rang rig mi rigs pas rang rig khas blangs pa tsam du ston pa'o //
translated: “In that case” means that since it is not tenable for reflexive awareness to exist when analyzed, it is shown that the assertion of reflexive awareness is merely an assertion.

original: de dag dran pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang rig dang yul la'o //
analyzed: de dag dran pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang rig dang yul la'o //
translated: “Their memory” refers to the memory of reflexive awareness and its object.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the reason for that, the root text says,

original: dran pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The memory is ‘I saw it,’ not ‘I saw it with reflexive awareness.’”

original: sngar nyams su ma myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyer sbas kyi shes pas byams pa'i shes pa nyams su ma myong bas so //
analyzed: sngar nyams su ma myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyer sbas kyi shes pas byams pa'i shes pa nyams su ma myong bas so //
translated: “What has not been experienced” means that the consciousness of Upagupta has not experienced the consciousness of Maitreya.

original: ma shes pa'i rgyud la skyes pa ltar na zhes bya ba ni nyer sbas kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma shes pa'i rgyud la skyes pa ltar na zhes bya ba ni nyer sbas kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: “As if it had arisen in a continuum that does not know it” means as if it had arisen in the continuum of Upagupta.

original: @195a * // nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i shes pas sngar shes pa dang don dag nyams su ma myong bas so //
analyzed: @195a * // nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i shes pas sngar shes pa dang don dag nyams su ma myong bas so //
translated: “Because it has not been experienced” means that the consciousness of memory has not experienced the previous consciousness and object.

original: dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang don dag go //
analyzed: dran par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang don dag go //
translated: “It would not be remembered” means that the consciousness and the object would not be remembered.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: “If you say” and so on is a hypothetical objection.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
