analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because the nature of cause and effect is stable” means that the previous and subsequent moments are stable as cause and effect.

original: gtan tshigs 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan phyir zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan phyir zhes bya bas so //
translated: “By this reason” means by the reason “because of the other.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “In terms of such things as cause and effect,” and so on. The phrase “and so on” includes “because they are different, like a cognition belonging to a different continuum.”

original: khyod kyi ltar na ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te kho bo las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dran pa'i shes pas nyams su ma myong ba'i shes pa dran par mi rigs na khyod kyi 'dod pa ltar na ci ltar rjod par byed ce na'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ltar na ci ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te kho bo las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dran pa'i shes pas nyams su ma myong ba'i shes pa dran par mi rigs na khyod kyi 'dod pa ltar na ci ltar rjod par byed ce na'o //
translated: If you ask, “How is it according to you?” the question is this: if it is not reasonable for a memory cognition to remember a cognition that it did not experience because it is different from it, then how is it that you describe it?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that, he says,

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gis yul myong 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa gang gis yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gis yul myong 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i shes pa gang gis yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “I will explain,” and so on. “By which the object is experienced” refers to the cognition of blue by which the object is experienced.

original: 'di las dran pa 'di gzhan nga la yod min pa //
analyzed: 'di las dran pa 'di gzhan nga la yod min pa //
translated: “This memory is not different from that.”

original: zhes bya ba ni yul shes pa de la dran pa'i shes pa gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul shes pa de la dran pa'i shes pa gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: This means that the memory cognition is not different from the cognition that experiences the object.

original: de'i phyir nga yis mthong snyam dran 'gyur te //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga yis mthong snyam dran 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore, the thought “I saw it” occurs.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i dran pa las dran pa'i shes pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe gang nyams su myong ba'i shes pas gang nyams su myong ba de nyid dran pa'i shes pas kyang nyams su myong ba yin pas ngas
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba'i dran pa las dran pa'i shes pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe gang nyams su myong ba'i shes pas gang nyams su myong ba de nyid dran pa'i shes pas kyang nyams su myong ba yin pas ngas
translated: Since the memory consciousness is not different from the memory that experiences, then when the consciousness that experiences experiences, the consciousness that remembers also experiences it.

original: mthong snyam du dran par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthong snyam du dran par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought “I saw it” occurs as memory.

original: gal te shes pa rnams skad cig ma yin pa dang rang rig med pas ngas mthong ngo snyam du ji ltar dran zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa rnams skad cig ma yin pa dang rang rig med pas ngas mthong ngo snyam du ji ltar dran zhe na /
translated: If the consciousnesses are momentary and there is no reflexive awareness, how can there be the memory “I saw it”?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: 'di yang 'jig rten tha snyad tshul lugs yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'jig rten tha snyad tshul lugs yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the way of the conventions of the world.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad brtag dpyad kyi go skabs med pas na 'jig rten na ci ltar yod pa de ltar khas blang bar bya dgos pas so ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad brtag dpyad kyi go skabs med pas na 'jig rten na ci ltar yod pa de ltar khas blang bar bya dgos pas so ;
translated: Since there is no opportunity to analyze the conventions of the world, one must accept things in the world as they are.

original: / des na 'jig rten pas rang rig med du zin kyang mthong ngo snyam pa'i tha snyad byed pas /
analyzed: / des na 'jig rten pas rang rig med du zin kyang mthong ngo snyam pa'i tha snyad byed pas /
translated: Therefore, even though the world does not have reflexive awareness, it is still possible to say, “I see.”

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dag gcig tu zhen pa yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dag gcig tu zhen pa yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the cognition of experience and the memory are conceived of as one, and so there is no error.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha dad du las len na de'i tshe rgyud gzhan du @195b gtogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du dran par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha dad du las len na de'i tshe rgyud gzhan du @195b gtogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du dran par mi rigs so //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the cognition of experience and the memory are taken to be different, then, like the cognition belonging to another continuum, it is not reasonable that they be remembered.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa la ltos nas nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang mthong ba de dran pas kyang mthong ba'i phyir ngas mthong ngo snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa la ltos nas nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gang mthong ba de dran pas kyang mthong ba'i phyir ngas mthong ngo snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin la
translated: If, in dependence on the world, the cognition of experience and the memory are not different, then the cognition of experience that sees would also be remembered, and so it would be possible to say, “I see.”

original: / de nyid kyi phyir dran pa rang rig gi 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir dran pa rang rig gi 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And for that very reason, memory would not be the effect of reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pas rang rig gi sgo nas tha snyad mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pas rang rig gi sgo nas tha snyad mi byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, worldly people do not make assertions by means of reflexive awareness.

original: 'on kyang yul nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas yin pas 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas yin pas 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas nas dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: However, since they do so by means of the experience of objects, the establishment of reflexive awareness by means of memory is not done from the perspective of worldly people.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: gang gis yul myong ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis yul myong ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “By means of the experience of objects” and so on.🔽“As was explained earlier”

original: de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: refers to the following lines:

original: gzhan phyir ma skyes rgyud las skyes pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan phyir ma skyes rgyud las skyes pa bzhin //
translated: Because of being different, it is not born from itself, but like the birth from a continuum.

original: gtan tshigs 'dis ni khyad par dag kyang 'joms //🔽zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis ni khyad par dag kyang 'joms // zhes bya bas so //
translated: This argument also refutes the distinctions.

original: dran pa dang yul dang ldan par 'byung la zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i yul dang ldan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang yul dang ldan par 'byung la zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams su myong ba'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i yul dang ldan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “It arises in possession of memory and objects” means that the consciousness that experiences memory is in possession of an experienced object.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, it says:

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “For these reasons” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa yin pa de ci'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i dran pas rang rig pa yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba dang dran pa'i shes pa dag tha mi dad pa yin pa de ci'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i dran pas rang rig pa yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the consciousnesses of experience and memory are not different, therefore, the existence of reflexive awareness is not from memory, which is different from the consciousness of experience.

original: khyod kyi gzhan dbang gis 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi phyogs la rang rig pa med pa'i phyir gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi gzhan dbang gis 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi phyogs la rang rig pa med pa'i phyir gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: “ By what would your dependent consciousness be apprehended?” means that, according to your standpoint, since there is no reflexive awareness, by what would the dependent consciousness be apprehended?

original: de ltar dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig mi 'grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa'i sgo nas rang rig mi 'grub par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that reflexive awareness is not established by memory,

original: rang rig ngo bo'i sgo nas kyang mi rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig ngo bo'i sgo nas kyang mi rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that it is also illogical in terms of the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: byed pa po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir rang rig ni bdag nyid rig pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te 'dir rang rig ni bdag nyid rig pa yin la /
translated: he says, “The agent and object are not one,” and so on. Here reflexive awareness is the awareness of itself.

original: bdag nyid kyis yin par khas len na bdag nyid byed pa por khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis yin par khas len na bdag nyid byed pa por khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: If it is accepted that it is itself, then it is accepted that it is the agent itself.

original: bdag nyid rig par bya ba yin pas bdag nyid bya bar yang khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rig pa zhes bya ba de yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir byed pa dang las dang bya ba rnams gcig tu yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid rig par bya ba yin pas bdag nyid bya bar yang khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rig pa zhes bya ba de yang tha dad pa med pa'i phyir byed pa dang las dang bya ba rnams gcig tu yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is accepted that the self is the agent, since it is that which is to be known, and because that which is called “knowledge” is not different, it is not tenable that the agent, object, and action are the same.

original: gcig nyid las grub pa dang ma grub pa dang ma grub pa dag 'gal ba'i chos su thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gcig nyid las grub pa dang ma grub pa dang ma grub pa dag 'gal ba'i chos su thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it follows that in the case of oneness, the established, the not yet established, and the not established would be contradictory phenomena.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽de nyid kyis de @196a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / de nyid kyis de @196a * //
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is not tenable that it

original: 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: grasps itself.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: bdag rig pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag rig pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “It is the agent of the knowledge of itself,” and so on.

original: de nyid kyang byed pa po yin zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid byed pa po yin na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang byed pa po yin zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid byed pa po yin na'o //
translated: “It is also the agent” means that the self is the agent.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gi'o //
translated: “Of it” means of the self.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: “Action” has the nature of experience.

original: 'di dag gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni lhas byin gyis zor bas brnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir byed pa po dang las dang bya ba rnams tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni lhas byin gyis zor bas brnga'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir byed pa po dang las dang bya ba rnams tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement they are not seen to be the same is because here, in the statement Devadatta cuts with a sword, the agent, object, and action are seen to be distinct.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for this, he says

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In the noble Lankavatara-sutra, it is also said:

original: ci ltar ral gri'i so la gcod par mi byed pa dang ci ltar sor mo rang nyid la reg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sems kyis kyang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar ral gri'i so la gcod par mi byed pa dang ci ltar sor mo rang nyid la reg par mi byed pa de bzhin du sems kyis kyang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the edge of a sword does not cut itself, and just as the finger tip does not touch itself, in the same way, the mind is not aware of itself.

original: des na gzhan dbang la sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa dang / gnod byed yod pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan dbang la sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa dang / gnod byed yod pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no valid cognition establishing the dependent nature and there is a refutation of it, the dependent nature is not established as existent.

original: gal te sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa dang / gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod kyang gzhan dbang khas len na ni de'i tshe skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sgrub byed kyi tshad ma med pa dang / gnod byed kyi tshad ma yod kyang gzhan dbang khas len na ni de'i tshe skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If you accept the dependent nature even though there is no valid cognition to establish it and there is a valid cognition to invalidate it, then we will show you the error of that position.

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakīrti says, “In that case . . .”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed med pa dang / gnod byed yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed med pa dang / gnod byed yod pa'o //
translated: “In that case” refers to the absence of valid cognition to establish it and the presence of valid cognition to invalidate it.

original: mi shes pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa med pa nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa med pa nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: “It would be an object of the ignorant” shows the absence of valid cognition to establish it.

original: skye ba med cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba ma grub pas gnod byed yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med cing zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas skye ba ma grub pas gnod byed yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: “It would be unborn” shows the presence of valid cognition to invalidate it, since it is not established that it arises from itself and so on.

original: gzhan dbang ngo ba'i dngos yod na //
analyzed: gzhan dbang ngo ba'i dngos yod na //
translated: If the dependent nature existed . . .

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gzhan dbang gi ngo bo yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gzhan dbang gi ngo bo yod par gyur na'o //
translated: . . . if the dependent nature, which has the nature of appearing as blue and so on, existed.

original: gzhan la mo gsham bus gnod pa ci zhig bskyal /
analyzed: gzhan la mo gsham bus gnod pa ci zhig bskyal /
translated: What harm has the son of a barren woman done to you?

original: sems tsam du smra ba gzhan la mo gsham gyi bus gnod pa ci zhes byas te /
analyzed: sems tsam du smra ba gzhan la mo gsham gyi bus gnod pa ci zhes byas te /
translated: What harm is there in saying that the son of a barren woman is a mind-only proponent?

original: de yang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes pa'o //
translated: And that must be accepted as existing.

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byas pas so //
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byas pas so //
translated: “By whom” means by the one who is harmed.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni mo gshom gyi bu'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni mo gshom gyi bu'o //
translated: “This” means the son of a barren woman.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “due to the other-dependent,” and so on.

original: gong du spyir bstan pa yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma @196b yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir skye ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gong du spyir bstan pa yin la zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma @196b yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir skye ba bkag pa'o //
translated: “Previously, in general” means that arising in general was refuted by “not from self,” and so on.

original: ma shes pa'i bdag nyid can du yang bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni da lta na ni gzhan dbang las shes byed med pa nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma shes pa'i bdag nyid can du yang bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni da lta na ni gzhan dbang las shes byed med pa nyid ston pa'o //
translated: “It must be taught to have the nature of non-knowledge” means that now the absence of an object of knowledge in the other-dependent is taught.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni ma shes pa'i bdag nyid can du chos mtshungs kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni ma shes pa'i bdag nyid can du chos mtshungs kyang ngo //
translated: “This” means that although the son of a barren woman and the other-dependent are similar in having the nature of non-knowledge,

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni mo gsham bu yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni mo gsham bu yang ngo //
translated: “this” means that the son of a barren woman is also.

original: spros pa thams cad spangs shing zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad spangs shing zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Free from all conceptual elaborations” means beyond all conceptualization.

original: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Having the nature of being inexpressible” means beyond the domain of words.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid bkag nas dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid bkag nas dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the existence of the dependent nature, in order to refute the cause of the nominal existence of entities, he says:

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Whatever” and so on.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to the reason for the nominal existence of entities.

original: cung zad yod min na zhes bya ba ni de la sgrub par byed pa med pa dang / gnod par byed pa yod pas so //
analyzed: cung zad yod min na zhes bya ba ni de la sgrub par byed pa med pa dang / gnod par byed pa yod pas so //
translated: “Not even the slightest” means that there is no proof for that, and there is refutation of it.

original: kun rdzob kyi rgyur ni gang zhig 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra bas khas blangs pa'i dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan dbang med pas sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams la rgyu ci yod de
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rgyur ni gang zhig 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra bas khas blangs pa'i dngos por btags par yod pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan dbang med pas sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams la rgyu ci yod de
translated: Since the Cittamātra proponents do not accept the dependent nature, which is the cause of the imputed existence of things, what cause is there for the conceptual thoughts of blue, yellow, and so on?

original: / gzhan dbang las ma gtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / gzhan dbang las ma gtogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that apart from the dependent nature, there is no other cause whatsoever.

original: des na sems tsam du smra ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na sems tsam du smra ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, for the proponents of Mind Only, the conventional truth is severed.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: kun rdzob rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “With regard to all the conventional…”

original: rgyu gang yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: “Whatever is the cause” is the dependent nature.

original: gzhan dbang rnams la rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dbang rnams la rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted as the cause of all conceptual thoughts with regard to the dependent nature.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams la'o //
translated: Here refers to the Proponents of Mind Only.

original: yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang med pas so //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang med pas so //
translated: Since it does not exist means since the dependent nature does not exist.

original: kye ma kyi hud ces bya ba ni shin tu nyam thag pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma kyi hud ces bya ba ni shin tu nyam thag pa'o //
translated: Alas! and Oh no! express great distress.

original: rdzas la chags pa yis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi rdzas la chags pas so //
analyzed: rdzas la chags pa yis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi rdzas la chags pas so //
translated: Attachment to substance means attachment to the substance that has the characteristic of the dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi ltar na zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyi ltar na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyi ltar na'o //
translated: According to others means according to the Proponents of Mind Only.

original: rnam gzhag kun zhes bya ba ni 'dug shig song shig byos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gzhag kun zhes bya ba ni 'dug shig song shig byos shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All presentations means sit, go, do, and so on.

original: brlag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang med pas so //
analyzed: brlag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang med pas so //
translated: Destroyed means that the dependent nature, which is the cause of conceptuality, does not exist.

original: de 'grel pas bstan @197a * //🔽par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan @197a * // par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: shes rab med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, because of the absence of wisdom, and so on.

original: rdzas cha shas tsam la chags pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang tsam gyi cha shas la chags pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas cha shas tsam la chags pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dbang tsam gyi cha shas la chags pa'o //
translated: “Attachment to mere partial substance” means attachment to the mere partial dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis bum pa so ma btang bar chu dang 'dra ba blugs nas zhes bya ba ni ci ltar bum pa so ma btang bar chu blugs na chu dang bum pa gnyis ka brlag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis bum pa so ma btang bar chu dang 'dra ba blugs nas zhes bya ba ni ci ltar bum pa so ma btang bar chu blugs na chu dang bum pa gnyis ka brlag par 'gyur la /
translated: “Like a pot that has not been fired, water is poured into it” means that if water is poured into a pot that has not been fired, both the water and the pot are destroyed.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang khas len na gzhan gyi dbang med pas rnam par rtog pa med pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzhan gyi dbang khas len na gzhan gyi dbang med pas rnam par rtog pa med pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In the same way, if one accepts the dependent nature as the cause of conceptualization, then because the dependent nature does not exist, there is no conceptualization, and so conventional truth is destroyed.

original: rang gi blo gros kyi tshul ngan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i blo gros kyi tshul zhan pas so //
analyzed: rang gi blo gros kyi tshul ngan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i blo gros kyi tshul zhan pas so //
translated: “Because of the bad way your mind works” means because of the weakness of the Cittamātra mind.

original: rgud pa nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni skyon 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rgud pa nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni skyon 'ba' zhig go //
translated: “Only decline” means only faults.

original: mngon par mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not seen.

original: dge ba'am shis pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'am shis pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no virtue or good fortune.

original: de ltar sems tsam du smra ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems tsam du smra ba rnams la kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that even conventional truth does not exist for the Proponents of Mind Only,

original: da ni de rnams la don dam pa'i bden pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de rnams la don dam pa'i bden pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to show that even ultimate truth does not exist for them,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Therefore, in that way . . . ” and so on.

original: phyin ci log la zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin pa las rnam par shes pa dngos po nyid du khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log la zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin pa las rnam par shes pa dngos po nyid du khas blangs pas so //
translated: “ In error” means that, since all things are essenceless, consciousness is accepted as an entity.

original: slob dpon zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: slob dpon zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams so //
translated: “ The master” is the Proponents of Mind Only.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyar ba'i lugs kyi lam kho nar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i shes pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i lugs kyang yin
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyar ba'i lugs kyi lam kho nar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i shes pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i lugs kyang yin
translated: “ Enters only the path of the system of his own imagination” means that the Proponents of Mind Only imagine that nondual consciousness exists ultimately.

original: pa de nyid las so ;
analyzed: pa de nyid las so ;
translated: That is the system imagined by their own imagination.

original: / slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis lam las ni phyi rol gyur la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi lam las phyi rol du gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: / slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis lam las ni phyi rol gyur la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi lam las phyi rol du gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The master Nagarjuna says, Those who are outside the path, that is, those who are outside the path of emptiness,

original: rnam par shes pa rdzas yod du khas len pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rdzas yod du khas len pas so //
translated: because they accept consciousness to be substantially real.

original: zhi ba'i thabs med do zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba'i thabs med do zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no means of peace means that there is no means of liberation.

original: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i thabs med pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i thabs med pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why? means Why is there no means of liberation?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽kun rdzob de nyid bden pas nyams //🔽zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag las yongs su nyams pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / kun rdzob de nyid bden pas nyams // zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dag las yongs su nyams pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: he says,🔽Because they are impaired by the conventional and ultimate truths,🔽impaired by the conventional and ultimate truths means impaired by the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: @197b de las nyams pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: @197b de las nyams pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las nyams pa'o //
translated: Impaired by that means impaired by the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: thar pa grub yod min zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thar pa grub yod min zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Liberation is not accomplished” means that nirvana is not accomplished.

original: sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa las nyams nas thar pa 'grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can kun rdzob kyi bden pa las nyams nas thar pa 'grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Liberation is not accomplished by falling from the conventional truth, which has the nature of generating the mind , the practice of the perfections, and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thar pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thar pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba'o //
translated: “Why is that?” and so on asks the reason for the non-accomplishment of liberation.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “The conventional truth” and so on.

original: tha snyad bden pa thabs su gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa thar pa thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad bden pa thabs su gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa thar pa thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
translated: “The conventional truth is the method” means that the conventional truth is the method for attaining liberation.

original: de med na chos ston pa la sogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: de med na chos ston pa la sogs pa med pas so //
translated: Without it, there would be no teaching of the Dharma and so on.

original: don dam bden pa thabs byung gyur ba ste //
analyzed: don dam bden pa thabs byung gyur ba ste //
translated: “The ultimate truth is the result of the method.”

original: zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa'i sgo nas sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos bstan pa'i sgo nas sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the result of engaging in generating the mind and so on through the door of teaching the Dharma.

original: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub thob pas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub thob pas so //
translated: because they have attained enlightenment, which has the characteristic of the extremely pure dharmadhatu, free from all obscurations.

original: de gnyis rnam dbye gang gis mi shes pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba gang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bden pa gnyis las 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam dbye gang gis mi shes pa // zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba gang gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bden pa gnyis las 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: How is it that they do not understand the distinction between the two?🔽This refers to the proponents of mind only, who do not understand the distinction between the two truths, conventional truth and ultimate truth, saying, “This is conventional truth,

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa'o //
translated: this is ultimate truth.”

original: de ni rnam rtog log pas lam ngan zhugs //
analyzed: de ni rnam rtog log pas lam ngan zhugs //
translated: They have entered a bad path due to the reversal of conceptual thought.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob don dam pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir sems tsam du smra ba de rnams kyis bden pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pas lam ngan par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob don dam pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir sems tsam du smra ba de rnams kyis bden pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pas lam ngan par zhugs pa'o //
translated: This refers to the proponents of mind only, who have accepted the conventional, which has the nature of consciousness, as being the ultimate. Since they have not understood the nature of the two truths as it is, they have entered a bad path.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam gzhag lung gi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi rnam gzhag lung gi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the two truths by means of scripture,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said…” and so forth.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: “The Knower of the World” is the Bhagavān.

original: ma gsan par zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams la slob dpon med par rang 'byung gi ye shes mnga' bas so //
analyzed: ma gsan par zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams la slob dpon med par rang 'byung gi ye shes mnga' bas so //
translated: “Without having heard” is because the Bhagavāns have self-arisen gnosis without a teacher.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: “From another” is from sentient beings who are disciples.

original: bden pa gnyis ka yin zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ka yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Are they both truths?”

original: de la lan ni /🔽gang zhig kun rdzob de bzhin don dam ste //
analyzed: de la lan ni / gang zhig kun rdzob de bzhin don dam ste //
translated: The answer is,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “That which is conventional and that which is ultimate.”

original: bden pa gnyis yin pa kho na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis yin pa kho na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why are they both truths?”

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is,

original: bden pa gsum pa gang yang ma mchis so //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽kun rdzob @198a * //
analyzed: bden pa gsum pa gang yang ma mchis so // zhes bya ba gsungs te / kun rdzob @198a * //
translated: “There is no third truth at all.”

original: kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa las gzhan pa'i bden pa gsum pa med pa ste /
analyzed: kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa las gzhan pa'i bden pa gsum pa med pa ste /
translated: The conventional truth and the ultimate truth are not a third truth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gzhan gsungs pa de rnams bden pa 'di gnyis su 'dus pa yin no zhes sngar bstan bcos mkhan pos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa gzhan gsungs pa de rnams bden pa 'di gnyis su 'dus pa yin no zhes sngar bstan bcos mkhan pos so //
translated: The other truths taught by the Lord are included in these two truths.

original: 'dis ni bden pa gnyis mdor bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'dis ni bden pa gnyis mdor bstan pa yin no ;
translated: This is the brief presentation of the two truths.

original: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the intention of the teaching of conventional truth,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “By which,” and so on.

original: gang gis zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pas so //
translated: “By which” refers to the teaching of conventional truth.

original: dad pa skye 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi sgo nas 'gro ba drug la sogs pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: dad pa skye 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi sgo nas 'gro ba drug la sogs pa bstan pas so //
translated: “Faith arises” refers to the teaching of the six destinies and so on in terms of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams bdag cag rnams la phan par mdzad pa nyid yin no snyam du rtogs nas dad pa skye bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams bdag cag rnams la phan par mdzad pa nyid yin no snyam du rtogs nas dad pa skye bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Thinking, “The Lords are indeed benefactors of us all,” faith arises.

original: gang gi don du dad pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi don du dad pa skye zhe na /
translated: For what purpose does faith arise?

original: bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “For the sake of happiness,” and so on.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba thob pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba thob pa'o ;
translated: It is the attainment of happiness characterized by high status and the auspicious.

original: /'gro ba rnams kyi don slad du //
analyzed: /'gro ba rnams kyi don slad du //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of migrating beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don ched du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don ched du'o //
translated: This means for the sake of the benefit of migrating beings.

original: de'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is:

original: 'jig rten phan phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten phan phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For the benefit of the world.

original: 'gro ba drug la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas las dge ba las ni bde 'gro dang mi dge ba las ni ngan song yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud nas mi dge ba'i las spong zhing byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa dge ba'i las la
analyzed: 'gro ba drug la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas las dge ba las ni bde 'gro dang mi dge ba las ni ngan song yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud nas mi dge ba'i las spong zhing byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa dge ba'i las la
translated: Having understood that through teaching the six realms of migrating beings and so forth, happy rebirths come from virtuous karma and miserable rebirths come from nonvirtuous karma, one abandons nonvirtuous karma and engages in virtuous karma such as the thought of awakening.

original: 'jug pas 'jig rten la phan pa mdzad pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pas 'jig rten la phan pa mdzad pas so //
translated: Thus, since it benefits the world, it is the conventional truth.

original: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the purpose of teaching the conventional truth, in order to make known the nature of the conventional truth, it is said:

original: sems can tshogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: sems can tshogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The mind of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi tshogs kyi 'gro ba drug gang bstan pa de ni kun rdzob tu btags pa mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi tshogs kyi 'gro ba drug gang bstan pa de ni kun rdzob tu btags pa mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One taught the six destinies of the multitude of sentient beings, which is a conventional designation.

original: 'gro ba drug bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the six destinies,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, “the hells,” and so on.

original: mtshungs med khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshungs med khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “You, incomparable one,”

original: mi'i 'gro ba'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the particularities of the human destiny,

original: rigs dma' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs dma' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “low caste,” and so on.

original: khyad par bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the teaching of the particularities,

original: 'gro ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “particularities of the destinies,” and so on.

original: mtshungs med khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang mtshungs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @198b rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mtshungs med khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang mtshungs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @198b rnams kyis so //
translated: “You, incomparable one,” means the Blessed Buddhas who are incomparable to others.

original: mi la de bstan to zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: mi la de bstan to zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: “He taught it to humans” means conventional truth.

original: de ni 'gro ba drug gi skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba drug gi skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the faults of the six destinies,

original: 'di la dga' ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la dga' ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Here, one who delights in this . . .”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug po rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug po rnams la'o //
translated: “Here” refers to the six destinies.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: “Destiny” is the different divisions of the six destinies.

original: 'khor ba na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro bar 'khyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro bar 'khyams pa'o //
translated: “In cyclic existence” means wandering from destiny to destiny.

original: 'gro ba'i chos brgyad la ni 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i chos brgyad la ni 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: “One enters into the eight dharmas of the destinies”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means one enters into the eight worldly dharmas.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad gang zhe na thob dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad gang zhe na thob dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What are the eight worldly dharmas? He says, “Gain and so on.”

original: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa ni lkog tu'o //
analyzed: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa ni lkog tu'o //
translated: Fame and ill-fame are behind one’s back.

original: bstod pa dang / smad pa ni mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: bstod pa dang / smad pa ni mngon sum du'o //
translated: Praise and blame are in one’s presence.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the results of gain and so on,

original: thob pa rnyed na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thob pa rnyed na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If one gains gain . . .”

original: gal te rnyed pa thob par gyur na mi rnams la stod pa byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa thob par gyur na mi rnams la stod pa byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If he obtains gain, he becomes conceited with people.

original: ma thob par gyur na des kyang 'khrug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa ma thob par gyur na mi rnams la rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob par gyur na des kyang 'khrug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa ma thob par gyur na mi rnams la rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If he does not obtain it, he becomes agitated.

original: gang gzhan ma bstan tshul 'dis shes par bya //
analyzed: gang gzhan ma bstan tshul 'dis shes par bya //
translated: The other worldly dharmas should be understood in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan te 'jig rten pa'i chos drug gi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan te 'jig rten pa'i chos drug gi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi mtshan nyid can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The result of the other worldly dharmas should be understood as being, in brief, of the nature of passion and aversion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽nad rnam brgyad kyis de rgyun gcod par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / nad rnam brgyad kyis de rgyun gcod par 'gyur //
translated: For this very reason,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said:🔽The eight illnesses afflict him.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad gang yin pa de rnams nad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad gang yin pa de rnams nad de /
translated: The eight worldly dharmas are illnesses

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang bskyed pa'i sgo nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang bskyed pa'i sgo nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas so //
translated: because they are the cause of suffering in the hells, etc., through the generation of passion and aversion.

original: de rnams kyis dus rtag tu 'gro ba rnams la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis dus rtag tu 'gro ba rnams la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will always harm transmigrators.

original: de ltar 'gro ba drug gi skyon bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba drug gi skyon bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the faults of the six transmigrations,

original: kun rdzob la don dam du phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob la don dam du phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the fault of holding the conventional as the ultimate,

original: kun rdzob de la don dam du smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun rdzob de la don dam du smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The one who speaks of the ultimate in that conventional,” and so on.

original: gang gis kun rdzob la don dam pa'i rang bzhin du rtog pa de nor ba'i blo gros dang ldan pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis kun rdzob la don dam pa'i rang bzhin du rtog pa de nor ba'i blo gros dang ldan pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the one who conceives the conventional as having the nature of the ultimate is simply one who possesses a mistaken intellect.

original: phyin ci log tu rtog pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽mi sdug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mi sdug pa ste mi gtsang ba'i dngos po gang yin pa la sdug pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / mi sdug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mi sdug pa ste mi gtsang ba'i dngos po gang yin pa la sdug pa ste /
translated: In order to teach the very error of conception,🔽he says, “The one who speaks of the impure as pure,” and so on.🔽The one who speaks of the impure, that is, the unclean, as pure,

original: gtsang ba nyid du smra ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi dngos po gang yin pa de la bde ba'o zhes smra @199a * //
analyzed: gtsang ba nyid du smra ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi dngos po gang yin pa de la bde ba'o zhes smra @199a * //
translated: and the one who speaks of that which is suffering as happiness,

original: ba dang ; bdag med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la bdag go zhes smra ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos la rtag pa'o zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang ; bdag med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la bdag go zhes smra ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos la rtag pa'o zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: And that which is the nature of selflessness, that is called self, and that which is impermanent is called permanent.

original: de ltar dga' ste mtshan mar gang gnas pa //
analyzed: de ltar dga' ste mtshan mar gang gnas pa //
translated: Thus, whoever delights in this way and abides in signs

original: zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar sdug pa la sogs pa la dga' ba de ni mtshan ma la gnas pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar sdug pa la sogs pa la dga' ba de ni mtshan ma la gnas pa'o /
translated: means that whoever delights in beauty and so on abides in signs.

original: de rnams kyis chos la gshe bas 'bras bu ngan song du skye ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyis chos la gshe bas 'bras bu ngan song du skye ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by reviling the Dharma, the result is rebirth in the lower realms,

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the text] says those who... and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni mtshan ma la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni mtshan ma la dga' ba'o //
translated: Those means those who delight in signs.

original: bde gshegs gsung ni thob 'gyur na //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsung ni thob 'gyur na //
translated: Having attained the speech of the Sugata,

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med par gsungs pa thos par gyur na rang bzhin med pa la 'jigs shing sangs rgyas kyi gsung spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos po rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba med par gsungs pa thos par gyur na rang bzhin med pa la 'jigs shing sangs rgyas kyi gsung spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: means that when they hear the speech of the Buddha Bhagavān that things are essenceless and unborn, they are afraid of essencelessness and abandon the speech of the Buddha.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ji bzhin mi rtog pa ste stong pa nyid la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i don ma rtogs pas chad pa'i don du khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji bzhin mi rtog pa ste stong pa nyid la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i don ma rtogs pas chad pa'i don du khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because, without understanding the meaning of non-production from the beginning in emptiness, which is non-conceptual as it is, they understand it to mean annihilation.

original: tshul min zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi sgo nas te /
analyzed: tshul min zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi sgo nas te /
translated: The phrase in an improper way means by way of error.

original: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means by an improper method.

original: bde ba tshol bgyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon mtho dang nges legs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
analyzed: bde ba tshol bgyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon mtho dang nges legs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
translated: The phrase seeking happiness refers to the characteristics of high rebirth and definite goodness.

original: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught conventional truth,

original: bstan pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i blo gros can rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i blo gros can rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach ultimate truth by way of teaching the result for those who have the intelligence to understand the teaching without error,

original: 'jig rten phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten phan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, For the sake of the world's welfare, etc.

original: ma log blo yis zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba shes pas so //
analyzed: ma log blo yis zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba shes pas so //
translated: “With an unerring mind” means by knowing the division into the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin dben pa ste //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin dben pa ste //
translated: All these phenomena are empty of inherent nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos 'di thams cad rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: All these phenomena are without inherent nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: mtshan mas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan mas stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because they are empty of characteristics.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because they are without cause.

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang bral ba brjod du med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu dang bral ba brjod du med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is that which is inexpressible, which is free from the cause of the absence of inherent nature.

original: de lta bu thos nas zhes gang bstan pa la dga' ba skye ba de dag bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i sgo nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu thos nas zhes gang bstan pa la dga' ba skye ba de dag bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i sgo nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who, having heard such a teaching, give rise to joy in it, will attain unsurpassed enlightenment through reflection and meditation.

original: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong par gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong par gzigs pa'o //
translated: “Just so” means seeing as empty of inherent nature.

original: dbang po'i grong ni @199b zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i tshogs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i grong ni @199b zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i tshogs so //
translated: The “city of the senses” is the collection of the senses.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary,

original: kun kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “all” and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par rang bzhin med par gzigs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par rang bzhin med par gzigs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: All things are seen without error to be essenceless.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba bstan nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa ni thabs yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba bstan nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa ni thabs yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the division of conventional and ultimate truths, in order to teach that the teaching of conventional truth is the method,

original: 'dir tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Here, the conventional” and so on.

original: yi ge med pa'i zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge med pa'i zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Without letters” means free from all expression.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid can rtogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid can rtogs pa'i chos so //
translated: “Dharma” is the dharma of realization, which is emptiness.

original: nyan pa gang dang ston pa gang ;
analyzed: nyan pa gang dang ston pa gang ;
translated: “The hearer and the teacher”

original: / zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad las 'das pa la nyan pa dang / ston pa dag mi srid pas so //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad las 'das pa la nyan pa dang / ston pa dag mi srid pas so //
translated: means that since they are beyond all expression, hearing and teaching are impossible.

original: brjod du med la sgro btags pas //
analyzed: brjod du med la sgro btags pas //
translated: But it is taught and heard through verbal designation,

original: 'on kyang nyan cing ston pa yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan cing ston pa yin //
translated: Even though it is inexpressible.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par brjod du med pa yin du zin kyang ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i stong pa nyid la blos sgra btags nas nyan pa dang ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par brjod du med pa yin du zin kyang ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i stong pa nyid la blos sgra btags nas nyan pa dang ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This means that even though it is ultimately inexpressible, it is taught and heard through the intellect’s verbal designation of emptiness, which is void of intrinsic reality.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa kho na la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na la ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa kho na la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na la ste /
translated: “Only in conventional reality” means only in superficial reality.

original: gzhan du na rjod pa po dang brjod pa la sogs pa'i spros pa med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na rjod pa po dang brjod pa la sogs pa'i spros pa med pas so //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no elaboration of the speaker, speech, etc.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //🔽tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so // tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: “In the treatise” means in the Wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang / shes bya dang / rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa rnams khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa ston par mi nus pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa dang / shes bya dang / rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa rnams khas ma blangs na don dam pa'i bden pa ston par mi nus pas /
translated: “Without depending on the conventional” means that without accepting the elaborations characterized by mundane consciousness, objects of consciousness, expressions, and objects of expressions, it is impossible to teach ultimate reality.

original: ma bstan na ni khong du chud par mi nus la /
analyzed: ma bstan na ni khong du chud par mi nus la /
translated: If it is not taught, it cannot be understood.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa khong du ma chud na ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par mi 'gyur la /🔽des na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs yin par nges pas ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa khong du ma chud na ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer thob par mi 'gyur la / des na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs yin par nges pas ci lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: And if one does not understand ultimate reality, one will not attain the city of nirvana.

original: chu don du gnyer bas snod bzhin du'o //🔽de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni thabs las byung bar gyur cing zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa ni thob par bya ba can yin pas thabs las byung ba yin la /🔽don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa la thabs las byung ba nyid du brjod pa ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: chu don du gnyer bas snod bzhin du'o // de la don dam pa'i bden pa ni thabs las byung bar gyur cing zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa ni thob par bya ba can yin pas thabs las byung ba yin la / don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pa la thabs las byung ba nyid du brjod pa ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is certain that it is the means for attaining nirvana, one must accept the conventional truth as it is, just as one accepts a vessel when one wants water.🔽In that regard, ultimate truth is what arises from the means, means for attaining it.🔽The statement that ultimate truth is what arises from the means is a designation because ultimate truth is what is to be attained and thus arises from the means.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa khong du chud pa la ni bstan pa ma gtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa khong du chud pa la ni bstan pa ma gtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med pas so //
translated: The statement that ultimate truth is what arises from the means in the teaching of ultimate truth is a designation because there is no means other than the teaching for understanding ultimate truth.

original: da ni gzhan gyis dbu ma pa la kun @200a * //
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis dbu ma pa la kun @200a * //
translated: Now, others say that the Madhyamika🔽

original: rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam gzhag mi 'thad pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: rdzob kyi bden pa'i rnam gzhag mi 'thad pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: Now, others teach that the Madhyamaka is not tenable with respect to the presentation of conventional truth.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, he says, “Here, some say, etc.”

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pas so //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pas so //
translated: “Some” refers to the Cittamātra.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas so //
translated: “You” refers to the Madhyamaka.

original: kho bo cag la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag la zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams la'o //
translated: “To us” refers to the proponents of Cittamātra.

original: shin tu ltos pa med par smra na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las nyams par brjod pas so //
analyzed: shin tu ltos pa med par smra na zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las nyams par brjod pas so //
translated: “You speak with utter disregard” refers to the fact that you are said to have fallen from conventional and ultimate truth.

original: nged cag kyang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: nged cag kyang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: “We too” refers to the proponents of Cittamātra.

original: khyod la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: khyod la zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams la'o //
translated: “To you” refers to the Madhyamaka.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas par zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas par zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “You are skilled in merely refuting the positions of others” means that you are skilled in merely refuting the positions of the Cittamātra.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa tsam la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of “expert” is just refuting the position of others.

original: 'thad pas mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'thad pas mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “ Because it is not reasonable by means of a proof” and so forth teaches that.

original: kho bo cag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang ngo ;
analyzed: kho bo cag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyang ngo ;
translated: “ We also” means the proponents of Mind Only.

original: / khyod la grags pa'i zhes bya ba'i dbu ma pa rnams la grags pa'o //
analyzed: / khyod la grags pa'i zhes bya ba'i dbu ma pa rnams la grags pa'o //
translated: “ What is renowned to you” is renowned to the Mādhyamikas.

original: ji skad du smras pa'i 'thad pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni /🔽bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa'i 'thad pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni / bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: “ By means of the very proof that is stated” is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnod byed bkod pa dang / khyod kyi gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnod byed bkod pa dang / khyod kyi gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: “ Not from self, not from other . . .” and so forth, which sets forth the refutation, and “What is the dependent that you apprehend?”

original: zhes bya bas gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzhan dbang gang gis 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: which asks, “What is the dependent that you apprehend?”

original: yod pa'i sgrub byed med pas so //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgrub byed med pas so //
translated: “ Because there is no proof of its existence.”

original: de la co 'dri ba'i sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la co 'dri ba'i sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer by way of ridicule,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ If you say . . .” and so forth is stated.

original: gal te khyod rangs par 'gyur na 'gyur la rag las te kho bo cag gis mngon par mtho ba dang dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te khyod rangs par 'gyur na 'gyur la rag las te kho bo cag gis mngon par mtho ba dang dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: If you are pleased, then it is dependent on your pleasure that we will have high status and virtue.

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis rangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis rangs par 'gyur na /
translated: For what reason would you be pleased?

original: de la lan ni slar 'phrogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de la lan ni slar 'phrogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The answer is: as if one were to take back what was stolen.

original: rdzas phyir 'phrogs pa'i bya bas so //
analyzed: rdzas phyir 'phrogs pa'i bya bas so //
translated: Because of the activity of taking back the substance.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: dug dang bcas pa'i zas byin nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa'i zas byin nas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said: “having given food with poison.”

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: thog ma med pa'i dus na dka' ba brgya phrag gis bsags pa'i nor gyi tshogs 'phrog pa po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus na dka' ba brgya phrag gis bsags pa'i nor gyi tshogs 'phrog pa po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said: “to one who steals the wealth that was accumulated with a hundred hardships over the course of beginningless time.”

original: mngon par mtho zhing zhes bya ba ni dga' ston du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho zhing zhes bya ba ni dga' ston du gyur pa'o //
translated: “High status” means a festival.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis sems tsam 'phrog pa'i dbu ma pa rnams la kun rdzob 'thad pa kho nas mi @200b rigs pa'i phyir zhes dbu ma pa la skyon 'gel bar byed na de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis sems tsam 'phrog pa'i dbu ma pa rnams la kun rdzob 'thad pa kho nas mi @200b rigs pa'i phyir zhes dbu ma pa la skyon 'gel bar byed na de ni kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the proponents of mind-only, in order to refute the Madhyamikas who are proponents of mind-only, were to charge the Madhyamikas with the fault that the conventional is not tenable, then we would agree with them.

original: yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: mngon par mtho ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very higher perception,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”🔽Because you, the proponents of mind-only, accept the existence of the dependent entity as tenable, you accept it as you wish.

original: gang gi phyir sems tsam du smra ba khyod kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po 'thad pas rigs nga yin no zhes rang dgar ci ltar khas len pa de bzhin du kho bo cag gis kun rdzob khas ma blangs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems tsam du smra ba khyod kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po 'thad pas rigs nga yin no zhes rang dgar ci ltar khas len pa de bzhin du kho bo cag gis kun rdzob khas ma blangs pas so //
translated: In the same way, we do not accept the conventional.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it, then?

original: 'bras phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Because of the effect, etc.”

original: 'thad pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob 'di med du zin kyang yod do zhes brjod pa ni kun rdzob bzlog pa'i don du ste //
analyzed: 'thad pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes smras pa'i sgo nas kun rdzob 'di med du zin kyang yod do zhes brjod pa ni kun rdzob bzlog pa'i don du ste //
translated: The statement although this conventional truth does not exist, it is said to exist is for the purpose of reversing the conventional.

original: bstan pa'i kun rdzob kyi sgo nas shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa thams cad bzlog par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i kun rdzob kyi sgo nas shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa thams cad bzlog par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because all elaborations characterized by cognition, objects of cognition, and so forth are reversed through the teaching of the conventional.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says just like... and so forth.

original: 'thad pas rigs pa yin no zhes smras pa'i sgo nas rang dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dor nas 'thad pas rigs pa yin no zhes blangs nas so //
analyzed: 'thad pas rigs pa yin no zhes smras pa'i sgo nas rang dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dor nas 'thad pas rigs pa yin no zhes blangs nas so //
translated: The statement through the reasoning of tenability means that, having abandoned the worldly perspective, one accepts reasoning as tenable.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i grub mtha' la brten nas so //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs kyis zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i grub mtha' la brten nas so //
translated: By one's own system means based on the tenets of the Cittamātra school.

original: de ltar kho bos kun rdzob ma yin te //
analyzed: de ltar kho bos kun rdzob ma yin te //
translated: Thus, I say the conventional does not exist

original: zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba bzhin du kho bos rang dbang la brtan nas ni brjod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba bzhin du kho bos rang dbang la brtan nas ni brjod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is to say, we do not speak on the basis of our own authority, as do the proponents of mind-only.🔽Although they do not exist,

original: yod pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa'i kun rdzob po //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa'i kun rdzob po //
translated: we teach them in conformity with the world.

original: de zlog pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ldog pa'i thabs yin pas so //
analyzed: de zlog pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ldog pa'i thabs yin pas so //
translated: Because they are the means of reversing that.

original: kun rdzob 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa la khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa la khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the teaching of the conventional truth in conformity with the world, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ji ltar nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi zhes bya ba ni nga'i yul dang 'gal ba des khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ji ltar nga dang lhan cig rtsod kyi zhes bya ba ni nga'i yul dang 'gal ba des khas blangs pas so //
translated: As it is said,🔽Whoever disputes with me should dispute with the world.

original: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de zhes bya ba ni dis khas blangs pas kyang khas len pas so //
