analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten dang mi rtsod de zhes bya ba ni dis khas blangs pas kyang khas len pas so //
translated: I do not dispute with the world.

original: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that extensively, he says:

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The world and so on.

original: gal te 'jig rten na kun rdzob yod par ma gyur na de'i tshe ngas kyang khas len pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten na kun rdzob yod par ma gyur na de'i tshe ngas kyang khas len pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If the conventional did not exist in the world, then I would not accept it either. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽phung po spangs nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i @201a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / phung po spangs nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i @201a * //
translated: Just like and so on.

original: phung po rnams dor nas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dor nas so //
translated: Having abandoned the aggregates means having discarded the aggregates of form and so on.

original: zhir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having entered peace means having entered nirvāṇa without remainder of the aggregates.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa rnams la'o //
translated: The arhats means those who have exhausted the defilements.

original: yod pa nyid min zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob bo //🔽de ltar na zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid min zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob bo // de ltar na zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: Do not exist means conventionally.🔽In that way means like the arhats.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: In the same way means like the arhats.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: This means the conventional.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te dgra bcom pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa rnams la yang phung po snang ba med par gyur na de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang kho bos kun rdzob khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te dgra bcom pa bzhin du 'jig rten pa rnams la yang phung po snang ba med par gyur na de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang kho bos kun rdzob khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is: if, like the Arhats, the aggregates would not appear to the worldly, then at that time, even following the worldly, I would not accept the conventional.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Arhats,” etc.

original: bdag nyid thams cad du kun rdzob yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la phung po rnams rgyun chad pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad du kun rdzob yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la phung po rnams rgyun chad pas so //
translated: “Not existing conventionally in any way” means that for those who have attained nirvana without remainder, the aggregates are interrupted.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i phung po la sogs pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “just so” is: “like the aggregates, etc. of the Arhats.”

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: “These” refers to the conventional.

original: gzhan la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la rag las pas so //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la rag las pas so //
translated: “Due to dependence on others” means dependence on the worldly.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas so //
translated: “By whom” means by the worldly.

original: de kho na la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la'o //
analyzed: de kho na la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la'o //
translated: “In that” means in the worldly.

original: gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: “Not in dependence on another” means not in the non-worldly.

original: gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gal te khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gal te khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of “not in dependence on another,” he says:🔽“If you refute this conventional truth, then you refute the world.”

original: kun rdzob 'di khyod kyis 'jig rten kho na dgag par gyis shig dang / kho bo ni kun rdzob 'jig rten pa kho na la zhugs pas so //🔽khyod la 'jig rten mi gnod na //
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di khyod kyis 'jig rten kho na dgag par gyis shig dang / kho bo ni kun rdzob 'jig rten pa kho na la zhugs pas so // khyod la 'jig rten mi gnod na //
translated: You should refute this conventional truth only in the world, because I am engaged only in the conventional truth of the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te sems tsam du smra ba khyod la snang bzhin pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin par ci ltar bstan zhes 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te sems tsam du smra ba khyod la snang bzhin pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin par ci ltar bstan zhes 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa yod par mi 'gyur na zhes pa'o //
translated: “If the world does not invalidate you” means that if the worldly does not invalidate you, then why do you teach that things which appear to the mind only do not exist?

original: des na khyod dang 'jig rten 'dir ni rtsod kyis dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: des na khyod dang 'jig rten 'dir ni rtsod kyis dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, you and the world may dispute about this!

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pas kun rdzob 'gog na khyod dang 'jig rten dag kun rdzob dgag pa'i don du rtsod par gyis shig dang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pas kun rdzob 'gog na khyod dang 'jig rten dag kun rdzob dgag pa'i don du rtsod par gyis shig dang zhes pa'o //
translated: If you refute the superficial because of the contradiction with the world, then you and the world may dispute about the refutation of the superficial.

original: phyi nas stobs ldan bdag gis brten par bya //
analyzed: phyi nas stobs ldan bdag gis brten par bya //
translated: Later, I will rely on the powerful one.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis po dag rtsod pa las na gang rgyal @201b ba de la bdag gis brten par bya ste 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pas 'jig rten rgyal bar gyur na 'jig rten kho na la brten par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis po dag rtsod pa las na gang rgyal @201b ba de la bdag gis brten par bya ste 'jig rten gyi gnod pa yod pas 'jig rten rgyal bar gyur na 'jig rten kho na la brten par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: If the two dispute, then I will rely on the victor. If the world wins because of the existence of the contradiction with the world, then I will rely on the world alone.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: We do not refute the superficial as it is apprehended by the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ldog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten la ltos pa'i shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ldog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten la ltos pa'i shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa yin la /
translated: In order to reverse the mundane conventional, that is, in order to reverse the elaborations that have the character of the consciousness and objects of knowledge that are dependent on the world.

original: de bzlog par bya ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: de bzlog par bya ba'i ched du ste /
translated: It is for the sake of reversing that,

original: stong pa nyid mngon du bya ba'i don du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon du bya ba'i don du zhes pa'o //
translated: for the sake of realizing emptiness.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni lung gi gnod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lung gi gnod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the damage done by scripture, he says:

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, someone says, etc.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smras pas so //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smras pas so //
translated: Someone says refers to the proponents of mind-only.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas so //🔽lung gi gnod pas 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas so // lung gi gnod pas 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You, the Mādhyamika,🔽frightened by the damage done by scripture,

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lung gi gnod pas 'jigs nas so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lung gi gnod pas 'jigs nas so //
translated: frightened by the damage done by scripture that will be explained.

original: lung gi gnod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gi gnod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the damage done by scripture, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: That refers to the bodhisattva.

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lung gi gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i don du co 'dri ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sgo nas lan ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lung gi gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i don du co 'dri ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sgo nas lan ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning “We will respond” is the response to the objection, which is stated in the form of a challenge.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung gi nor bu aanda rnyil las sbyar ba'i mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba la zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung gi nor bu aanda rnyil las sbyar ba'i mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba la zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: The ground of the sutra is laid out with the jewels of the Sugata’s speech. The Sugata is the Buddha, the Bhagavat.

original: gsung ni dag ste de nyid nor bu aanda rnyil yin la /
analyzed: gsung ni dag ste de nyid nor bu aanda rnyil yin la /
translated: His speech is pure, and it is the jewel sapphire.

original: des gang sbyar ba ni mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba de la'o //
analyzed: des gang sbyar ba ni mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba de la'o //
translated: The ground of the sutra is laid out with that.

original: dper na khang pa 'ga' zhig gi gzhi khyad par can du bya ba'i don du nor bu aanda rnyil las sa gzhi legs par bstar bar byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyid nor bu aanda rnyil yin la /
analyzed: dper na khang pa 'ga' zhig gi gzhi khyad par can du bya ba'i don du nor bu aanda rnyil las sa gzhi legs par bstar bar byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyid nor bu aanda rnyil yin la /
translated: For example, in order to make the ground of a house special, the ground is laid out with sapphire jewels. In the same way, here the Bhagavat’s speech is the sapphire jewel.

original: des sbyar ba'i mdo sde ni sa gzhi bstar ba'o //
analyzed: des sbyar ba'i mdo sde ni sa gzhi bstar ba'o //
translated: The sutra laid out with that is the ground.

original: rnam par shes pa dngos por smra ba'i chu'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dngos por yod do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de nyid chu'i rnam pa can du yongs su 'gyur bar 'khrul ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos por smra ba'i chu'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dngos por yod do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de nyid chu'i rnam pa can du yongs su 'gyur bar 'khrul ba yin la /
translated: The statement “the transformation of consciousness into the form of water” means that those who say that consciousness exists as a thing are mistaken in thinking that it transforms into the form of water.

original: de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The term “those who say this” refers to those who say that consciousness exists as a thing.

original: ji ltar bee d'urya'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi bstar ba la 'jig rten pa rnams la chu ru 'khrul pa skye ba de bzhin du sems tsam pa rnams la mdo sde rnams su rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa yin no snyam pa'i chur 'khrul🔽pa dang @202a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bee d'urya'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi bstar ba la 'jig rten pa rnams la chu ru 'khrul pa skye ba de bzhin du sems tsam pa rnams la mdo sde rnams su rnam par shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa yin no snyam pa'i chur 'khrul pa dang @202a * //
translated: Just as the world is mistaken in thinking that a surface made of beryl is water, so Cittamātra is mistaken in thinking that the sūtras teach that consciousness is the nature of things.

original: mtshungs pa'i 'khrul pa skye ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i 'khrul pa skye ba yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are mistaken in thinking that consciousness is the nature of things.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma zin par byas na zhes bya ba ni bee d'urya'i sa gzhi bstar bar ma rtogs pa de bzhin du mdo sde'i don khong du ma chud par ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ma zin par byas na zhes bya ba ni bee d'urya'i sa gzhi bstar bar ma rtogs pa de bzhin du mdo sde'i don khong du ma chud par ro //
translated: just as one does not understand the ground of lapis lazuli, in the same way, one does not comprehend the meaning of the sutras.🔽Those who wish to draw out the mere water of consciousness, which is the subject matter of the sutras,

original: rnam par shes pa dngos por smra ba'i chu tsam zhig bcu bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni dper na bee d'uryas bstar ba'i sa gzhi la chur 'khrul pas chu bcu bar 'dod pa 'byung ba de bzhin du mdo sde rnams la sems tsam du smra ba rnams
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos por smra ba'i chu tsam zhig bcu bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni dper na bee d'uryas bstar ba'i sa gzhi la chur 'khrul pas chu bcu bar 'dod pa 'byung ba de bzhin du mdo sde rnams la sems tsam du smra ba rnams
translated: just as one who is confused about the ground of lapis lazuli wishes to draw out the water, in the same way, those who propound mind only

original: la rnam par shes pa dngos po nyid du chu la bcu bar 'dod pas 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: la rnam par shes pa dngos po nyid du chu la bcu bar 'dod pas 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: wish to draw out consciousness, which is the subject matter of the sutras.🔽Having baked and moistened the unbaked clay pot of one's own intelligence,

original: rang gi blo gros kyi sa'i bum pa so ma btang ba bshal zhing smyugs nas zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i rang gi blo gros nyid de sa'i bum pa so ma btang ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi blo gros kyi sa'i bum pa so ma btang ba bshal zhing smyugs nas zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra ba'i rang gi blo gros nyid de sa'i bum pa so ma btang ba yin te /
translated: the mind only proponents' own intelligence is the unbaked clay pot.

original: blo gros yongs su ma smin pas so //
analyzed: blo gros yongs su ma smin pas so //
translated: Because their intelligence is not fully mature,

original: de bshal zhing smyugs pas so //
analyzed: de bshal zhing smyugs pas so //
translated: It is broken and shattered by that.🔽For example, someone who has a surface of vaidurya stone moistened with water in order to make it clear, breaks a pot on it.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig bee d'uryas sa gzhi bstar ba la chu bcu pa'i don du bum pa so ma btang ba smyugs par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig bee d'uryas sa gzhi bstar ba la chu bcu pa'i don du bum pa so ma btang ba smyugs par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: When it is broken into a hundred pieces,🔽the surface of the stone is clear.🔽In the same way, when the surface of the sutra ground is moistened by the water of consciousness in order to make it clear, it is broken into a hundred pieces by the pot of reasoning.

original: dum bu rnam pa brgyar klog pa na zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi bstar ba mkhregs pa yin pas de bum pa so ma btang yang smyugs par byed na dum bu brgyar 'gyur ba srid pa yin la /
analyzed: dum bu rnam pa brgyar klog pa na zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi bstar ba mkhregs pa yin pas de bum pa so ma btang yang smyugs par byed na dum bu brgyar 'gyur ba srid pa yin la /
translated: The surface of the stone is hard, so even though the pot is not fired, it breaks it.

original: de bzhin du sems tsam pa'i rang gi blo gros kyis rnam par shes pa dngos po'i chu bcu bar bya ba'i don du mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba la smyugs par byed na rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir dum bu rnam pa brgyar klog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam pa'i rang gi blo gros kyis rnam par shes pa dngos po'i chu bcu bar bya ba'i don du mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba la smyugs par byed na rigs pas mi 'thad pa'i phyir dum bu rnam pa brgyar klog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the surface of the sutra ground is moistened by the water of consciousness in order to make it clear, it is broken into a hundred pieces by the pot of reasoning.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems tsam pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems tsam pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The self is the self of the Mind Only school.

original: de'i rang bzhin shes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni aindra n'i la mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba'i rang bzhin shes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin shes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni aindra n'i la mdo sde'i sa gzhi bstar ba'i rang bzhin shes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those who know the nature of that means those who know the nature of the ground of the sutra laid out with sapphire.

original: mdo sde'i dgongs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes bya ba'i mdo sde der ni phyi rol gyi don bkag pa'i sems tsam nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa de ltar na yin no
analyzed: mdo sde'i dgongs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes bya ba'i mdo sde der ni phyi rol gyi don bkag pa'i sems tsam nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa de ltar na yin no
translated: The intention of the sutra is as follows: In the sutra that says this threefold world is mind only, the intention is that mind only exists, having refuted external objects.

original: zhes pa'o ; / dgongs pa'i khyad par 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o ; / dgongs pa'i khyad par 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question about the specific intention is:

original: yang 'dir mdo'i don ci zhig yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yang 'dir mdo'i don ci zhig yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What is the meaning of this sutra?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, in order to teach the answer, it says therefore it is explained and so on.

original: mngon gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon du gyur pa la mngon par phyogs @202b pas srid gsum ste /
analyzed: mngon gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon du gyur pa la mngon par phyogs @202b pas srid gsum ste /
translated: As for manifest and so on, it is because the bodhisattvas who are manifest are directed towards the three existences.

original: khams gsum sems tsam nyid du rtogs pa yin pas de la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum sems tsam nyid du rtogs pa yin pas de la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since it is realized that the three realms are mind only, that is the intended meaning.

original: de la dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning:

original: byang chub sems dpa' des byed pa po ni sems tsam yin par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des byed pa po ni sems tsam yin par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: That bodhisattva realizes that the creator is mind only.

original: ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
translated: How is that understood?

original: rtag bdag byed pa po bkag par rtogs phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag bdag byed pa po bkag par rtogs phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “because the permanent self is realized to be the creator.”

original: gzhan gyis bdag rtag pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i byed pa por 'dod pa de bkag nas sems nyid byed pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bdag rtag pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i byed pa por 'dod pa de bkag nas sems nyid byed pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Having refuted the assertion by others that the permanent self is the creator of virtue, nonvirtue, and so on, it is realized that mind alone is the creator.

original: 'di'i don ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa de phyi rol gyi don 'gegs pa pa la gzhol ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa de phyi rol gyi don 'gegs pa pa la gzhol ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is that the statement “the three realms are mind only” is not directed at refuting external objects.

original: 'on kyang bdag la sogs pa rnams byed pa po yin par bkag nas sems kho na byed pa por bstan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag la sogs pa rnams byed pa po yin par bkag nas sems kho na byed pa por bstan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: However, having refuted that the self and so on are the creator, it is taught that mind alone is the creator.

original: sems kho na byed pa po nyid du bstan par ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: sems kho na byed pa po nyid du bstan par ci ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that mind alone is taught to be the creator?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says:

original: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because in that very sūtra, it says,

original: lugs su byung ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: lugs su byung ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In the manner of the forward order, it says, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are actions; conditioned by actions, there is consciousness.”

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
translated: The mass of suffering is the collection of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ljon pa zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byin pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ljon pa zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byin pas so //
translated: The tree of suffering is the tree of suffering because it repeatedly produces the fruit of suffering.

original: byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams la bdag la sogs pa'i byed pa po gang yang med pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshor ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams la bdag la sogs pa'i byed pa po gang yang med pa dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshor ba po med pa'o //
translated: Without an agent and without a feeler means that in this mass of suffering, there is no agent whatsoever, such as a self, in relation to virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, and there is no feeler of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, such as Īśvara.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so sor khong du chud par byed pa po la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so sor khong du chud par byed pa po la'o //
translated: “That” refers to the one who understands dependent origination individually.

original: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas las rnams yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la sogs pa byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i tshe de la ltos nas bya ba 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas las rnams yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag la sogs pa byed pa po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i tshe de la ltos nas bya ba 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: “Actions would exist because of the adherence to an agent” means that if there were some agent such as a self, then in dependence on that, action would be engaged.

original: bya ba thams cad byed pa po la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad byed pa po la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all actions depend on an agent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “where there is no agent,” etc.

original: 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang bral ba'o //🔽rab tu phye ste zhes bya ba ni khams dang / @203a * //
analyzed: 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang bral ba'o // rab tu phye ste zhes bya ba ni khams dang / @203a * //
translated: “This is mind only” means that it is free from an agent and a feeler.

original: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: “Distinction” means the distinction of realms and migrations.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'dis ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa'i sgo nas sems kho na byed pa po nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'dis ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa'i sgo nas sems kho na byed pa po nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the conclusion that this sūtra teaches that only mind is the agent by way of refuting another agent,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, thus . . .”

original: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par nyams dga' ba 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam las so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par nyams dga' ba 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam las so //
translated: “Conventionally” means that from mere dependent arising, “If this exists, that arises,” is delightful when not analyzed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the definition of a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Awakening . . .” and so on.

original: de la bshad pa dang po'i sems pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam brjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bshad pa dang po'i sems pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam brjod par byed pa'o //
translated: With respect to that, in the first explanation, the term “thought” expresses intention.

original: gnyis pas ni yod pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni yod pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the second, it expresses existence.

original: gsum pas ni gang zag brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni gang zag brjod pa'o //
translated: In the third, it expresses a person.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i tshig bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa zhes bya ba ni tshig de mi mngon par byas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i tshig bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa zhes bya ba ni tshig de mi mngon par byas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The word “certainty” is the omitted middle term.🔽Having explained the meaning of the sutra,

original: mdo'i don bshad nas zhes bya ba ni sems byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: mdo'i don bshad nas zhes bya ba ni sems byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: the meaning of the verse is to be stated.

original: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni sems byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni sems byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: This very meaning is the meaning of the sutra.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir bdag la sogs pa bkag nas sems kho na byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir bdag la sogs pa bkag nas sems kho na byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, having refuted the self and so on, only the mind is the agent.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //🔽blo ni 'phel bya'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so // blo ni 'phel bya'i phyir /
translated: The wise ones are the bodhisattvas.🔽For the sake of increasing their intelligence,

original: zhes bya ba ni blo gros 'phel bar bya ba'i ched du'o //🔽mu stegs spo mthon ri 'joms zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa nyid spo mthon po'i ri yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo gros 'phel bar bya ba'i ched du'o // mu stegs spo mthon ri 'joms zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa nyid spo mthon po'i ri yin la /
translated: for the sake of increasing their wisdom.🔽The high mountain peak of the tirthikas is destroyed.

original: de 'joms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'joms par byed pa ste /
translated: It is that which destroys the high mountain peak of the tirthikas.

original: ci ltar thog gis ri bo 'joms par byed pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi rdo rjes mu stegs kyi spo mthon po'i ri bo 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar thog gis ri bo 'joms par byed pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi rdo rjes mu stegs kyi spo mthon po'i ri bo 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as lightning destroys a mountain, so the vajra of the Bhagavat's speech destroys the mountain of the high peak of the tirthikas.

original: gang las gsungs she na //
analyzed: gang las gsungs she na //
translated: From what is it said?

original: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said in the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra and so on.

original: yod pa bcad phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa yod pa nyid dgag pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: yod pa bcad phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa yod pa nyid dgag pa'i ched du'o //
translated: In order to eliminate existence means in order to refute the existence of the person and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gang zag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: This refers to the person and so on.

original: / gang zag ces bya ba ni gang phung po 'di dor nas phung po gzhan nye bar len pa'i gang zag ni yod pa yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: / gang zag ces bya ba ni gang phung po 'di dor nas phung po gzhan nye bar len pa'i gang zag ni yod pa yin no zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa lta bu'o /
translated: Person refers to the assertion by the Vaibhāṣikas that the person who abandons these aggregates and takes up other aggregates exists.

original: rgyun dang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: rgyun dang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun no //
translated: Stream refers to the stream of mind.

original: phung po dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Aggregates refers to form, feeling, and so on.

original: rkyen dang zhes bya ba @203b ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi'o //
analyzed: rkyen dang zhes bya ba @203b ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi'o //
translated: “Condition” refers to the four conditions, such as the causal condition.

original: rdul dag dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i dbyibs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdul dag dang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba'i dbyibs su gyur pa'o //
translated: “Atoms” refers to the shape that appears as blue, etc.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Primordial nature” refers to the nature that will be explained later.

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: “God” refers to the creator of the entire world.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byed pa po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that reason, “creator” is mentioned.

original: byed pa po zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes bya ba'i tshig ni thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “creator” should be applied to all.

original: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained that it is mind only.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di las gzhan pa'i byed pa po gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di las gzhan pa'i byed pa po gzhan med pas so //
translated: Since there is no other creator apart from this,

original: des na mdo gzhan du yang byed pa po gzhan bkag pas sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dag 'di ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mdo gzhan du yang byed pa po gzhan bkag pas sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dag 'di ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: therefore, in another sūtra, the creator is also refuted. Therefore, “mind only,” etc. This is the refutation of another creator.

original: phyi rol gyi don bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the refutation of external objects.

original: 'di'i don dgrol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di'i don dgrol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po nyid kyis so //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of this, the author of the treatise says:

original: de de las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: de de las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las so //
translated: “That” refers to the treatises of the Vaibhāṣikas and tīrthikas, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those” refers to the person, etc.

original: ji bzhin rang gis zhes bya ba ni grub mtha'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: ji bzhin rang gis zhes bya ba ni grub mtha'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: “Just as they are” means in accordance with their philosophical tenets.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those” refers to the person, etc.

original: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byed pa po nyid du ma gzigs nas 'jig rten gyi byed pa po ni sems tsam yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byed pa po nyid du ma gzigs nas 'jig rten gyi byed pa po ni sems tsam yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas, not seeing the person, etc. as agents, said that the agent in the world is mind only.

original: de la gang zag dang gtso bo dag ni phyis 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang gtso bo dag ni phyis 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The person and primal matter will be refuted later.

original: rgyun ni sems las tha dad du gyur pa mi snang ba'i phyir sems kyi bdag nyid can kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyun ni sems las tha dad du gyur pa mi snang ba'i phyir sems kyi bdag nyid can kho na yin no //
translated: The continuum is only of the nature of mind, because it does not appear to be different from mind.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par shes pa med na mi snang ba'i phyir sems kyi bdag nyid can kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par shes pa med na mi snang ba'i phyir sems kyi bdag nyid can kho na'o //
translated: The form aggregate is the nature of mind alone, because it does not appear without consciousness.

original: gzhan rnams ni sems las byung ba'i khongs su 'dus pas so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni sems las byung ba'i khongs su 'dus pas so //
translated: The others are included in mental factors.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa ni btags pa tsam yin pas so //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa ni btags pa tsam yin pas so //
translated: The non-associated are mere imputations.

original: rkyen nyid kyang sems kho na yin te /
analyzed: rkyen nyid kyang sems kho na yin te /
translated: The conditions are mind alone.

original: de'i stobs kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par gzhag pa byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par gzhag pa byed pas so //
translated: Because virtue and nonvirtue are posited by the power of that.

original: rdul rnams kyang phyogs cha'i dbye bas brtags na mi 'thad pa'i phyir sems kho na byed pa po nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdul rnams kyang phyogs cha'i dbye bas brtags na mi 'thad pa'i phyir sems kho na byed pa po nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is untenable to impute particles by dividing them into parts, mind alone is taught to be the agent. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir yang don dam pa'i sems ni byed pa por gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang don dam pa'i sems ni byed pa por gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here also, the ultimate mind is not the agent.

original: 'on kyang gang zag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i ched du de ltar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zag la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i ched du de ltar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: However, it is taught in that way for the purpose of abandoning clinging to persons and so on.

original: gzhan du na bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba @204a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba @204a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the statement, “Not from self.”

original: la sogs pas sems kyang ma grub pas de skad du ji ltar brjod par bya /
analyzed: la sogs pas sems kyang ma grub pas de skad du ji ltar brjod par bya /
translated: and so on, since mind is not established, how could it be said to be that?

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni phal che ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni phal che ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “the tīrthikas” is stated from the perspective of the majority.

original: phal cher de rnams kyis gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: phal cher de rnams kyis gang zag la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: For the most part, they teach the person and so on.

original: gzhan du na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis kyang gang zag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: gzhan du na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis kyang gang zag byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pas mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ci ltar brjod /
translated: Otherwise, since the Vaibhāṣikas also accept the person as the agent, how could they be called “the tīrthikas”?

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos 'di bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang mu stegs pa rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir de dag kyang mu stegs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos 'di bdag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang mu stegs pa rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir de dag kyang mu stegs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For that reason, the root text says, “We also do not accept that.”🔽The phrase “in one sense” is stated because the Vaibhāṣikas are similar to the tīrthikas.

original: don phyin ci ma log par khong du ma chud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par khong du ma chud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are tīrthikas, the root text says, “because they do not understand the meaning correctly.”

original: gang zag la sogs pa rnams rigs pas ma grub pa'i phyir drang ba'i don du bstan pa ma rtogs nas de dag ni don dam pa nyid du btags pas so //🔽khyab par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyang mu stegs pa rnams dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa rnams rigs pas ma grub pa'i phyir drang ba'i don du bstan pa ma rtogs nas de dag ni don dam pa nyid du btags pas so // khyab par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyang mu stegs pa rnams dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the person and so on are not established by reasoning.🔽It is the pervader alone, because the Buddhists are similar to the tīrthikas.

original: nges par bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis so //
analyzed: nges par bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis so //
translated: This is the teaching,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che'i phreng ba las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che'i phreng ba las so //
translated: as it is said in the Ratnāvalī, in the section on advice to the king.

original: gang zag phung po smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos 'di yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag phung po smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos 'di yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The person is the proponent of the aggregates, and so on. This is the uncommon teaching that all with reference points are the same.

original: de la grangs can ni grangs kyi bstan bcos kha ton byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la grangs can ni grangs kyi bstan bcos kha ton byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the Sāṃkhya are those who recite the Sāṃkhya treatise.

original: 'ug phrug ces bya ba ni 'ug pa'i slob ma ste bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: 'ug phrug ces bya ba ni 'ug pa'i slob ma ste bye brag pa'o //
translated: The so-called owl-pupils are the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: gang zag dang phung por smra ba ni gang zag phung por smra ba ste bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang zag dang phung por smra ba ni gang zag phung por smra ba ste bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The proponents of the person and the aggregates are the proponents of the person and the aggregates, such as the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: de dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa dag las 'das pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid yod dam med ces dris shig dang smra'am ste smra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa dag las 'das pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid yod dam med ces dris shig dang smra'am ste smra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Ask those who have a worldly view that includes those, “Does the reality that is beyond existence and nonexistence and free from the two extremes exist or not?” They will not say anything. This is the meaning.

original: gal te grangs can la sogs pas ci'i phyir mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te grangs can la sogs pas ci'i phyir mi brjod ce na /
translated: If it is asked why the Sāṃkhya and so on do not speak,

original: gang gi phyir re zhig grangs can pa rnams skyes bu dang rang bzhin dag yod pa nyid khas len cing sa la sogs pa rnams bskal pa chen po'i bar du yod pa nyid dang / de'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid du khas len pa 'ug phrug pas kyang rdul phra rab gcig dang gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas byas pa'i bum @204b pa la sogs pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig grangs can pa rnams skyes bu dang rang bzhin dag yod pa nyid khas len cing sa la sogs pa rnams bskal pa chen po'i bar du yod pa nyid dang / de'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid du khas len pa 'ug phrug pas kyang rdul phra rab gcig dang gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas byas pa'i bum @204b pa la sogs pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
translated: The Aulūkyas assert that pots and so on are both existent and nonexistent in terms of the stages of one or two subtle particles.

original: gos med pas kyang thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa dang thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: gos med pas kyang thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa dang thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
translated: The Nirgranthas assert that everything is the self of everything and that everything is not the self of everything.

original: de bzhin srog ni yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin srog ni yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: They assert that the life force exists

original: gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: and that other things do not exist.

original: gang zag dang phung por smra ba dag gis ci gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du khas len pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni med pa yin zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang phung por smra ba dag gis ci gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa yod pa nyid du khas len pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni med pa yin zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: The proponents of the person and the proponents of the aggregates say, The person and the aggregates, etc. do exist, but the past and future do not exist.

original: de ltar yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas dris shig ces smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas dris shig ces smos pa yin no //
translated: Thinking, Nothing exists that transcends existence and nonexistence, he said, Ask!

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
translated: Because of this, means because of the reason just stated.

original: yod med las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yod med las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: Transcending existence and nonexistence means transcending the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: 'chi med ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'chi ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'chi med ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'chi ba med pa yin la /
translated: Immortality is nirvana, which is deathless.

original: de thob par byed pa'i thabs yin pas na bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i thabs yin pas na bstan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since the teaching is the means for attaining it, it is called the teaching of immortality.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Profound means that it cannot be understood by the tirthikas.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni blang bya dang dor bya dag blang ba dang dor bar ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni blang bya dang dor bya dag blang ba dang dor bar ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The teaching is that which teaches what is to be taken up and what is to be put aside, and that one should take up and put aside.

original: chos kyi khud pa yin shes kyis //
analyzed: chos kyi khud pa yin shes kyis //
translated: One should know the Dharma as the guide.

original: zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: One should know it as the uncommon.🔽One should know it as the outsider.

original: phyi rol pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni mu stegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni mu stegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should say that those who are attached to the aggregates, etc. are tīrthikas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyis zhes rtsa ba'i tshig gis bstan pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyis zhes rtsa ba'i tshig gis bstan pas so //
translated: Therefore,

original: 'o na mu stegs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mu stegs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the tīrthikas?

original: 'khor ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra says, “This saṃsāra . . .”

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa byed pa po'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Imagination is the characteristic of the agent of the aggregates, etc.

original: 'di ni rtog pa rnams kyang srid par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa rnams kyang srid par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: This shows that the imagination also exists in saṃsāra.

original: da ni rtog pa 'di rnams da lta yang yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtog pa 'di rnams da lta yang yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that these thoughts exist even now,

original: 'di ltar da lta nyid du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar da lta nyid du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In this way, even now…”

original: dge slong skya bseng la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i dge slong rnams la'o //
analyzed: dge slong skya bseng la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni gcer bu pa'i dge slong rnams la'o //
translated: “To the naked ascetics, the monks, etc.” refers to the naked ascetic monks.

original: byed pa po gzhan bkag pas zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams byed pa po nyid bkag pas so //🔽don byas zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @205a * //
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan bkag pas zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa rnams byed pa po nyid bkag pas so // don byas zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @205a * //
translated: “By refuting another agent” means by refuting the aggregates, etc. as the agent.

original: dgos pa bsgrubs zin pas so //
analyzed: dgos pa bsgrubs zin pas so //
translated: “Because the purpose has been accomplished” means because the purpose has been accomplished.

original: tsam gyi sgras zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa 'jig rten byed pa por gsungs zhes bya ba 'dir tsam gyi sgra gang smos pa des so //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras zhes bya ba ni sems tsam pa 'jig rten byed pa por gsungs zhes bya ba 'dir tsam gyi sgra gang smos pa des so //
translated: “By the word ‘only’” refers to the word “only” in the statement, “Mind only is taught as the creator of the world.”

original: shes bya 'gog par mi nus par brjod nas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa'i dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya 'gog par mi nus par brjod nas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po gzhan bkag pa'i dgos pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “After stating that the object of cognition cannot be refuted” means because there is a purpose in refuting another agent.

original: rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras sems gtso bo nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras sems gtso bo nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: In another way, also means that the word only indicates that mind is primary.

original: phyi rol 'gog par mi srid par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras sems gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol 'gog par mi srid par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras sems gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that it is impossible to refute external objects, means that the word only indicates that mind is primary.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that very point,

original: de nyid rtogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid rtogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, One who realizes thatness, etc.

original: ci ltar tshig snga ma mi mngon par byas pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khams gsum na sems gtso bo yin pas tshig phyi ma mi mngon par byas nas brjod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar tshig snga ma mi mngon par byas pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang khams gsum na sems gtso bo yin pas tshig phyi ma mi mngon par byas nas brjod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as, by making the previous word indistinct, one says Buddha for one who realizes thatness, so here also, by making the subsequent word indistinct, one says only because mind is primary in the three realms.

original: gzugs ni 'dir 'gog pa dang de ltar mdo'i don ma yin zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras ni phyi rol gyi don 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'dir 'gog pa dang de ltar mdo'i don ma yin zhes bya ba ni tsam gyi sgras ni phyi rol gyi don 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here form is refuted, and that is not the meaning of the sutra.  means that the word only does not refute external objects.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Just as, etc.”

original: gzhan gtso bo yin pa bkag nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gtso bo yin pa bkag nas so //
analyzed: gzhan gtso bo yin pa bkag nas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gtso bo yin pa bkag nas so //
translated: Having refuted the other, i.e., form, etc., as primary,

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam pa ste zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam pa ste zhes bya bas so //
translated: “This” refers to “this world is mind-only.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the mode of the non-denial of form, etc.,

original: sems tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Mind-only, etc.”

original: yod pa nyid 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //🔽de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems gtso bo nyid bstan pa'i don du yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa nyid 'gog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams so // de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems gtso bo nyid bstan pa'i don du yin gyi /
translated: “Existence is not denied” refers to form, etc.

original: gzugs dgag pa'i don du ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs dgag pa'i don du ni ma yin pas so //
translated: “Likewise” means that the teaching of the primacy of mind is not for the purpose of denying form,🔽but for the purpose of teaching the primacy of mind.

original: khyod kyi lugs ltar zhes bya ba ni gzugs bkag nas sems tsam zhig yod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs ltar zhes bya ba ni gzugs bkag nas sems tsam zhig yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “In your system” refers to the assertion of the existence of mind-only, having denied form.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
translated: “In that case,” i.e., according to the sutra,

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni khams gsum mo //
translated: “These” refers to the three realms.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo de nyid las sems ma rig pa dang 'du byed las skye ba ci'i phyir gsungs zhes pa'o //🔽'di'i don ni gal te don dam par 'gyur na de'i tshe rang bzhin gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir gti mug dang las la ltos par mi 'gyur ba yin pa las ltos pa nyid kyang @205b yin pas des na rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo de nyid las sems ma rig pa dang 'du byed las skye ba ci'i phyir gsungs zhes pa'o // 'di'i don ni gal te don dam par 'gyur na de'i tshe rang bzhin gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir gti mug dang las la ltos par mi 'gyur ba yin pa las ltos pa nyid kyang @205b yin pas des na rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid kyis
translated: “Again” and so on means that the same sutra says that consciousness arises from ignorance and karmic predispositions.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If it were ultimate, then at that time, since its nature would not depend on anything else, it would not depend on delusion and karma. But since it does depend on them, it is established that consciousness does not exist inherently.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The noble ones” and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Not by virtue of its own characteristic” means that it does not exist inherently without depending on anything else.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that in more detail, he says,🔽“The eye is not the self” and so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If, etc.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is nescience.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Formations have the character of virtue, nonvirtue, and so on.

original: phyin ci log gi rkyen yod na yod pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rkyen yod na yod pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they exist when the conditions of error exist, they do not exist inherently without depending on others.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni mdo las so //
translated: As it is said means as it is said in the scriptures.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas so //
translated: Thus means in the manner that will be explained.

original: lugs su byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma rig pa dang las kyi mtshan nyid can phyin ci log gi rkyen yod na rnam par shes pa yod pas so ;
analyzed: lugs su byung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma rig pa dang las kyi mtshan nyid can phyin ci log gi rkyen yod na rnam par shes pa yod pas so ;
translated: The consciousness that occurs in sequence exists when the conditions of error exist, which have the character of ignorance and karma.

original: / ma rig pas byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: / ma rig pas byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Created by ignorance means arisen from ignorance.

original: las kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: las kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Karma has the character of virtue, nonvirtue, and the unshakable.

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin par bya ba yin pas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin par bya ba yin pas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “maturation” is a verbal noun formed from the verbal root “to mature” (pāc).

original: sems dang po ni zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sems dang po ni zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems so //
translated: The first moment of consciousness is the consciousness that links one life to another.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba len pa'i phung po bzhi ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba len pa'i phung po bzhi ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can rnams so //
translated: The four aggregates that arise simultaneously with consciousness are the aggregates of feeling, perception, disposition, and form.

original: de la ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams yin la /
analyzed: de la ming ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams yin la /
translated: Name refers to the four aggregates that are formless.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //🔽ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams 'phel ba las yid kyi skye mched yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o // ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams 'phel ba las yid kyi skye mched yin la /
translated: Form refers to the aggregate of form.

original: gzugs kyi phung po rnam par 'phel ba las mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po rnam par 'phel ba las mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga'o //
translated: The expansion of name and form is the six sense bases. The six sense bases are the sense base of the mental faculty, which is the expansion of the formless aggregates, and the five sense bases of the eyes, etc., which are the expansion of the aggregate of form.

original: dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa ni reg pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa ni reg pa yin te /
translated: Contact, etc. means that the coming together of the three, i.e., sense faculty, object, and consciousness, is contact.

original: gang yod na gsum phan tshun mngon par phyogs pas phrad pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de ni reg pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang yod na gsum phan tshun mngon par phyogs pas phrad pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de ni reg pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since the three mutually approach and come together when it exists, it is contact.

original: srid pa'i rkyen tshor ba'i rgyu yin pas reg pa de yang zag pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni @206a * //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen tshor ba'i rgyu yin pas reg pa de yang zag pa dang bcas pa'o // reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni @206a * //
translated: Since the condition of existence is the cause of feeling, that contact is also contaminated.🔽Feeling is that which arises simultaneously with contact.

original: tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Since contact and feeling are co-arisen causes,🔽Craving is attachment to feeling.

original: tshor ba las chags pa ni sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa rnams la mi 'bral ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba las chags pa ni sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba la sogs pa rnams la mi 'bral ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Since craving for pleasant, etc., feeling is manifest attachment to non-separation, etc., it is craving.🔽Clinging is the increase of craving.

original: sred pa rnam par 'phel ba ni len pa'o zhes bya ba ni sred pa de rab tu son pa ni len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa rnam par 'phel ba ni len pa'o zhes bya ba ni sred pa de rab tu son pa ni len pa'o //
translated: Since that craving is fully developed, it is clinging.

original: len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis yang srid pa len pas na srid pa'o //
analyzed: len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis yang srid pa len pas na srid pa'o //
translated: Existence is the karma that is produced by grasping and that is accompanied by the outflows.

original: las kyi rgyu mthun pa ni skye zhes bya ba ni las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ma 'ongs pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: las kyi rgyu mthun pa ni skye zhes bya ba ni las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ma 'ongs pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o ;
translated: Birth is the karma-result of karma.

original: / skye ba ste zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni phung po 'byung ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / skye ba ste zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni phung po 'byung ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Birth is the arising of the aggregates.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa ni zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du skad cig ma khyad par can skye bas rnyings par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa ni zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du skad cig ma khyad par can skye bas rnyings par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Aging is the maturing of the aggregates.

original: rgas pa'i phung po 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba ni phung po rnyings nas 'jig par 'gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgas pa'i phung po 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba ni phung po rnyings nas 'jig par 'gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Death is the destruction of the aged aggregates.

original: chags pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bgad pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtse ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bgad pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtse ba la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: With attachment is the attachment to former laughter, joy, and play.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni snying la gdung ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni snying la gdung ba skyes pa'o //
translated: “Arisen from grief” means that the heart is tormented.

original: tshig brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yul dor nas gang zhig tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig brjod pa ni zhes bya ba ni yul dor nas gang zhig tu 'gro bar 'gyur zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: “The utterance of words” means that, having abandoned the object, one says, “Where can I go?”

original: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The impairment of the five senses” means the impairment of the five senses.

original: yid kyi lta ba nyams su bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni yid kho na lta ba yin te nges pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: yid kyi lta ba nyams su bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni yid kho na lta ba yin te nges pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: “The impairment of the mental view” means that the mind itself is the view, because it has the nature of certainty.

original: de'i nyams su bab pa ni mi gsal ba ste yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nyams su bab pa ni mi gsal ba ste yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: “Its impairment” means that it is unclear, and that is mental dissatisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang pos sems 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrug pa ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang pos sems 'khrug pa ste /
translated: “The arising of much suffering and mental dissatisfaction” means that the mind is disturbed by much suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: sems nyam chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyam chung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mind becomes weak.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Alone” means without a self, and so on.

original: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni yan lag so so'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan nas da ni yan lag so so'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the characteristics of the twelve members, now, in order to teach the result of each member,

original: de la ma rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therein, ignorance is the cause of the members of action,🔽and it is also the cause of the members of affliction.”

original: bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bya ba gnyis byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bya ba gnyis byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is present as two actions means it performs two actions.

original: bya ba gnyis po de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba gnyis po de bstan pa ni /
translated: The two actions are taught:

original: sems can rnams @206b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ma rig pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa rnams ci lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams @206b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ma rig pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa rnams ci lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa'o //
translated: It causes sentient beings to not know reality.

original: rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni las bskyed pa'i don du bag chags kyi mtshan nyid can gyi nus pa gtod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni las bskyed pa'i don du bag chags kyi mtshan nyid can gyi nus pa gtod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It also produces the cause means it deposits the potency characterized by the latent impressions for the sake of generating karma.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang 'grub par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mig la sogs pa de rnams 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang 'grub par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mig la sogs pa de rnams 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: It also establishes future karmic maturation.

original: rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //🔽srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod pa la sogs par nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o // srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod pa la sogs par nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: It also produces a cause, as before.🔽It also produces rebirth-linking.

original: phan tshun brten pa yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhi phan tshun gyi stobs kyis gnas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhi phan tshun gyi stobs kyis gnas pa yin pas so //
translated: It also produces mutual support, because the four aggregates exist by the power of each other.

original: rang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug po rnams kyis phan tshun yul nyams su myong ba med pas so //
analyzed: rang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug po rnams kyis phan tshun yul nyams su myong ba med pas so //
translated: It also reveals the differentiation of its own object, because the six sense spheres do not experience each other’s objects.

original: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la mngon par phyogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la mngon par phyogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It also causes contact with the object means it causes the object to be directly perceived.

original: gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba myong bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba dag las rnam par grol ba ste btang snyoms pa myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba myong bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba dag las rnam par grol ba ste btang snyoms pa myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the experience of complete liberation from both means it causes the experience of equanimity, which is complete liberation from both the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la kun tu chags par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni chags pa skye ba'i rgyu la chags pa skye bar yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la kun tu chags par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni chags pa skye ba'i rgyu la chags pa skye bar yang byed pa'o //
translated: It causes attachment to things that arouse passion means it causes the generation of passion in regard to the cause of the generation of passion.

original: srid pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gnas par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni srid par mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams nye bar gnas par byed pa'o //🔽gong ma lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gnas par byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni srid par mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams nye bar gnas par byed pa'o //🔽gong ma lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the continuation of the other realms of existence means it causes the continuation of the realms of existence in the world of desire and so on.🔽It causes the continuation of the other realms of existence like the above means it causes the continuation of the other realms of existence in the world of form and the formless world.

original: dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams gzhan du 'gyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: It also causes the faculties to change” means it causes the faculties such as the eyes to change.

original: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni phung po 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni phung po 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: “ It also causes the formations to perish” means it causes the aggregates to perish.

original: yongs su mi shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: “ It also causes the cause of the uninterrupted continuity of ignorance” means it causes the uninterrupted continuity of ignorance.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lugs las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lugs las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan nas /
translated: “ Such things” refers to the summary of the aspects of dependent origination in the forward order.

original: da ni lugs las bzlog pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de ltar ri @207a * //
analyzed: da ni lugs las bzlog pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de ltar ri @207a * //
translated: Now, in order to teach the aspects of dependent origination in the reverse order,

original: zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said:🔽“If that does not exist, this does not occur.

original: de med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa med pa na'o //
analyzed: de med pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa med pa na'o //
translated: “ If that does not exist” means if ignorance and so on do not exist.

original: de yang med pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang med pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
