translated: Moreover, “non-existence” refers to the formative forces and so on.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to teach this in detail, he says:🔽“Through the cessation of ignorance, the formative forces cease.”

original: rkyen ma rig pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ma rig pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is: “Through the non-existence of the condition, ignorance, the formative forces do not exist.”

original: nye bar zhi zhing zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rten pa med pa'i zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi zhing zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rten pa med pa'i zhes pa'o //
translated: The explanation of “they are completely pacified” is: “they are non-existent because they are not dependent.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He thinks” refers to what is stated below.

original: 'du ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang phrad pa las so //
analyzed: 'du ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang phrad pa las so //
translated: “The conditioned originates from a combination” means from the contact with a cause.

original: bral ba las ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang ma phrad pa las zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba las ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang ma phrad pa las zhes pa'o //
translated: “From a separation” means from the non-contact with a cause.

original: rgyu gcig pu'i stobs las 'dus byas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gcig pu'i stobs las 'dus byas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the conditioned does not originate through the power of a single cause, he says:

original: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
translated: “The conditioned arises from a collection” is stated.

original: gcig ni gang gis yang skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig ni gang gis yang skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One does not cause generation by any means,

original: 'on kyang tshogs las skyed par byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs las skyed par byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: but rather, by the mode of generation from a collection.

original: nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po'i skyon gyis skyon dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa mang po'i skyon gyis skyon dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Having the fault of many problems” means having the fault of many problems such as arising.

original: 'du ba 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu log pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu rnams ldog pa yin te gzhan du na 'dus byas nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa de bzlog par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: 'du ba 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu log pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu rnams ldog pa yin te gzhan du na 'dus byas nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa de bzlog par mi nus pas so //
translated: “This collection” and so on means that the results are reversed by the reversal of the cause, because otherwise the conditioned having the fault of many problems could not be reversed.

original: 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba thob par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams shin tu log na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba thob par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams shin tu log na /
translated: “One should not cause the complete pacification of formations” means that if formations are completely reversed,

original: sems can gyi don byed par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: the benefit of sentient beings would not be accomplished.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “in order to ripen sentient beings.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The passage beginning O sons of the Conqueror!

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The it refers to the bodhisattva.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The compounded refers to the aspect of the compounded.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang zhes pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang zhes pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of without an intrinsic nature is

original: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: unborn and unceasing.

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis sems skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis sems skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: This means that the mind arises through causes and conditions,

original: de med na ni mi skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //🔽des na gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir sems la ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na ni mi skye ba yin no zhes pa'o // des na gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir sems la ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: and that if those do not exist, it does not arise.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the mind lacks an intrinsic nature because it depends on something else.🔽The passage beginning Therefore...

original: de nyid las gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las @207b so ;
analyzed: de nyid las gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las @207b so ;
translated: The just that refers to the Ten Levels Sutra.

original: / rdzas su yod pa zhes bya ba ni sems don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: / rdzas su yod pa zhes bya ba ni sems don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The substantial existence means that the mind exists ultimately.

original: de ni lta bar byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dag tu ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni lta bar byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dag tu ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is the view, that is the view of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni gang yod pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever exists by intrinsic reality

original: de med min pas rtag pa yin //
analyzed: de med min pas rtag pa yin //
translated: Does not become nonexistent, and so is eternal.

original: sngar byung da ltar yod min pa //
analyzed: sngar byung da ltar yod min pa //
translated: What existed before and does not exist now

original: de ni chad par 'gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de ni chad par 'gyur pa yin //
translated: That is nihilism.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: sems kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The mind is the chief, etc.

original: sems can 'jig rten dang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba de dang de rnams su sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas na sems can zhes bya la 'jig pa'i phyir na 'jig rten te /
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten dang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba de dang de rnams su sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas na sems can zhes bya la 'jig pa'i phyir na 'jig rten te /
translated: The world of sentient beings is so called because of the experience of suffering in this and that world.

original: sems can yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin pas sems can gyi 'jig rten te 'jig par 'gyur ba 'gro ba lnga po rnams su sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin pas sems can gyi 'jig rten te 'jig par 'gyur ba 'gro ba lnga po rnams su sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The world of sentient beings is that which is both a sentient being and a world. It is the five destinies, which are the basis for the experience of suffering. It is synonymous with the five aggregates.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The world of the environment is that which serves as the basis for the world of sentient beings.

original: shin tu sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: shin tu sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: It is extremely diverse, due to the distinctions of realm, destiny, rebirth, and so on.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, it is said:

original: 'gro ba ma lus las las skye bar gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus las las skye bar gsungs // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: All destinies are said to arise from karma.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams las las skye bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams las las skye bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: All destinies included in the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment are said to arise from karma.

original: gal te las las skye bar gsungs na sems las skye bar ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te las las skye bar gsungs na sems las skye bar ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If it is said that they arise from karma, how can it be said that they arise from mind?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: sems spangs nas ni las kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: sems spangs nas ni las kyang yod ma yin //
translated: Apart from mind, there is no karma, either intention or that which is done by the force of intention.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las dang sems pas byas pa'i las dag yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa'i sems pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las dang sems pas byas pa'i las dag yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Apart from mind, there is no karma that has the nature of intention, nor is there any karma that is done by the force of intention.

original: des na sems kho nas 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba de la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na sems kho nas 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba de la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is an error in the statement that mind alone is the seed.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: In that regard, etc.

original: / de la zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi nang nas so //
analyzed: / de la zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi nang nas so //
translated: In that regard means in the midst of the world of sentient beings and the world of the container.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chu dang / sa dang ri rab la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chu dang / sa dang ri rab la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “wind-disk” and so on include water, earth, Mount Meru, and so on.🔽The words “birds, etc.” include parrots and so on.

original: bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ne tso la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽mdongs la sogs pa zhes @208a * //
analyzed: bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ne tso la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽mdongs la sogs pa zhes @208a * //
translated: The words “eyes, etc.”

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gshog pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gshog pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include the various wings and so on.

original: las thun mong ma yin pas bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rma bya la sogs pa rnams kyis skye ba snga ma la thun mong ma yin pa'i las rang gi rgyu kho na las 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i las gang byas pa des bskyed pa yin te
analyzed: las thun mong ma yin pas bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rma bya la sogs pa rnams kyis skye ba snga ma la thun mong ma yin pa'i las rang gi rgyu kho na las 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i las gang byas pa des bskyed pa yin te
translated: Generated by uncommon karma means that the various birds and so on are generated by karma that is not common to all, that is, by karma that is the cause of their birth and that produces its effect from its own cause alone.

original: de las gzhan du med pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan du med pas so //
translated: They are not generated by other karma.

original: sems can thams cad kyi las thun mong bas bskyed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi dga' ba'i rgyu yin pas nye bar spyad par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi las thun mong bas bskyed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi dga' ba'i rgyu yin pas nye bar spyad par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Generated by the common karma of all sentient beings means that they are generated by the karma common to all sentient beings because they are objects of use that are the cause of pleasure for all.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rnams kyi gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i las las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rnams kyi gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i las las skyes pa yin la /
translated: The same should be understood for other things means that the various forms of men and so on are generated from uncommon karma.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi skam pa dang gsher ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa rnams ni las thun mong bas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi skam pa dang gsher ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa rnams ni las thun mong bas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The various things such as earth, etc., are produced by common karma.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las thun mong bas bskyed pa'i khungs ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni las thun mong bas bskyed pa'i khungs ston pa'o //
translated: As it is said, etc. shows the source of the production by common karma.

original: dus su skyes zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dus su skyes zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las byung ba'o //
translated: Born in time means arising from the distinction of time.

original: nag po zhes bya ba ni ri'o //
analyzed: nag po zhes bya ba ni ri'o //
translated: Black means mountain.

original: sems dmyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dmyal ba ni ral gri lo ma'i nags la sogs pa'i mtshon la sogs pa dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du ni dga' ba'i tshal la sogs pa'i rin po che'i shing la sogs pa ni sems can gyi las dbang gis byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems dmyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dmyal ba ni ral gri lo ma'i nags la sogs pa'i mtshon la sogs pa dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du ni dga' ba'i tshal la sogs pa'i rin po che'i shing la sogs pa ni sems can gyi las dbang gis byung ba'o //
translated: Hell, etc. The weapons, etc., of the sword-leafed forest, etc., are produced by the power of the karma of sentient beings in the higher world.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ro myags kyi 'dam dang rkang pa gzhag cing bteg na 'phar zhing ni ma byed pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ro myags kyi 'dam dang rkang pa gzhag cing bteg na 'phar zhing ni ma byed pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The swamp of putrid corpses and the ground that rises and falls when the foot is placed on it and lifted up are included by the word, etc.

original: 'gro ba ma lus zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyis bsdus pa dag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus zhes bya ba ni sems can dang snod kyis bsdus pa dag go //
translated: “All beings” refers to those included in the container world and those included in the world of sentient beings.

original: las kyang sems la brten pa yin te zhes bya ba ni las ni 'di bzhin du bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: las kyang sems la brten pa yin te zhes bya ba ni las ni 'di bzhin du bya'o snyam pa'i sems pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Karma is also based on mind. Karma is of the nature of intention, the thought “I will do this.”

original: sems pa yang sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir las ni sems la brten pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa yang sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir las ni sems la brten pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And intention is associated with mind. Therefore, karma is based on mind.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽las sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems pas byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lus dang ngag gi las sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / las sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems pas byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lus dang ngag gi las sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “accompanied by mind,” and so on.🔽Because it is produced by intention, it is karma. Because it is produced by intention, it is karma.

original: las med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las dang sems pas byas pa'i las dag med pas so //
analyzed: las med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rang bzhin can gyi las dang sems pas byas pa'i las dag med pas so //
translated: Because there is no karma, there is no karma. Because there is no karma that is of the nature of intention and because there is no karma that is produced by intention,

original: de'i @208b phyir zhes bya ba ni sems med na las med pas so //
analyzed: de'i @208b phyir zhes bya ba ni sems med na las med pas so //
translated: therefore, because there is no mind, there is no karma.

original: gzhan ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “No other” means that it is not form.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Why?” and so on.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la'o //
translated: There means in form.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la byed pa po mi srid pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gzugs la byed pa po mi srid pas so //
translated: Therefore means because it is impossible for form to be an agent.

original: sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba ni sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po gtso bo la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba ni sems las gzhan pa'i byed pa po gtso bo la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: An agent other than mind refers to the pradhāna and so on, which are agents other than mind.

original: gzugs ni bkag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba des ni gzugs bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: gzugs ni bkag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba des ni gzugs bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: Form is not refuted means that by the statement, “The three realms are mind only,” form is not refuted.

original: / de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Here” and so on.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Here means in the context of an agent.

original: kha cig gis ni zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa ste /
translated: Some say that the self is the creator, such as the Sāṃkhyas.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The term “primal nature” and so on includes Īśvara and so on.

original: kha cig gis ni sems la 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sems la 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Some say that the mind is the creator.

original: gzugs byed pa po ma yin pa la yang rtsod pa med de zhes bya ba ni gzugs bem po yin pa'i phyir gnyis kas kyang byed pa po nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs byed pa po ma yin pa la yang rtsod pa med de zhes bya ba ni gzugs bem po yin pa'i phyir gnyis kas kyang byed pa po nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no dispute that form is not the creator, because both Buddhists and non-Buddhists do not accept that form is the creator, because form is matter.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The term “its characteristics” refers to the characteristics of the primal nature and so on.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas kyi yul zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas kyi yul zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “the domain of dispute” refers to the primal nature and so on.

original: 'das sogs zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid des gtso bo la sogs pa dor nas sems kho na la gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'das sogs zhes bya ba ni byed pa po nyid des gtso bo la sogs pa dor nas sems kho na la gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The term “past and so on” means that by that very creator, having abandoned the primal nature and so on, one should abide only in the mind.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of that,🔽he says:

original: yul gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: yul gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The verse beginning with “One who desires to rule over one country” explains this.

original: yul gcig la dbang byed par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni yul gcig gi rgyal po byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yul gcig la dbang byed par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni yul gcig gi rgyal po byed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “One who desires to rule over one country” means one who desires to be the king of one country.

original: dgra zla gcig bton nas zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzhan phyung nas so //
analyzed: dgra zla gcig bton nas zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzhan phyung nas so //
translated: “Having expelled one rival” means having expelled another king.

original: rang gi yul thob cing zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul du rgyal srid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul thob cing zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul du rgyal srid thob pa'o //
translated: “Having obtained one’s own country” means having obtained the kingdom in one’s own country.

original: de bzhin du sems dang gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa nyid du brjod pa las gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag nas sems kho na byed pa po nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa nyid du brjod pa las gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag nas sems kho na byed pa po nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, mind and so on are said to be the agent. Having refuted the status of the agent of such things as the primal substance, only mind remains as the agent.

original: gnyis pa la nye bar mkho ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la nye bar mkho ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the second verse, the verse beginning with “The two kings” explains this.

original: rgyal po gnyis ka la 'phangs rnams mkho ba yin pas /
analyzed: rgyal po gnyis ka la 'phangs rnams mkho ba yin pas /
translated: Since the people are needed by both kings,

original: rgyal po gnyis kas de rnams la gnod pa mi byed pas @209a * //
analyzed: rgyal po gnyis kas de rnams la gnod pa mi byed pas @209a * //
translated: neither king harms them.

original: so ; / don bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so ; / don bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the meaning, he says “The same is true” and so on.

original: gnyis ka la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems byed pa por 'dod pa dang / gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa por 'dod pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems byed pa por 'dod pa dang / gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa por 'dod pa dag la'o //
translated: Because it is necessary for both, i.e., for those who assert that mind is the agent and for those who assert that prakriti, etc. are the agent.

original: gzugs yod pa nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conclusion of the existence of form, he says: therefore, etc.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sems tsam zhes bya ba de tsam gyi sgras gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa po nyid du bkag pa yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sems tsam zhes bya ba de tsam gyi sgras gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa po nyid du bkag pa yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In the manner in which it has been taught means that by the word “only” in “mind only,” prakriti, etc. are refuted as agents, but not form.

original: lnga char yod ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga char yod ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five are existent means form, feeling, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa'i de nyid las zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i de nyid las zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: From mundane reality means from conventional truth.

original: de nyid ye shes 'char bar 'dod pa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa la'o //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes 'char bar 'dod pa na zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa la'o //
translated: When the arising of the intuition of reality is desired means when non-conceptual intuition is produced.

original: 'byung mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang du yang snang ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'byung mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang du yang snang ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “They do not occur” means that they do not appear as any nature, such as existent or nonexistent.

original: / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbu ma pas sems tsam pa rnams la gdams ngag nye bar 'bogs pa yin te /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbu ma pas sems tsam pa rnams la gdams ngag nye bar 'bogs pa yin te /
translated: “Therefore” and so on indicate the Madhyamaka’s advice to the Proponents of Mind Only.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de kun rdzob tu phung po lnga yod pas so //🔽gzugs med na ni sems yod ma 'dzin cig / ces bya ba ni yul med na yul can med pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de kun rdzob tu phung po lnga yod pas so // gzugs med na ni sems yod ma 'dzin cig / ces bya ba ni yul med na yul can med pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because the five aggregates exist conventionally.🔽“If form does not exist, do not grasp mind as existent” means that if the object does not exist, the subject does not exist.

original: sems yod nyid na'ang gzugs med ma 'dzin cig / ces bya ba ni gzugs mi rigs na sems yod pa nyid kyang mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: sems yod nyid na'ang gzugs med ma 'dzin cig / ces bya ba ni gzugs mi rigs na sems yod pa nyid kyang mi rigs pas so //
translated: “Even if mind exists, do not grasp form as nonexistent” means that if form is not possible, the existence of mind is also not possible.

original: gal te rigs pa dang 'gal yang 'jig rten pa la ltos nas sems yod pa nyid du khas len na ni gzugs kyang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rigs pa dang 'gal yang 'jig rten pa la ltos nas sems yod pa nyid du khas len na ni gzugs kyang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes pa'o //
translated: If, in spite of the contradiction with reason, one accepts the existence of mind in terms of the world, then one must also accept the existence of form.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: When, etc.

original: 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “Reason” refers to “not from self,” etc.

original: de ltar rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gnyis ka yod pa dang / don dam par ni gnyis kar yang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gnyis ka yod pa dang / don dam par ni gnyis kar yang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: “One should understand it thus” means that both exist conventionally, and neither is ultimately produced.

original: shes rab tshul mdor zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: shes rab tshul mdor zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las so //
translated: “In the Perfection of Wisdom Sutra” means in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras.

original: mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni cig car ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni cig car ro //
translated: “Equally” means simultaneously.

original: spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
analyzed: spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
translated: “Having abandoned” means having refuted.

original: mngon pa'i chos las gsungs zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las yod pa nyid du gsungs @209b pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos las gsungs zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las yod pa nyid du gsungs @209b pa'o ;
translated: “In the Abhidharma” means in the Abhidharma Pitaka.

original: / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The distinctions are the distinctions of the general and particular characteristics, etc. The particular characteristics are such as: because it is capable of materiality, it is called form, etc. The general characteristics are such as impermanence, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The etc. includes the realms, destinies, birth processes, etc.

original: bkag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka yang ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: bkag pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka yang ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pas so //
translated: It is not denied means that both are not born by intrinsic reality.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subhuti, if form were to exist, etc.

original: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: By scripture and logic means by the method taught above.

original: bden pa gnyis rim pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gal te sems yod na gzugs kyang yod pa nyid dang / gal te gzugs yod na sems kyang yod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis rim pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gal te sems yod na gzugs kyang yod pa nyid dang / gal te gzugs yod na sems kyang yod pa'o //
translated: The two truths are in this order means that if mind exists conventionally, form also exists, and if form exists, mind also exists.

original: don dam par ni gnyis kar yang ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyis kar yang ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, neither of them has any essence.

original: bshig nas zhes bya ba ni sems rdzas su yod pa khas blangs pas bden pa gnyis kyi rim pa 'di dag pa shig pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshig nas zhes bya ba ni sems rdzas su yod pa khas blangs pas bden pa gnyis kyi rim pa 'di dag pa shig pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Having been destroyed” means that by accepting that mind exists as a substance, this sequence of the two truths is destroyed.

original: khyod kyi rdzas ni bkag pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi rdzas ni bkag pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: Your substance will not be established by a negation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs spangs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin can gyi sems tsam rdzas su 'grub par mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs spangs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin can gyi sems tsam rdzas su 'grub par mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: This means that mind-only, which has the nature of the dependent and is separate from form, will not be established as a substance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni bkag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni bkag pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is “by a negation.”

original: sngar bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas su grub pa nyid bkag pas so //
analyzed: sngar bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas su grub pa nyid bkag pas so //
translated: That is, by the previous negation of substantial existence in “not from itself,” and so on.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said:

original: gzugs med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Because it is formless.”

original: ngal ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rdzas su yod par bsgrub pa la ngal ba byas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ngal ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rdzas su yod par bsgrub pa la ngal ba byas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “It would be pointless” means that the effort to prove that mind substantially exists would be pointless.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Therefore, etc.”

original: de lta'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de lta'i rim pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
translated: “In that order” means in the order that was taught earlier.

original: de nyid ma skyes zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ma skyes na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ma skyes zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i ye shes la ltos nas ma skyes na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “That itself is unarisen” means that it is unarisen in relation to the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: 'jig rten skyes rig ces bya ba ni 'jig rten la ltos nas skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyes rig ces bya ba ni 'jig rten la ltos nas skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The world is born” means that it is born in relation to the world.

original: yang gzhan gyi lung dang 'gal ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi lung dang 'gal ba ston pa ni /
translated: Again, in order to teach the contradiction with the scriptures of others, he says,

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Here, someone says, etc.”

original: mdo'i don 'di zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don to //
analyzed: mdo'i don 'di zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don to //
translated: “The meaning of this sūtra” is the meaning of the sūtra that says, “The three realms are mind only.”

original: de ltar bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Although it is explained like this,” etc.

original: byed pa po gzhan dgag pa'i don du dang / sems tsam @210a * //
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan dgag pa'i don du dang / sems tsam @210a * //
translated: The purpose of refuting other agents is to🔽establish that consciousness is the agent.

original: pa gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i don du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: pa gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i don du bshad pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the refutation of other agents, and the meaning of the teaching of mind-only as the principal.

original: lung dngos dgod pa ni /
analyzed: lung dngos dgod pa ni /
translated: The citation of the actual scriptures.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
translated: There is no external object.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de phyi rol na yod pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de phyi rol na yod pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that what appears as form, etc. does not exist externally, and is not different from consciousness.

original: sems ni sna tshogs nyid snang zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rnam pa sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni sna tshogs nyid snang zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rnam pa sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
translated: The mind itself appears as various things.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the body, etc.

original: de la lus ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yin te /
analyzed: de la lus ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams yin te /
translated: Therein, the body is the sense-spheres of the eye, etc.

original: de rnams lus su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams lus su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the body.

original: longs spyod ni gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod ni gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Enjoyment is form, etc.

original: longs spyad par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: longs spyad par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because it is to be enjoyed.

original: gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten yin te /
analyzed: gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten yin te /
translated: The place is the world vessel.

original: der sems can rnams gnas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: der sems can rnams gnas pa yin pas so //
translated: Because sentient beings dwell there.

original: lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas rnams sems gang la snang ba de la de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas rnams sems gang la snang ba de la de skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and place are so called because they appear to the mind.

original: sems tsam zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi lus la sogs pa stong pa'o //
analyzed: sems tsam zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi lus la sogs pa stong pa'o //
translated: The statement only mind is the emptiness of the external body, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: therein, etc.

original: phyi rol lta bur mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol lta bur mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Appears as if external means the adherence to the appearance of the apprehended.

original: lung dang 'gal ba'i skyon spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba'i skyon spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the fault of contradicting scripture, he says

original: mdo 'di yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo 'di yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: this scripture, etc.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This refers to external appearances, etc.

original: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Having an ulterior purport means having a provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lung dang 'gal ba nyid rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lung dang 'gal ba nyid rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: From which scripture, etc. is the reiteration of the contradiction with scripture.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that is this, as will be explained.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Form is not real” and so on.

original: shin tu chags zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu chags zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: “Very attached” means strongly attached.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa rnams la'o //
translated: “To them” means to those who are strongly attached to form.

original: gzugs bzlog pa ste zhes bya ba gzugs bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs bzlog pa ste zhes bya ba gzugs bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Form is refuted” means that form is negated.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni mdo de yang ngo ;
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni mdo de yang ngo ;
translated: “That” refers to that sūtra.

original: 'di'i don ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du gzugs bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du gzugs bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Form is negated in order to eliminate the attachment to form of those who are attached to form.

original: gzugs spangs pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam rdzas su yod par ston pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs spangs pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam rdzas su yod par ston pa'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the purpose of teaching that consciousness alone, which is the negation of form, substantially exists.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason, he says:

original: drang don nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: drang don nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “It is interpretable in meaning.”

original: de 'grel @210b pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel @210b pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The root text says, “Thus, etc.”

original: shin tu re ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par bcas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu re ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par bcas pa'o //
translated: “With great hope” means with strong attachment.

original: de'i rkyen can gyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen can gyi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: “Conditioned by that” means having the cause of attachment to form.

original: rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags so //
translated: “Attachment” means desire.

original: khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen nas de nyid la gzhan mngon par zhen pa la khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen nas de nyid la gzhan mngon par zhen pa la khong khro ba'o //
translated: “Aversion” means, having become attached to the form of a woman, etc., being averse to others’ attachment to her.

original: gzugs khyad par can gyis mtho ba nyid du sems pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gzugs khyad par can gyis mtho ba nyid du sems pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: “Conceit” means thinking that one is superior because of having superior form.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phrag dog la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽'jug pa rang dbang med par byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phrag dog la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o // 'jug pa rang dbang med par byas par 'gyur //
translated: The word “etc.” includes envy, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la rag lus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la rag lus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One is made to engage without independence” means that the engagement of the mind depends on desire, etc.

original: de la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: By strongly clinging to that means by strongly clinging to form, etc.

original: sdig pa chen po dang zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams nas so //
analyzed: sdig pa chen po dang zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams nas so //
translated: From great evil means from the paths of the ten unwholesome actions.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa las zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the accumulation of the collections of merit and knowledge means from the wholesome actions of the ten paths of action and from generosity, etc.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of merit is the wholesome actions of the ten paths of action and generosity, etc.

original: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //🔽de dag las nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ye shes kyi tshogs so // de dag las nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The collection of knowledge is the wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation.🔽From those means from those who have accumulated evil and degenerated from the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bsags shing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las nyams pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid bstan pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bsags shing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las nyams pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis sems tsam nyid bstan pa yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: From those means from those who have accumulated evil and degenerated from the collections of merit and knowledge. The Bhagavān taught mind only to them.

original: ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why did he teach it?

original: de'i lan ni /
analyzed: de'i lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: gzugs kyi rkyen can gyi nyon mongs pa de gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rkyen can gyi nyon mongs pa de gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase in order to destroy the afflictions that have form as their condition is stated.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase in order to destroy the afflictions that have form as their cause is the same as the previous phrase.

original: de la dpe ston pa ni phyi rol gyi yul la chags pa 'joms pa'i keng rus ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dpe ston pa ni phyi rol gyi yul la chags pa 'joms pa'i keng rus ltar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase just as in the case of skeletons, which are taught as an antidote to attachment to external objects is an example.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags can rnams la phyi rol gyi yul la chags pa gzhom pa'i keng rus bsgom pa'i thabs ston pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags can rnams la phyi rol gyi yul la chags pa gzhom pa'i keng rus bsgom pa'i thabs ston pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as skeletons are taught as a method of meditation for the purpose of destroying attachment to external objects in those who are attached, so is this.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs keng rus kyi rang bzhin ma yin du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs keng rus kyi rang bzhin ma yin du zin kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase even though they are not like that means that even though form is not by nature skeletons.

original: des na gzugs bkag nas sems tsam du sgrub pa'i lung ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gzugs bkag nas sems tsam du sgrub pa'i lung ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this scripture does not refute form and establish mind only.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la chags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spang ba'i don du yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la chags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spang ba'i don du yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: However, it is for the purpose of abandoning attachment to form, such as desire.

original: lung @211a * //
analyzed: lung @211a * //
translated: The phrase just as in the case of the teaching of the three vehicles is an example.

original: drang ba'i don yin pa'i shes byed bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: drang ba'i don yin pa'i shes byed bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the proof that it is of provisional meaning,

original: yang lung 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang lung 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Moreover, this scripture…”

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /🔽phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni / phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
translated: “This” refers to

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “External appearances do not exist.”

original: da ni sems tsam pa rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mdo gzhan dag kyang drang ba'i don du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems tsam pa rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mdo gzhan dag kyang drang ba'i don du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that other scriptures that are similar to the Cittamātra position are also of provisional meaning,

original: mdo 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This scripture…”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “This” refers to

original: phyi rol snang ba yod med do //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba yod med do // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “External appearances do not exist.”

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Moreover” and so forth refers to the Samdhinirmocana and so forth.

original: lung gi zhes bya ba ni ci ltar nad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung gi zhes bya ba ni ci ltar nad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Scripture” refers to “Just as for a patient…” and so forth.

original: brtags pa med pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su brtags pa ste med pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa med pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su brtags pa ste med pa'o //
translated: “Non-apprehension” means that the nondual consciousness is devoid of the dualistic discrimination of object and subject.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The existence of the dependent” means that the consciousness that appears as blue, etc., is produced by causes and conditions.

original: yongs su grub pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gnyis kyis stong pa'i shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i stong pa nyid dag yod pas so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gnyis kyis stong pa'i shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i stong pa nyid dag yod pas so //
translated: “The existence of the perfected” means that the consciousness that is empty of the duality of object and subject is not empty of the emptiness of the duality of object and subject.

original: de ltar gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du bstan pas sems tsam don dam par yod pa yin no zhes sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du bstan pas sems tsam don dam par yod pa yin no zhes sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Cittamātra proponents say that since the existence of the dependent is taught, mind only exists ultimately.

original: sems tsam du ston pa'i lung gzhan yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: sems tsam du ston pa'i lung gzhan yang ston pa ni /
translated: To present other scriptures that teach mind only, he says:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Likewise,” and so on.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis bag chags thams cad len pa'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis bag chags thams cad len pa'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The so-called appropriating consciousness is the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates all the habitual propensities.

original: zab cing zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas so //
analyzed: zab cing zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas so //
translated: It is profound, because it is difficult for the naïve to understand.

original: phra zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas so //
analyzed: phra zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyis rtogs par dka' bas so //
translated: It is subtle, because it is difficult for the śrāvakas to understand.

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
translated: All the seeds flow in it like a river.

original: ces bya ba ni ci ltar chu bo cher skyes pa'i tshe chu bos shing la sogs pa mang po khyer ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang bag chags mang po sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ci ltar chu bo cher skyes pa'i tshe chu bos shing la sogs pa mang po khyer ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang bag chags mang po sogs pas so //
translated: Just as when a great river is flowing, it carries along a great deal of wood and so forth, in the same way, in the store-consciousness also, many habitual propensities are collected.

original: ci'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it not taught to the śrāvakas and so on?

original: bdag tu rtog par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: because of the danger of the conception of self.

original: gal te de rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan par gyur na de'i tshe byed pa po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bdag tu yongs su rtog par 'gyur ro snyam nas ma gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bstan par gyur na de'i tshe byed pa po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bdag tu yongs su rtog par 'gyur ro snyam nas ma gsungs so //
translated: If the foundation consciousness were taught to them, they would imagine a self that has the qualities of being an agent and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni sems tsam ston @211b par byed pa'i lung gnyis so //🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nad pa la rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / pad kan gyi rnam 'gyur rnams so sor rtogs nas sman pas nad dang rjes su bstun pa'i sman gyi bye brag gtong ba de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas sems tsam ston par mdzad pa yin pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang bstun nas
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni sems tsam ston @211b par byed pa'i lung gnyis so // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nad pa la rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / pad kan gyi rnam 'gyur rnams so sor rtogs nas sman pas nad dang rjes su bstun pa'i sman gyi bye brag gtong ba de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas sems tsam ston par mdzad pa yin pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang bstun nas
translated: “This” refers to the two scriptures that teach mind only.🔽“Just as” means that just as a doctor, having diagnosed whether the illness of a patient is due to wind, bile, or phlegm, prescribes a specific medicine that is suitable for the illness, in the same way, having understood the thoughts of sentient beings, the Teacher teaches mind only.

original: gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the teaching is in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the ultimate.

original: yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other sūtras of provisional meaning, he says,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
translated: Just as the statement about the essence of the Tathagata is interpretable in meaning,

original: de bzhin du sems tsam gsungs pa de yang drang ba'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam gsungs pa de yang drang ba'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: so the statement about mind-only is interpretable in meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes mdo las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes mdo las gsungs pas so //
translated: The essence of the Tathagata is all sentient beings, because it is said in the scriptures that they have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //🔽rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste dri ma med pa yin la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste dri ma med pa yin la /
translated: The essence of the Tathagata is the reality of sentient beings.🔽It is naturally luminous, because it is naturally luminous, stainless.

original: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dag pa gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dag pa gang yin pa des so //
translated: It is pure by nature, because it is pure by nature.

original: thog ma nas rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du gdod ma nas dri ma med pas so //
analyzed: thog ma nas rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du gdod ma nas dri ma med pas so //
translated: It is primordially pure, because it is primordially stainless, like space.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: The phrase endowed with the thirty-two marks means that they are the nature of emptiness.

original: de rnams kyang der 'dus pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang der 'dus pa yin pas so //
translated: And because they are included in that, it says they are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi nang na mchis par brjod de zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi nang na mchis par brjod de zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be present in the bodies of all sentient beings means that emptiness pervades everything.

original: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach just that by way of an example,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavān said,

original: rin thang chen po zhes bya ba ni nor ches mang pos blu dgos pas so //
analyzed: rin thang chen po zhes bya ba ni nor ches mang pos blu dgos pas so //
translated: The phrase of great value means that it is to be bought with a great deal of wealth.

original: rin po che zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase a precious gem refers to a ruby, and so on.🔽In order to connect the example with the meaning, he said,

original: dpe don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the aggregates, and so on.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi gos kyis yongs su dkris pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams gos dang mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi gos kyis yongs su dkris pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams gos dang mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase wrapped in the cloth of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases indicates that the aggregates and so forth are like a cloth.

original: dri ma nyid ston pa ni 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la @212a * //
analyzed: dri ma nyid ston pa ni 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / yang dag pa ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la @212a * //
translated: The phrase the stains of attachment, anger, and ignorance indicates the stains.

original: sogs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ste de dag gis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la yongs su brtags pas so //🔽rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa'o //🔽brtan pa zhes bya ba ni chad pa med pas so //
analyzed: sogs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ste de dag gis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la yongs su brtags pas so // rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa'o // brtan pa zhes bya ba ni chad pa med pas so //
translated: The phrase false imagination refers to the imagination of a self and so forth, and the imagination of an object and subject.🔽The phrase permanent means unchanging.🔽The phrase stable means not interrupted.

original: ther zug ces bya ba ni thog ma med pas so ;
analyzed: ther zug ces bya ba ni thog ma med pas so ;
translated: The phrase eternal means beginningless.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having heard the teaching of the Tathagata-essence, the Bodhisattvas ask the Lord, Bhagavan, if the Tathagata-essence is taught...

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'o //
translated: This refers to the teaching of the Tathagata-essence.

original: mu stegs kyi zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi zhes pa'o //
translated: Non-Buddhists refers to non-Buddhists.

original: de rnams kyis ci ltar bdag tu smra ba de dang mtshungs pa ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ci ltar bdag tu smra ba de dang mtshungs pa ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Why would it not be the same as their doctrine of self?

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, the Bhagavan said, Bhagavan, if the Tathagata-essence is taught...

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Bhagavan is a vocative term.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi byed pa po'o //
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi byed pa po'o //
translated: Agent refers to the agent of virtuous, non-virtuous, and other actions.

original: yon tan med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul mun pa snying stobs gsum gyi yon tan dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul mun pa snying stobs gsum gyi yon tan dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: Lacking qualities means lacking the qualities of rajas, tamas, and sattva.

original: mi 'jigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness means being without fear.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, The Lord... and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa de drang ba'i don nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa de drang ba'i don nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the teaching of the Tathagata-essence is just interpretable in meaning,

original: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Mahamati... and so on.

original: stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pas so //
translated: By emptiness is meant that it is empty of the grasped and the grasper.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni dngos po rnams yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni dngos po rnams yin la /
translated: By limit of reality is meant that reality is things,

original: de'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: and its limit is emptiness,

original: rigs pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by reasoning.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas mya ngan las 'das pa ni stong pa nyid kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi bas mya ngan las 'das pa ni stong pa nyid kho na la bya'o //
translated: By nirvana is meant that here nirvana is just emptiness, because all conceptualization is completely pacified.

original: ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba med pa ste stong pa nyid kho na la'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba med pa ste stong pa nyid kho na la'o //
translated: “Unborn” means that which is not born, i.e., emptiness itself.

original: mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtshan ma ste rgyu yin la /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtshan ma ste rgyu yin la /
translated: “Signless” means the true sign, i.e., the cause.

original: de gang la med pa ste stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de gang la med pa ste stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is without that, i.e., emptiness, is signless.

original: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid las ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la mngon par dga' ba med pas gang la smon pa med pas te stong pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid las ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la mngon par dga' ba med pas gang la smon pa med pas te stong pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: “Wishless” means that which is without wish, i.e., emptiness, because of the absence of delight in future things due to emptiness.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “etc.” include suchness and so on.

original: byis pa rnams @212b zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i bag chags goms pa rnams so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams @212b zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa'i bag chags goms pa rnams so //
translated: “The childish” refers to those who are habituated to the imprints of self and so on.

original: bdag med pas 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams spang ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyis kho na bdag chad par dogs pas 'jigs pa'i gnas yin la de spang ba'i don du ste cig cag stong pa nyid bstan nas skrag par 'gyur bas so
analyzed: bdag med pas 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams spang ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyis kho na bdag chad par dogs pas 'jigs pa'i gnas yin la de spang ba'i don du ste cig cag stong pa nyid bstan nas skrag par 'gyur bas so
translated: For the purpose of abandoning the bases that are feared due to selflessness means that the two kinds of selflessness are the bases that are feared by those who suspect that the self is annihilated, and for the purpose of abandoning those, i.e., for the purpose of abandoning fear through teaching emptiness.

original: // de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Tathāgata essence and so on.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul lo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul lo //
translated: The base of nonconceptuality is the object of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: snang ba med pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba med pas so //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa snang ba med pas so //
translated: The absence of appearance is the absence of the appearance of blue and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te dang po nyid du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra don stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te dang po nyid du stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra don stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the terms such as emptiness were expressed by the terms such as emptiness from the outset,

original: de'i tshe bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i byis pa rnams skrag par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i byis pa rnams skrag par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: then childish beings who are attached to the self and so on would be frightened.

original: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa brjod par rung ba'i sgra'i sgo nas bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa brjod par rung ba'i sgra'i sgo nas bstan par gyur na /
translated: When it is taught by means of terms that are suitable to be expressed such as “self,”

original: de'i tshe de rnams skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: then, because they would not be frightened, the Transcendent Lord taught the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
translated: “Mahāmati” and so on. Here, “this” refers to the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by means of an example,

original: blo gros chen po dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Buddha] says, “Mahāmati, for example” and so on.

original: snod rnam pa sna tshogs byed do zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'khar phor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snod rnam pa sna tshogs byed do zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang 'khar phor la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Various types of vessels” refers to pots, bowls, and so on.

original: srad bu la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khor lo bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: srad bu la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khor lo bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Thread and so on” and so on refers to a wheel.

original: nan tan dang zhes bya ba ni dbyi gus 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan dang zhes bya ba ni dbyi gus 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Effort” means that the potter turns the wheel.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kun la sbyar bar bya'o//
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni kun la sbyar bar bya'o//
translated: The term “endowed” should be applied to all [of the above].

original: chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The “selflessness of phenomena” is characterized by emptiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par log pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par log pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The “cessation of the characteristics of conceptualization” means

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad log pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad log pa yin te /
translated: the cessation of all conceptualization.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par log pa yin te /
translated: Emptiness is not the object of conceptualization, and all characteristics cease,

original: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because [emptiness] is free from the four extremes.

original: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ci lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pas shes rab dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ci lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pas shes rab dang ldan pa yin la /
