translated: “Endowed with the skill in wisdom and method” means that [the Buddha] is endowed with wisdom because he knows the nature of all phenomena just as it is.🔽If all phenomena are taught with terms such as “selflessness” and “emptiness,” which are the nature of things just as they are,

original: gal te chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i rang bzhin bdag med pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgras bstan na de'i tshe @213a * //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i rang bzhin bdag med pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgras bstan na de'i tshe @213a * //
translated: then at that time,

original: byis pa rnams 'dir skrag pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas ston pa yin pas thabs la mkhas pa'o //🔽rdza mkhan bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na rdza mkhan 'jim pa'i rdul gyi phung po gcig las byung ba'i snod rnam pa sna tshogs pa byed pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi don las byung ba'i yi ge dang tshig gi rnam
analyzed: byis pa rnams 'dir skrag pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas ston pa yin pas thabs la mkhas pa'o // rdza mkhan bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na rdza mkhan 'jim pa'i rdul gyi phung po gcig las byung ba'i snod rnam pa sna tshogs pa byed pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi don las byung ba'i yi ge dang tshig gi rnam
translated: Because the childish would not enter into it out of fear, it is taught by way of the teaching of the Tathagata-essence. Therefore, it is skillful means.

original: grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis stong pa nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis stong pa nyid ston pa'o //
translated: Like a potter, he creates various kinds of vessels from a single mass of clay particles. In the same way, he teaches emptiness by means of various enumerations of syllables and words that arise from the meaning which has the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de la yi ge ni yi ge re re'o //
analyzed: de la yi ge ni yi ge re re'o //
translated: There, a syllable is each individual letter.

original: tshig ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A word is a pot and so forth.

original: rnam grangs ni de dag gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs ni de dag gi rang bzhin te /
translated: An enumeration is their nature,

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rnam grangs med pas so //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rnam grangs med pas so //
translated: because there is no enumeration apart from them.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ston pa yin te /
translated: Thus, and so forth, shows the conclusion.

original: drang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas de rnams mi skrag pas bstan pa la bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i sgo nas de rnams mi skrag pas bstan pa la bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
translated: The phrase in order to be straightforward means that, by teaching the essence of the tathāgata, they will not be frightened and will easily enter into the teaching.🔽The phrase the intention that is focused on the domain of the three doors of liberation means that the intention is focused on the three purities that have the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽The phrase in order to be straightforward means that, by teaching the essence of the tathāgata, they will not be frightened and will easily enter into the teaching.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum gyi spyod yul la gnas pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rnam par dag pa gsum gyi spyod yul la bsam pa gtad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum gyi spyod yul la gnas pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rnam par dag pa gsum gyi spyod yul la bsam pa gtad pa'o //
translated: The phrase the intention that is focused on the domain of the three doors of liberation means that the intention is focused on the three purities that have the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽The phrase in order to be straightforward means that, by teaching the essence of the tathāgata, they will not be frightened and will easily enter into the teaching.🔽The phrase the intention that is focused on the domain of the three doors of liberation means that the intention is focused on the three purities that have the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽The phrase in order to be straightforward means that, by teaching the essence of the tathāgata, they will not be frightened and will easily enter into the teaching.

original: des ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i don stong pa nyid kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems tsam bstan pa yang stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa'i don stong pa nyid kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems tsam bstan pa yang stong pa nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the intention that is focused on the domain of the three doors of liberation means that the intention is focused on the three purities that have the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: yang mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi don bstan pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi don bstan pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase in order to be

original: yang de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang de nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, the passage beginning “And in that very sūtra” shows that the sūtras are not contradictory.

original: mdo sde'i nang du chud pa zhes bya ba ni mdo thams cad kyis stong pa nyid kyi don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde'i nang du chud pa zhes bya ba ni mdo thams cad kyis stong pa nyid kyi don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Included in the sūtras” means that all sūtras teach the meaning of emptiness.

original: 'di'i don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo thams cad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo thams cad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gsungs la /
translated: The meaning of this is that the Bhagavān taught the nature of dependent arising in all sūtras.

original: gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de la ltos pa can yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kho na mdo thams cad kyi nang du chud pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de la ltos pa can yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kho na mdo thams cad kyi nang du chud pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And because that which is dependently arisen is dependent, it is empty because it lacks intrinsic reality. Therefore, emptiness alone is included in all sūtras.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis lung drangs pa rnams drang ba'i don yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems tsam du smra ba rnams kyis lung drangs pa rnams drang ba'i don yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning “Thus” shows the conclusion that the scriptures cited by the proponents of mind only are of provisional meaning.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / phyi rol snang ba yong med de //🔽@213b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba dang / phyi rol snang ba yong med de // @213b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A sūtra of this type is one that says, “The three realms are mind only,” and “External appearances do not exist.

original: nges pa'i don du khas blangs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i don can nyid du khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don du khas blangs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i don can nyid du khas blangs pa'o //
translated: ” “All of the statements that are accepted as having a definitive meaning” are accepted as having an ultimate meaning.

original: drang ba'i don nyid yin par zhes bya ba ni don dam par ston pa ma yin par ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don nyid yin par zhes bya ba ni don dam par ston pa ma yin par ro //
translated: “They are interpretable in meaning” means that they are not taught to have an ultimate meaning.

original: lung 'dis zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs las 'byung ba'i rnam pa la rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lung 'dis zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs las 'byung ba'i rnam pa la rtog go zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “This scriptural passage” is the one that says, “One should investigate the forward and reverse processes of dependent origination.”

original: de ltar khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung de rnams la lung gzhan gyi sgo nas drang ba'i don nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung de rnams la lung gzhan gyi sgo nas drang ba'i don nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, after showing that the scriptural passages that say, “The three realms are mind only,” and so on, are interpretable in meaning by means of other scriptural passages,

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas drang ba'i don nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas drang ba'i don nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that they are interpretable in meaning by means of reasoning,🔽Candrakīrti says,🔽“The three realms are mind only.”

original: rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning “By reasoning” shows that the teaching of mind-only is provisional.

original: shes bya med na zhes bya ba ni shes bya mi 'thad na'o //
analyzed: shes bya med na zhes bya ba ni shes bya mi 'thad na'o //
translated: “ If there is no object of knowledge” means if the object of knowledge is not tenable.

original: shes pa bsal ba ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa bsal ba ni zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa'o //
translated: “ The elimination of consciousness” means the nonexistence of consciousness.

original: bde blag rnyed ces bya ba ni bde blag tu khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: bde blag rnyed ces bya ba ni bde blag tu khong du chud pa'o //
translated: “ Easily understood” means easily comprehended.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this.

original: gang sems tsam du gsungs pa de don dam par yod pa nyid sgrub pa'i don du ma yin gyi /🔽'on kyang / shes bya med na shes pa ci ltar yod //
analyzed: gang sems tsam du gsungs pa de don dam par yod pa nyid sgrub pa'i don du ma yin gyi / 'on kyang / shes bya med na shes pa ci ltar yod //
translated: The teaching of mind-only is not for the purpose of establishing that the mind ultimately exists.

original: ces shes pa med pa bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i don du yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces shes pa med pa bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i don du yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Rather, it is for the purpose of easily comprehending the nonexistence of consciousness, as in the statement, “If there is no object of knowledge, how can consciousness exist?”

original: de ltar rigs pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir shes pa yod par bstan pa ni drang ba'i don kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir shes pa yod par bstan pa ni drang ba'i don kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, because the existence of consciousness is not established by reasoning, the teaching of the existence of consciousness is only interpretable in meaning.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, the following is stated:🔽“The Buddha taught that the mind alone exists,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and that forms do not exist.”

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas yin te /
translated: The gradual is in terms of the negation of self, etc.

original: gzhan du na stong pa nyid la skrag nas 'jug par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na stong pa nyid la skrag nas 'jug par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, being frightened of emptiness, one would not enter.

original: de la dpe ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la dpe ston pa ni /
translated: The illustration of that is

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The that and so forth that is stated is

original: chos nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la ltos pa med par tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo nas bsod nams byas pa dag med pa khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pas so //
analyzed: chos nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la ltos pa med par tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo nas bsod nams byas pa dag med pa khong du chud pa'i thabs yin pas so //
translated: The method of entering into reality is because it is the method of understanding the non-existence of the accumulations of merit through engaging in ethics, etc. without regard for enjoyments.

original: shes bya bkag pa ni shes pa bdag med par rtogs pa'i thabs yin pas bde blag tu 'jug pa ston pa ni ;
analyzed: shes bya bkag pa ni shes pa bdag med par rtogs pa'i thabs yin pas bde blag tu 'jug pa ston pa ni ;
translated: The negation of the object of knowledge is the method of realizing the selflessness of consciousness. The teaching of easy engagement is

original: shes bya rang bzhin med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bya rang bzhin med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The object of knowledge without intrinsic nature and so forth that is stated is

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems yod par ston pa'i gsung rab rnams brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems yod par ston pa'i gsung rab rnams brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang ba'i don nyid do //
translated: Moreover, in the same way means that the scriptures that teach the existence of mind should be investigated. This is the interpretability.

original: brtag pa de yang drang ba dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i mtshan nyid med na mi shes pas de dag @214a * //
analyzed: brtag pa de yang drang ba dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i mtshan nyid med na mi shes pas de dag @214a * //
translated: Moreover, that investigation is not known without the characteristics of the sutras of interpretable meaning and of definitive meaning.

original: gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach their characteristics,

original: de ltar lung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de ltar lung gi lo rgyus shes bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar lung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de ltar lung gi lo rgyus shes bya ste //
translated: he says, “Thus, one should know the history of the scriptures. . . . ”

original: zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don dbye bas lung gi lo rgyus shes par byas nas so //🔽mdo gang de nyid ma yin bshad don can //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don dbye bas lung gi lo rgyus shes par byas nas so // mdo gang de nyid ma yin bshad don can //
translated: “Thus, one should know the history of the scriptures” means that one should know the history of the scriptures by distinguishing the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo gang du de kho na nyid ma yin pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo gang du de kho na nyid ma yin pa bshad pa ste /
translated: “The sutra which has a meaning that is not reality” means the sutra which teaches that which is not reality.

original: phung po la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //🔽gang blos de nyid rtogs 'gyur drang don gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba ni gang du shes rab kyi sgo nas don dam pa'i don nges par byed pa de ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o // gang blos de nyid rtogs 'gyur drang don gsungs // zhes bya ba ni gang du shes rab kyi sgo nas don dam pa'i don nges par byed pa de ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: It teaches the aggregates, etc.🔽“The sutra which is interpretable in meaning is that which the intellect can understand as reality” means that the interpretable meaning is that by which one ascertains the meaning of the ultimate through wisdom.

original: stong nyid don can nges don 'ang shes par gyis //
analyzed: stong nyid don can nges don 'ang shes par gyis //
translated: “The sutra which has the meaning of emptiness is definitive in meaning” means that the definitive meaning is that by which one ascertains the meaning of the ultimate through direct perception.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo gang du stong pa nyid dngos su ston par byed pa de ni nges pa'i don ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo gang du stong pa nyid dngos su ston par byed pa de ni nges pa'i don ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: meaning.

original: mdor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor shes par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be understood.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says,

original: mdo sde gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dngos su gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dngos su gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa //
translated: “Those sutras that . . .”🔽“Do not explicitly teach”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: means that they do not teach it explicitly, but rather by implication.🔽In order to demonstrate how it is that they are the cause for engaging in

original: rang bzhin med pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'gyur ba bde bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'gyur ba bde bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the teaching of essencelessness, it says, “As it is said . . . ”🔽In order to demonstrate how the teaching of form in the Praise by the Bodhisattva🔽Mafijusri, composed by the master Nagarjuna, is the cause for engaging in the

original: slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa las gzugs bstan pa rang bzhin med pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i bstod pa las gzugs bstan pa rang bzhin med pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: teaching of essencelessness, it says,

original: 'byung rnams mig gzung ma yin na //
analyzed: 'byung rnams mig gzung ma yin na //
translated: The elements are not perceived by the eye.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba rnams sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can reg par bya ba yin pas mig gis gzung bar bya bar mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba rnams sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can reg par bya ba yin pas mig gis gzung bar bya bar mi rigs pas so //
translated: The elements are characterized as earth, water, fire, and wind. They are the nature of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility. Since they are tangible objects, it is not reasonable that they are perceived by the eye.

original: de byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de byung zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
translated: “Derived from that” refers to form derived from the elements.

original: mig gzung ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du ci ltar rigs te /
analyzed: mig gzung ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzung bar bya ba nyid du ci ltar rigs te /
translated: How can the eye be perceived? How can it be reasonable that the eye is perceived by visual consciousness?

original: reg bya mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na dbang po lnga don med par thal bar 'gyur ba yin pas so //
analyzed: reg bya mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na dbang po lnga don med par thal bar 'gyur ba yin pas so //
translated: If the tangible object is perceived by visual consciousness, it follows that the five sense faculties are meaningless.

original: gzugs la de skad gsungs pa na ;
analyzed: gzugs la de skad gsungs pa na ;
translated: When it is said that form is like that,

original: / zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khyod kyi gzugs 'byung ba las gyur par gsungs na'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khyod kyi gzugs 'byung ba las gyur par gsungs na'o //
translated: the Bhagavān said that your form is derived from the elements.

original: gzugs kyi 'dzin pa bzlog ces bya ba ni gal te gzugs 'byung ba las gyur pa yin na de'i tshe mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhes gzugs la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dzin pa bzlog ces bya ba ni gal te gzugs 'byung ba las gyur pa yin na de'i tshe mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhes gzugs la mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase the apprehension of form is to be stopped means that if form were to arise from the elements, then how could it be apprehended by the eye? Thus, the adherence to form is to be stopped.

original: des na @214b shes rab kyis ma brtags na nyams dga' bar sgyu ma ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams snang ba yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi don brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na @214b shes rab kyis ma brtags na nyams dga' bar sgyu ma ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'di rnams snang ba yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi don brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of emptiness should be investigated, namely, that these forms and so forth appear as if they were illusions, delightful when not examined by wisdom.

original: mdo'i sgo nas kyang stong pa nyid kyi don ston pa ni /
analyzed: mdo'i sgo nas kyang stong pa nyid kyi don ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of emptiness is also taught through the sutras.

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase also in the sutras and so forth.

original: mi rtag don med do zhes bya ba ni gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu med pa de ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag don med do zhes bya ba ni gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu med pa de ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The phrase impermanent, meaningless means is taught, and that which is always non-existent is impermanent.

original: des na mi rtag pa las bstan pas stong pa nyid kyi don nges par bya'o //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa las bstan pas stong pa nyid kyi don nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of emptiness should be ascertained through the teaching of impermanence.

original: mtshan nyid de lung gi sgo nas kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lung gi sgo nas kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that characteristic also through the scriptures,🔽he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, and so on.

original: nges don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: nges don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words “definitive meaning” and so on is easy to understand.

original: yi ge tha dad ces bya ba ni sgra tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge tha dad ces bya ba ni sgra tha dad pa'o //
translated: “Different letters” means different sounds.

original: don gcig ste zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid kyi don gcig ston pas so //
analyzed: don gcig ste zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid kyi don gcig ston pas so //
translated: “One meaning” means that they teach the one meaning of emptiness in the manner explained above.

original: yongs su bsgrags par nus ma yin //
analyzed: yongs su bsgrags par nus ma yin //
translated: It is not possible to proclaim them.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par nus pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par nus pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that it is not possible to express the characteristics of the sūtras.

original: dngos po gcig ni bsam byas na //
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni bsam byas na //
translated: If one reflects on a single thing,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po gcig la bsam par byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po gcig la bsam par byas nas so //
translated: this means that if one reflects on a single thing that has the characteristics of form and so on,

original: de dag thams cad bsgom 'gyur te //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsgom 'gyur te //
translated: one will meditate on all of them.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: mdo'i don thams cad bsgom par 'gyur ba ste /🔽stong pa nyid kyi don thams cad bsgom par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i don thams cad bsgom par 'gyur ba ste / stong pa nyid kyi don thams cad bsgom par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: that one will meditate on the meaning of all the sūtras.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don thams cad du mtshungs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don thams cad du mtshungs pa yin pas so //
translated: One will meditate on the meaning of emptiness, because the meaning of emptiness is the same in all.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis chos mang po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis chos mang po //
translated: All the Buddhas have taught the Dharma

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos ji snyed cig gsungs pa de rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi bdag med pa nyid du gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos ji snyed cig gsungs pa de rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi bdag med pa nyid du gsungs pa yin la /
translated: in terms of the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: mi gang don la mkhas pa ste bdag med pa shes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mi gang don la mkhas pa ste bdag med pa shes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are wise in the meaning, who understand selflessness,

original: gnas 'di la ni bslab byas nas //
analyzed: gnas 'di la ni bslab byas nas //
translated: should train in this teaching of the Buddhas.🔽Those who are wise in the meaning, who understand selflessness, should train in this teaching of the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i gnas 'di la thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas bslab par gyur na'o //🔽sangs rgyas chos rnams rnyed mi dka' //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i gnas 'di la thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas bslab par gyur na'o // sangs rgyas chos rnams rnyed mi dka' //
translated: Having trained in this teaching of the Buddhas,🔽it will not be difficult to attain the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams bde blag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams bde blag tu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having trained in this teaching of the Buddhas, it will not be difficult to attain the qualities of the Buddhas, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: mdo gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The characteristic of a sutra of interpretable meaning is also taught by way of another sutra, in the passage beginning “Likewise, etc.”

original: rgya cher bstan pa yang zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i mdo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgya cher bstan pa yang zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i mdo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “And the extensive teaching” is the characteristic of a sutra of interpretable meaning and a sutra of definitive meaning.

original: 'di ltar mdo las @215a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las @215a * //
translated: Thus, a sutra says:

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo ni gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a sutra of interpretable meaning?

original: mdo gang las kun rdzob gsungs pa 'di ni drang ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: mdo gang las kun rdzob gsungs pa 'di ni drang ba'i don yin no //
translated: A sutra that teaches the conventional is of interpretable meaning.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo gang zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sutra of definitive meaning?

original: mdo gang las don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa 'di ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdo gang las don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa 'di ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: A sutra that teaches the ultimate truth is of definitive meaning.

original: mdo gang nas tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: mdo gang nas tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
translated: A sutra that teaches in various words and letters is of interpretable meaning.

original: mdo gang zab pa blta bar dka' ba khong du chud par dka' bar gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: mdo gang zab pa blta bar dka' ba khong du chud par dka' bar gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don yin la /
translated: A sutra that teaches the profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, is of definitive meaning.

original: mdo gang bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba po dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po'i sgra dang / skad sna tshogs pa bdag po med pa la bdag po yod pa bzhin du gsungs pa ni drang ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: mdo gang bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba po dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po'i sgra dang / skad sna tshogs pa bdag po med pa la bdag po yod pa bzhin du gsungs pa ni drang ba'i don yin la /
translated: Those sūtras that teach various terms such as self, sentient being, life, nourisher, human, person, human born of Manu, child of Manu, agent, and experiencer, as if they refer to a self that does not exist, are provisional.

original: mdo gang las stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
analyzed: mdo gang las stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
translated: Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-composition, non-arising, non-birth, non-entity, non-sentience,

original: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: non-life, non-person, non-self, and the three doors of liberation are definitive.

original: phyogs tsam zhig ni brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i don du phyogs tsam brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig ni brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i don du phyogs tsam brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A mere portion will be stated means that a mere portion will be stated for the purpose of teaching the division of the sūtras of provisional and definitive meaning.

original: de yang ngo bo gsum bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par nus pas kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo gsum bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par nus pas kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, since that can be taught by means of teaching the three natures, the teaching of the division of the imagined, dependent, and thoroughly established is:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, etc. is stated.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i bya ba'i khyad par dang thag pa la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni lag pa'i bya ba'i khyad par dang thag pa la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: In dependence on the particular action of the hand and the rope, arising means arising in dependence.

original: thag pa bsdogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khyil ba'i rnam pa yin pas so //
analyzed: thag pa bsdogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khyil ba'i rnam pa yin pas so //
translated: The rope coiled means it is in the form of a coil.

original: brtags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis de la sbrul med pas so //
analyzed: brtags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis de la sbrul med pas so //
translated: It is imagined means that by worldly convention, since the snake does not exist there.

original: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis sbrul dngos su yod pas so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis sbrul dngos su yod pas so //
translated: The so-called “perfected” is the snake that is actually present by worldly convention.

original: de la dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example and to apply it to the meaning, he says:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the imagined is the form, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs dang sems la sogs @215b pa ni gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs dang sems la sogs @215b pa ni gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The so-called “other-dependent” is form, mind, etc., because they operate by the power of causes and conditions.

original: kun tu brtags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sems la sogs pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes rang bzhin gang brtags pa de ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sems la sogs pa don dam par yod pa yin no zhes rang bzhin gang brtags pa de ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: The so-called “imagined” is the nature that is imagined, i.e., “form, mind, etc. exist ultimately.”

original: de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las khungs ston pa ni /🔽rang bzhin dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las khungs ston pa ni / rang bzhin dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, the source in the Wisdom of the Middle Way is🔽The imagined is the nature of what is other-dependent.

original: 'di'i don ni rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: One’s own entity is one’s nature.

original: dngos po gang gi gnyug ma'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang gi gnyug ma'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of a thing is its nature.

original: gang gang gi bdag gi ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gang gi bdag gi ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is its property?

original: gang bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not artificial.

original: gang bcos ma ma yin pa de ni bdag gi ba yin te /
analyzed: gang bcos ma ma yin pa de ni bdag gi ba yin te /
translated: That which is not artificial is its property,

original: dper na chu'i dro ba nyid bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na chu'i dro ba nyid bzhin no /
translated: like the heat of water.

original: yang gang gang gi dbang du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba yin te /
analyzed: yang gang gang gi dbang du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is dependent is its property,

original: dper na rang gi bran dang rgyal po'i blas bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang gi bran dang rgyal po'i blas bzhin no //
translated: like a slave or a king’s servant.

original: gang gang gi gzhan dbang du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gang gi gzhan dbang du gyur pa de ni de'i bdag gi ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not dependent is not its property,

original: dper na dus ji srid cig tu g-yar ba'i rang mi dbang ba'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dus ji srid cig tu g-yar ba'i rang mi dbang ba'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: like a thing that is borrowed for a certain time and does not belong to anyone.

original: gang gi phyir bcos ma dang gzhan la ltos pa la rang bzhin 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir me'i dro ba nyid rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa dang / sngar ma byung ba phyis skyes pa'i phyir byas pa yin pas rang bzhin yod pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcos ma dang gzhan la ltos pa la rang bzhin 'dod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir me'i dro ba nyid rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa dang / sngar ma byung ba phyis skyes pa'i phyir byas pa yin pas rang bzhin yod pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because we do not assert that essence is fabricated or dependent on another, therefore, since the heat of fire depends on causes and conditions and since it is produced, having not existed previously, it is not tenable that it exists essentially.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir me las dus gsum char du yang mi 'khrul bar gnyug mar gnas pa bcos ma ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir me las dus gsum char du yang mi 'khrul bar gnyug mar gnas pa bcos ma ma yin pa /
translated: Because that is the case, therefore, that which is not fabricated, not dependent on another,

original: sngar ma byung ba ma yin pa gang rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa med pa chu'i dro ba nyid dang / pha rol tshu rol dang / ring ba dang / thung ngu la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la ltos pa med pa la rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba ma yin pa gang rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa med pa chu'i dro ba nyid dang / pha rol tshu rol dang / ring ba dang / thung ngu la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la ltos pa med pa la rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and not arisen from causes and conditions, like the heat of water, this side and that side, long and short, and so on, which is not dependent on another, should be called essence.

original: ci me la de lta bu'i rang bzhin yod dam /
analyzed: ci me la de lta bu'i rang bzhin yod dam /
translated: Does fire have such an essence?

original: rang bzhin yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist essentially, nor does it not exist essentially.

original: de ltar yin na yang nyan pa po rnams la skrag pa spang ba'i don du kun rdzob tu sgro btags nas de yod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang nyan pa po rnams la skrag pa spang ba'i don du kun rdzob tu sgro btags nas de yod do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in order to eliminate the fear of the listeners, it is said that it exists, having been verbally fabricated in a conventional sense.🔽Thus, it is said, “The Dharma is without letters, etc.”

original: de ltar yang yi ge med pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yang yi ge med pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las kyang /
translated: And in the Wisdom at the Root of the Middle Way, it is said:

original: stong nyid ces kyang brjod mi bya //
analyzed: stong nyid ces kyang brjod mi bya //
translated: It is not to be said that it is empty,

original: mi stong zhes kyang brjod mi bya //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang brjod mi bya //
translated: Nor is it to be said that it is not empty.

original: gnyis ka gnyis min zhes mi brjod //🔽tha snyad tsam du brjod par bya //
analyzed: gnyis ka gnyis min zhes mi brjod // tha snyad tsam du brjod par bya //
translated: It is not to be said that it is both, nor that it is neither.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is to be said only conventionally.

original: gal te sgro btags nas yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgro btags nas yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it does not exist, having been verbally fabricated, how is it?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The reality of phenomena is the nature of that.

original: @216a * // 'o na chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: @216a * // 'o na chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi gshis so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gshis so //
translated: The basic nature of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi gshis gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gshis gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basic nature of phenomena?

original: ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence.

original: ngo bo de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid de gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de gang zhe na /
translated: What is emptiness?

original: rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The absence of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of intrinsic nature?

original: de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is suchness?

original: de bzhin nyid du yod pa dang / mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / dus rtag tu gnas pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du me la sogs pa'i skye ba med pa nyid gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du yod pa dang / mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / dus rtag tu gnas pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad du me la sogs pa'i skye ba med pa nyid gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is the existence of suchness, the unchanging, the constant abiding of reality, the non-arising of all aspects, such as fire, and so on, which is not dependent on another and is not fabricated. Therefore, it should be called intrinsic nature.

original: 'di'i don ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi nus pas dmigs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib spangs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la gang gis bdag nyid ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis phul nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de rnams kyi rang bzhi
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi nus pas dmigs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs rnams ma rig pa'i rab rib spangs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la gang gis bdag nyid ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis phul nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de rnams kyi rang bzhi
translated: The meaning of this is that the collection of things that are perceived through the power of the eye disease of ignorance are suchness for the noble ones who have abandoned the eye disease of ignorance. That intrinsic nature which is not seen by them in the manner of an object is their intrinsic nature.

original: nyin no zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: nyin no zhes rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: This is the presentation.

original: de'i rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang ; / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dag ni bcos min dang ; / gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: zhes slob dpon 'di rnams kyis mtshan nyid rnam bzhag mdzad pa yin no zhes rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon 'di rnams kyis mtshan nyid rnam bzhag mdzad pa yin no zhes rigs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these masters present the characteristics in this way.

original: dngos po rnams kyis skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin de yang ci'i ngo bor ma grub pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir dngos po la rang bzhin yod pa🔽ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin de yang ci'i ngo bor ma grub pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir dngos po la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That intrinsic nature of things which is devoid of arising is just the intrinsic nature of mere essencelessness, since it is not established as any kind of entity. Therefore one should say that things do not have intrinsic nature.

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rang bzhin gang brtags pa de ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa rnams la gzugs la sogs pa nyid du rang bzhin gang brtags pa de ni kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: Thus, that intrinsic nature which is imputed to forms and so on as their form and so forth is an imaginary nature.

original: gzung bzhin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzung bzhin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the line “that which is apprehended and that which apprehends,”

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byas pa can zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byas pa can zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: dependent origination that is produced is called “form and so on.”

original: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'thad pas so //
translated: “Like a reflection” means that it is not tenable, as stated in “not from itself,” and so on.

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: “Imagined” means imagined to exist essentially.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la ni dngos po yin te zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nas ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la ni dngos po yin te zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nas ma skyes pa'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In the domain of the buddhas, it is a thing” means that the non-arisen thing is apprehended by the buddhas, the transcendent lords, in the manner of not seeing.

original: kun tu ma brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcos ma'i dngos po la rang bzhin kun tu ma brtags pas so //
analyzed: kun tu ma brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcos ma'i dngos po la rang bzhin kun tu ma brtags pas so //
translated: “Because it is not imagined” means that the essence is not imagined in a fabricated thing.

original: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: dngos po byas pa @216b can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po byas pa @216b can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “A fabricated thing,” and so on.

original: ma rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa der mi snang bas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa der mi snang bas so //
translated: “Due to ignorance” means that it does not appear as such to forms and so on.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The so-called “nature” is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: mngon sum du mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mngon sum du mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “By realizing” means by the method of non-apprehension.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can de kho na nyid do //
translated: “Thatness” is thatness characterized by non-arising.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the conclusion, he says

original: de'i phyir zhes bya la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Therefore, having understood the system of the Sūtra’s meaning, the Sūtra’s intention should be explained.”

original: rnam par gzhag pa rtogs par byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa rtogs par byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “Having understood the system” means by the method taught above.

original: mdo'i dgongs pa rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i mdo'i don bshad par bya'o ;
analyzed: mdo'i dgongs pa rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drang ba dang nges pa'i mdo'i don bshad par bya'o ;
translated: “The Sūtra’s intention should be explained” means the meaning of the Sūtra, which is interpretable and definitive, should be explained.

original: /'di lta ste kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don la brten nas mdo gang gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: /'di lta ste kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don la brten nas mdo gang gsungs pa de ni drang ba'i don yin la /
translated: That is to say, the Sūtra that is taught in dependence on the meaning of the imagined and the other-dependent is interpretable in meaning.

original: gang yongs su grub pa'i don la brten nas gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang yongs su grub pa'i don la brten nas gsungs pa de ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: That which is taught in dependence on the meaning of the perfected is definitive in meaning.

original: da ni sems tsam du smra ba'i 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas kun brtags kyi rnam gzhag rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems tsam du smra ba'i 'dod pa'i dbang du byas nas kun brtags kyi rnam gzhag rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is illogical to posit the imagined in terms of the assertions of the Cittamatrins,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The duality of the grasped and the grasper,” and so on.🔽Since there is no entity apart from the dependent,

original: gzhan gyi dbang las ma gtogs par dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ltar na ni rang bzhin yongs su grub pa la yod pas gzugs dang sems la sogs pa byas pa can la rang bzhin de brtags pa🔽yin na kun brtags rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang las ma gtogs par dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa ltar na ni rang bzhin yongs su grub pa la yod pas gzugs dang sems la sogs pa byas pa can la rang bzhin de brtags pa yin na kun brtags rigs pa yin la /
translated: just as we assert that the perfected exists, since it is the nature of form, mind, and so on, it is logical to impute that nature to that which is fabricated,

original: khyod kyi ltar na gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang las ma gtogs par gzhan du dngos su yod pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khyod kyi ltar na gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang las ma gtogs par gzhan du dngos su yod pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: but according to you, since the duality of the grasped and the grasper does not exist as a real entity apart from the dependent,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kun tu brtags par mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag kun tu brtags par mi rigs pa'o //
translated: it is illogical to impute the duality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gnyis so //
translated: The two are the grasped and the grasper.

original: spros pas chog go zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra bzhar la 'ongs pa des chog go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: spros pas chog go zhes bya ba ni sems tsam du smra bzhar la 'ongs pa des chog go zhes pa'o //
translated: Enough of this elaboration! means Enough of this coming forth of the proponents of mind-only!

original: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dgag pa nyid do //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dgag pa nyid do //
translated: The simple is to be explained, means the negation of arising.

original: gnyis ka las skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to negate arising from both,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Therefore, etc.

original: gnyis ka las skye ba'ang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan las so //
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye ba'ang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan las so //
translated: Arising from both means from self and other.

original: rigs pa'i ngo bo ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i ngo bo ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not reasonable means it is not tenable.

original: de dam bca' ba tsam yin pas de'i gtan tshigs ston pa ni /
analyzed: de dam bca' ba tsam yin pas de'i gtan tshigs ston pa ni /
translated: Since that is merely a thesis, he shows its reason:

original: bshad zin nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @217a * //
analyzed: bshad zin nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa @217a * //
translated: The faults already explained, etc.

original: ste ; gang gi phyir bdag las skye ba'i phyogs dang gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa de dag gnyis ka las skye bar 'dod pa la thog tu 'bab pa yin pas de'i phyir gnyis ka las skye ba mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ste ; gang gi phyir bdag las skye ba'i phyogs dang gzhan las skye ba'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa de dag gnyis ka las skye bar 'dod pa la thog tu 'bab pa yin pas de'i phyir gnyis ka las skye ba mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Because whatever faults are stated in the position of arising from self and in the position of arising from another, they apply to the assertion of arising from both. Therefore, arising from both is not tenable.

original: de 'grel pas ston pa las dang por gcer bu pas brjod pa'i gnyis ka las skye ba 'gog pa'i phyogs snga ma ston pa ni /
analyzed: de 'grel pas ston pa las dang por gcer bu pas brjod pa'i gnyis ka las skye ba 'gog pa'i phyogs snga ma ston pa ni /
translated: The Commentary teaches this. First, it shows the opponent’s position, the refutation of arising from both as stated by the Jains:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to that, the proponents of both say:

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la skye ba 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka la skye ba 'gog pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: With regard to that means with regard to the context of the refutation of arising from both.

original: tshig gal gnyis su smra ba rnams ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhing thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshig gnyis su smra ba ste gcer bu pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshig gal gnyis su smra ba rnams ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin zhing thams cad thams cad kyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshig gnyis su smra ba ste gcer bu pa rnams so //
translated: The proponents of both say means the Jains, who say that everything is the nature of everything and that everything is not the nature of everything.

original: gnyis ka las skye ba'i tshul rgyas par ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye ba'i tshul rgyas par ston pa ni /
translated: The extensive teaching of the mode of arising from both:

original: de la 'jim pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'jim pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To that, he says, “Clay, etc.,”

original: skud pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'jim pa'i gong bu las bum pa so sor byed pa'o //
analyzed: skud pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'jim pa'i gong bu las bum pa so sor byed pa'o //
translated: “Thread” is that by which a pot is made from a lump of clay.

original: dbyu gu zhes pa ni gang gis 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu zhes pa ni gang gis 'khor lo skor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Stick” is that by which a wheel is made.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lag pa'i bya ba bsdu bar bya'o //🔽de la rang las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lag pa'i bya ba bsdu bar bya'o // de la rang las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The word “etc.” includes the activity of the hands.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽gzhan las skye ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // gzhan las skye ba ston pa ni /
translated: To show arising from itself, he says, “Because,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir rdza mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams gnyis ka las skye bar brjod nas nang gi dngos po rnams kyang gnyis ka las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdza mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams gnyis ka las skye bar brjod nas nang gi dngos po rnams kyang gnyis ka las skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To show arising from another, he says, “Because,” etc.

original: phyi rol gyi dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, having stated that external things arise from both, to show that internal things also arise from both, he says, “External things,” etc.

original: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To show that in detail, he says,🔽“Because,” etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The root text declares, What is called life force...

original: srog ces bya ba ni 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Life force refers to that which goes from here to the next world.

original: srog ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is not life force refers to the faculties and so on.

original: bsod nams dang sdig pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag go //
analyzed: bsod nams dang sdig pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag go //
translated: Merit and sin refers to virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Contaminated refers to the afflictions such as attachment.

original: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa lta bu'o //
translated: Vows refers to vows such as those of a fully ordained monk or nun.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: And so on includes nonvows and so on.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag las skye ba'i gcig pu 'gegs pa dang / gzhan las skye ba'i gcig pu 'gegs @217b pa'o ;
analyzed: kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag las skye ba'i gcig pu 'gegs pa dang / gzhan las skye ba'i gcig pu 'gegs @217b pa'o ;
translated: We do not commit the error of saying It is not so because we refute arising from self and arising from another.

original: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain the response to that, the root text says:

original: rtsod pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “This argument” and so on.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka las skye bar smra ba yang ngo //🔽phyi rol gyi dngos po rang las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka las skye bar smra ba yang ngo // phyi rol gyi dngos po rang las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “This” refers to the assertion of arising from both.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;🔽/ nang gi dngos po rang las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ; / nang gi dngos po rang las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error in the position that external things arise from themselves, he says “because” and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽phyi rol gyi dngos po gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon ston pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // phyi rol gyi dngos po gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon ston pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error in the position that internal things arise from themselves, he says “in the same way” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽nang gi dngos po gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa 'gegs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // nang gi dngos po gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa 'gegs pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error in the position that external things arise from another, he says “because” and so on.

original: pha dang ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pha dang ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute the position that internal things arise from another, he says “father, mother, and so on” and so on.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conclusion, he says “Therefore” and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning “In that regard” indicates that.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu bdag las skye ba bkag pa ni 'jig rten gyis kyang 'di dag gcig nyid du ni khas mi len zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu bdag las skye ba bkag pa ni 'jig rten gyis kyang 'di dag gcig nyid du ni khas mi len zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: In that regard, the refutation of arising from self in the conventional reality of the world is presented in the lines beginning “The world does not accept that things arise from themselves.”

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu gzhan las skye ba bkag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sa bon tsam zhig blugs par gyur nas /🔽nga yi bu 'dis bskyed ces smra byed pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu gzhan las skye ba bkag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sa bon tsam zhig blugs par gyur nas /🔽nga yi bu 'dis bskyed ces smra byed pas //
translated: The refutation of arising from other in the conventional reality of the world is presented in the lines beginning “When a seed is sown in the ground.”🔽The lines beginning “The world says ‘This is produced by that’” present the refutation of arising from other in the ultimate reality of reasoning.
